title: Senior UI/UX Product Designer (Remote, Work from Home available)
description:
Description

At Humana’s Experience Center (XC), we are explorers, listeners, creators, and thinkers working together to influence the ways that people care for themselves and one another. We are seeking individuals who are passionate about solving big problems in healthcare for seniors, with experience in understanding consumers’ underlying needs and how to go about addressing them. Above all... else, we are human-centered, kind and respectful, and always looking to understand and support our members. Come help us redefine the future of healthcare.

Responsibilities

An XC Product Designer is…

Human-centered – They put people at the center of everything they do, always seeking to deeply understand and empathize with them in the entire context of their lives. The designer advocates for the user’s needs with peers, facilitates user research on a regular basis, and continuously delivers based on evidence-backed insights in order to ensure products and services fit the user need.

Strategic - They strive for experiences that are desirable for members, viable for the business, and operationally and technically feasible. They look to best practices and methods in order to uncover real member needs and to synthesize insights from research and data. They understand and practice the design processes across the product lifecycle. Additionally, the designer develops a full-stack skillset, ensuring that the visual interaction design complements the user research findings.

Collaborative – They are a humble and generous contributor to a cross-functional team. They recognize and respect the deep expertise of others, helping the team move forward. The designer participates in the team’s rituals, facilitates user research activities, and serves as part of a design pair. They are a fast learner and are willing to adapt to the product design needs and processes.

A Storyteller – They are a communicator and presents research to colleagues and stakeholders. They are able to thoughtfully discuss and justify design decisions, give honest effective feedback to others, and leverage their communication techniques.

Key Responsibilities

The Senior Product Designer is an individual contributor, who works within a cross-functional team to create and drive the delivery of both virtual and in-person experiences that are impactful for our members and measurable for the business.
• Facilitate the design process over the course of a product lifecycle, working effectively as part of a design pair and advocating for the user’s perspective.
• Within a design pair, develop the assets necessary for product success, which include, but are not limited to, the following: research discussion guides, screeners, research insights, remote tests, and the resulting research reports.
• Develop the design assets that include, but are not limited to, the following: customer journeys, user flows, sitemaps, research plans, paper prototypes, sketches, wireframes, visual designs, clickthrough prototypes
• Advocate for the user based on user research insights, product ambition, value proposition, and technical feasibility.
• Uncover user needs in order to craft how users will interact with our products / services.
• Co-create with both XC team members and our internal stakeholders to understand user and business needs, identify design opportunities, and create meaningful experiences.
• Be a great storyteller by preparing product demos and engaging stakeholders with design decisions.
• Contribute to the continuous development of the design discipline.

Working together, we will:
• Have specific opportunities to make healthcare better for our members, transform the future of care today, while working to build and deliver technology.
• Engage in ongoing activities that enable us to learn, practice, and evolve design to integrate it into a more agile and efficient process.
• Collaborate on products and services that change the way our members enroll, seek, and establish care.

Set yourself apart:
• Ability to support and teach fellow designers through design pairing, design critiques, and general ways of working.
• A strong portfolio demonstrating a full understanding of the end-to-end design process.
• Extensive experience with Figma, Sketch, Adobe Creative Suite. Ability to learn new software quickly a plus.
• Experience with applying user-centered design processes.
• Understanding of areas of specialization within the greater design landscape, including but not limited to Design Research, Visual Design, Service Design, UI / UX Design, and Product Design; willingness to broaden own skillset into adjacent specializations while refining mastery of primary skillset.
• Ability to create design assets (e.g., customer journeys, flows, prototypes, visual designs, etc.).
• Extensive knowledge of rapid prototyping methods, ranging from paper sketching to digital prototypes.
• HTML / CSS / JS skills are a plus.
• Strong communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.

Your experience:
• 3 – 6 years of relevant industry experience
• Bachelor’s design degree or equivalent experience in a related field
• Demonstrated experience working in UX, Visual Design, or IA within multiple cross-discipline teams (both technology and design)

Additional Information

Humana and its subsidiaries require vaccinated associates who work outside of their home to submit proof of vaccination, including COVID-19 boosters. Associates who remain unvaccinated must either undergo weekly negative COVID testing OR wear a mask at all times while in a Humana facility or while working in the field.

Work-At-Home Requirements
• WAH requirements: Must have the ability to provide a high speed DSL or cable modem for a home office. Associates or contractors who live and work from home in the state of California will be provided payment for their internet expense.
• A minimum standard speed for optimal performance of 25x10 (25mpbs download x 10mpbs upload) is required.
• Satellite and Wireless Internet service is NOT allowed for this role.
• A dedicated space lacking ongoing interruptions to protect member PHI / HIPAA information

Scheduled Weekly Hours

40

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
Your purpose:

You will be responsible for designing user interfaces and visuals to enhance the user experience for our SaaS platform. This role will create end-to-end experiences that turn complex problems and workflows into intuitive and elegant interfaces. Ultimately, you will make our product more user-friendly and intuitive for our users...

This role will report to our Director of Design. The job is located in Boston, MA.

Who You Are:

You’re an individual with close attention to detail and a strong understanding of the product's user experience. You care about the product's impact on their relationship with use and their own business. You can build toward achieving that vision by using data and interviewing users to inform your work and decisions; collaborating with team members to provide the best user experience fuels you to get to our professional and team goals.

This position requires activities that are subject to US Export Control Laws and require US Citizenship or Green Card Holder.

Responsibilities
• Develop wireframes, interactive prototypes, and high-fidelity interfaces around customer needs
• Work alongside designers, engineers, and product managers to ensure we’re solving problems for our users the right way.
• Utilize and contribute to our design system and component library
• Use research and data to inform design decisions
• Partner with Engineering to ensure that our implementation and user experience are high-quality
• As part of the Paperless Parts team, further, the company-wide DEI & social impact initiates

Knowledge, Skill, and Abilities
• 2+ years of experience designing for SaaS or digital products in a software product company
• Solid understanding of how to build intuitive, user-first designs
• Experience working with and building on a design/component library
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills
• A UX/UI Design portfolio is required
• Travel to customers as needed; vaccination required

title: Entry Level UX Design- Northeast
description:
Welcome to Avanade Experiences, where the best in creative and technology mix it up to push the boundaries of innovation. We're a fast-moving, big-idea-dreaming, mishmash of designers, UX architects, technologists, delivery experts, writers, and more, who, when brought together, create trans formative digital experiences for some of the biggest and best brands on the planet. Sound like a place... you wouldn't mind hanging your hat? Great, in North America you can find us in Atlanta, Chicago, Houston, Los Angeles, NYC, Raleigh, Seattle, and Toronto.

About the Role:

The UX Design team stands out for its lively creativity and flawless style. It translates users' needs, business objectives and technology capabilities from concept to delivery with exceptional attention to detail. It aims to craft an alluring experience that skillfully incorporates the voice of the end user.

As a UX Design Analyst, you would assist with customer engagements and create UX/creative transformation deliverables on projects. You would be working within the design team to assist in workshops to gather stakeholder and end user goals using a pool of techniques to help break down barriers, communicate better and generate new ideas. You would be assisting in the creation of compelling wireframes that illustrate a best-in-class experience for our clients, and artfully test those ideas by participating in user testing.

What you'll do:

Work with our design and UX leads to create compelling user experiences
Support UX discovery via workshops & design thinking methods

Create low to high fidelity wireframes to illustrate the recommended experience
Participate in the creation of journey maps, user flows and personas
Learn the end-to-end process from project kick-off to delivery handoff
Understand how to design within different platforms/technologies

We think boldly and inclusively. We experiment with new approaches and expect some to fail. We like solving hard problems. We remove barriers to entry so we can expand our talent pools and provide more opportunities for all to thrive at Avanade. Together, we will position Avanade as an award-winning destination for top talent, that is future ready and truly diverse.

Academic requirements:

Bachelor's degree in Human Factors, Human Computer Interaction, Psychology, or a similar field of study

About you:

Some experience in UX design
Demonstrate a growth mindset with knowledge of UX design capabilities and strategies. You have knowledge of UX disciplines such as:

UX research methods
information architecture
usability testing

Wireframing
Prototyping

Great communicator with an eagerness to work within a team
Creative mind and collaborative spirit
Knowledge of design disciplines including principles of UI design, layouts, graphics development, typography, color, and visual theories

Functional knowledge of UX design tools such as Figma, Sketch, InVision, Adobe XD

What we offer you:

Our Early Talent program offers distinctive experiences through limitless learning opportunities that encourage you to master Microsoft and pursue big ideas and ambitious growth for yourself as part of Avanade's people-first culture. We value you and plan to stay committed by offering competitive pay and benefits, flexible work arrangements, and a commitment to diversity and inclusion.

Avanade requires all new hires to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment. Avanade will consider requests for medical or religious accommodation to this vaccination requirement on an individual basis.

Applicants for employment in the US/Canada must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States/Canada

Avanade(R) Is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Avanade prohibits discrimination and harassment against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, age, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, veteran, military or marital status, genetic information, or any other protected status

title: Sr UI/UX Designer
description:
EBSCO Information Services (EIS) provides a complete and optimized research solution comprised of e-journals, e-books, and research databases - all combined with the most powerful discovery service to support the information needs and maximize the research experience of our end-users. Headquartered in Ipswich, MA, EIS employs more than 2,700 people worldwide, most now working hybrid or remotely... We are the leader in our field due to our cutting-edge technology, forward-thinking philosophy, and outstanding team. EIS is a company that will motivate you, inspire you, and allow you to grow. Our mission is to transform lives by providing relevant and reliable information when, where, and how people need it. We are looking for bright and creative individuals whose unique differences will allow us to achieve this inclusive mission around the world.

EBSCO Information Technologies is looking for design talent. The Senior UI/UX Designer is an active leader on the User Experience team well-versed in the collaborative design process and capable of bringing innovative ideas from concept to code. You’ll be a key part of strategic initiatives and responsible for crafting best-in-class experiences and interfaces.

About the team

We are a multidisciplinary UX team made up of talented designers and researchers who focus on a wide variety of EBSCO products. We service numerous product and development teams across the organization helping the business achieve its goals.

About the role

Your mission as the Senior UI/UX Designer will be to drive design quality on each and every project, while simultaneously advancing design standards for EBSCO’s products and platforms. You will work on a variety of projects that include internal and external facing web applications, and mobile applications.

The ideal candidate will have a passion for exceptional design and a portfolio to match. We’re looking for a user-focused individual who can communicate ideas through sketches, prototypes, detailed mockups or code.

You will develop visual concepts (i.e. sketches, wireframes, high fidelity concepts, interactive prototypes and designs system components) to feed user research, long-range plans, capabilities and features to be executed by agile development teams.
• Be able to solve complex scenarios with elegant and compelling design patterns.
• Experience communicating in different levels of fidelity, anywhere from sketching to HTML/CSS.
• Utilize storytelling in your design process to frame the problem space, justify design direction and establish measurement framework.
• Show strong ability to present to different audiences across the organization.
• Collaborate with internal stakeholders and UX team members to brainstorm new, forward-thinking, features and functionalities.
• Assist business stakeholders, and product management in planning design resources with a goal of providing consistent and reliable estimates for design tasks.
• Work closely with the development teams to build and polish your design vision.
• Champion a common design process and help maintain design standards in our centralized library of design elements and visual language.
• Continue to build and advance EBSCO’s design system.
• Be effective throughout the entire product development process, from problem definition to detailed UI and visual design

Please include an online portfolio when applying.

What you should have
• A strong online portfolio, displaying a foundation in Typography, Interaction and Visual Design, and Ideation.
• Solid understanding of building usable, accessible, and modular designs that can scale to millions of users.
• 7+ years as an individual contributor role within a UX team or equivalent.
• Have shipped products and features. Not just designed a website.
• Experience with design systems and component libraries
• Must have an online portfolio.

Preferred Qualifications
• Expert-level skills in design software (Figma, Sketch, Adobe Creative Cloud, etc.)
• Familiarity with HTML and CSS. (Advanced coding skills is a plus.)
• Familiarity with a multitude of User Research methodologies and experience working from research findings.
• An understanding of accessibility standards
• Experience working with distributed teams and understand the sensibilities and responsibility that come with it.
• Degree in a relevant field (HCI, Graphic Design, Interaction Design, etc.)
• Ability to work on multiple projects and be self-directed in daily tasks
• Demonstrated creativity and innovation
• Solid oral, written and listening communication skills

The position reports into the Design Manager within the User Experience Design team.

Target Annual Salary Range: $99,495 - $142,135 This Pay Target range includes a bonus target of 5% of base salary. The actual salary offer will carefully consider a wide range of factors including your skills, qualifications, education, training, and experience, as well as the position’s work location. EBSCO provides a generous benefits program including medical, dental, vision, life and disability insurance, flexible spending accounts, a retirement savings plan, paid parental leave, holidays and paid time off (PTO), as well as tuition reimbursement. View more about EBSCO’s benefits here: https://www.ebsco.com/about/benefits

We are an equal opportunity employer and comply with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. We strictly prohibit and do not tolerate discrimination against employees, applicants, or any other covered persons because of race, color, sex, pregnancy status, age, national origin or ancestry, ethnicity, religion, creed, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, training, promotion, discipline, compensation, benefits, and termination of employment. We comply with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), as amended by the ADA Amendments Act, and all applicable state or local law

title: UI/UX Design Architect
description:
Position:
UI/UX Design Architect
Job Description...

Do you have endless curiosity about how people use technology? We are looking for an enthusiastic User Experience (UX) person to join a team of passionate professionals obsessed with quality, usability, and simplicity. We are expecting intuitive, innovative, and beautiful human experiences led by data-driven processes.

Arrow Electronics, Inc is a Fortune 104 company that helps the world’s best technology companies think Five Years Out and work together to innovate. We are a global provider of technology products, services, and solutions, with 2021 sales of $30 billion. Arrow Electronics is currently seeking a UI/UX Design Architect to work in our SiliconExpert subsidiary.

The UX team includes a wide range of disciplines including design, interaction, research, code development and analytics. We're organized across multi-disciplinary teams where designers and developers tightly collaborate in exploring, crafting, and validating the user/customer experience. You'll have regular interactions with stakeholders and be capable of being a UX lead for a project team. You are a proactive thinker and eager to learn new skills to develop your career and increase the value of our products. You are comfortable working in an Agile environment as well as other Methodologies, such as Kanban and FDD.

The ideal candidate follows design patterns and innovates using UX best practices, a team player and collaborator, as well as having an analytical mind for approaching solving UX problems logically. We are looking for someone who is excited about being part of a team of learners, constantly contributing to the team's collective growth and success. They will be strong in visual design, front-end engineering technologies, knowledgeable on the latest trends and innovations in UI/UX, a deep understanding of WCAG and 508 accessible compliance, and has experience with research and analytics tools. You should have a strong technical background in interaction design methodologies and implementations.

Work You'll Do
• Innovate and mentor, as well as an openness to new learning, nurturing ideas and growing new skills in the UX sphere
• Assist in solving all sorts of design challenges with creativity, efficiency and precision
• Full stack design skills (interaction, usability, graphic design, html, CSS, SEO, Analytics, A/B testing, UX Research, etc.)
• Easily Create wireframes and review user journeys
• Create and enhance user personas
• Ensure projects are completed according to established specifications and are properly documented throughout the project life cycle.
• Develop and report on KPIs for tracking digital creative team contribution to revenue and overall company performance
• Lead discussions and reviews of creative digital strategy deliverables with stakeholders
• Proactive thinking and eager to move out of comfort zone in order to develop your career and move the company forward

Required Qualifications
• Experience in designing supply chain applications and platform highly desirable
• Experience in B2C applications a must have
• Self-starter and team player, with strong technical and personal leadership skills
• Must be comfortable working on multiple projects across different domains simultaneously
• Deep understanding of information architecture and software interaction design principles
• 10+ years of proven track record working in a UI/UX design-focused role
• 10+ years professional experience in software interaction design and implementation

As the Lead role of our multi-disciplined UX team, we desire for an applicant to also possess many of these skills.

Desired Qualifications
• A complete mastery of interaction design and prototyping processes
• A complete mastery of identity and brand development
• Deep understanding of limitations and functions of the DOM, including HTML, CSS, and JS
• Highly proficient in communicating ideas using whatever tool necessary
• Advanced understanding of user experience research methodologies and principles
• Superior knowledge of Accessible responsive web design and development

EDUCATION

Typically requires a minimum of 14 years of related experience with a 4 year degree; or 12 years and an advanced degree; or equivalent experience.

About SiliconExpert

Since 2000, SiliconExpert helps you make better data-driven decisions with a human-driven experience. Over 500 electrical, software and data engineers handcraft our component database of more than one billion parts to deliver the most comprehensive and current tools in the industry. Customers globally use our solutions to manage risk, avoid redesigns, and mitigate obsolescence in innovative industries such as consumer electronics, telecommunications, automotive, medical and aerospace. SiliconExpert's customers include: leading commercial and government OEMs, top-tier authorized distributors, contract manufacturers and component suppliers. Whether it’s a design engineer or financial expert, supply chain management or procurement manager, SiliconExpert is a complete components data intelligence solution for organizational alignment, efficiency, collaboration, and optimization.

$117,900.00 - $175,450.00

Actual compensation offer to candidate may vary from posted hiring range based upon geographic location, work experience, education, and/or skill level. The pay ratio between base pay and target incentive (if applicable) will be finalized at offer.

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Title: UI/UX Designer

Duration: 6 + Months...

Location: Boston, MA highly preferred, but remote also ok.

Are you a UI/UX designer who believes that great application design has the power to improve people's lives? The ADI Medical Products group is seeking a designer to join us on the software product team. We're looking for an innately curious teammate with deep experience in the principles of design, and a demonstrated ability to deliver intuitive user experiences and excellent application design in a medical/healthcare domain. Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) is a global leader in the design and manufacture of semiconductor products. Our team uses ADI's technology to create Client hardware and software health technology products that we believe will solve real-world problems for patients facing life-altering diagnoses. We're a diverse group of folks from many backgrounds, with a shared commitment to making a difference through our work.

The UI/UX designer will:
• Provide the design artifacts for stories in the product backlog, and clarification on design and styling to developers.
• Participate in demos and user acceptance testing.
• Attend daily stand-ups and other scrum ceremonies, as a key member of the software product team.
• Work with product teammates to establish, track, and execute design-relevant quarterly goals.'
• Create a design process methodology to help make sure artifacts and deliverables are standardized, organized and available.
• Guide the team on the implementation of UX research techniques; help the team use data analytics to evaluate performance and usability.
• Collaborate with software product teammates and other stakeholders in discovery and planning activities. Conceptualize features, map user journeys, build personas, lead user story workshops, and define requirements.
• Interview representative users and stakeholders to establish user needs. Incorporate feedback and findings into designs.
• Monitor user experience and review user feedback to determine improvements needed.
• Take responsibility for the look and feel of new and redesigned software products.
• Present proposed design solutions to senior stakeholders with polish and comfort in spoken, written, and visual formats.

Expected Experience and Skills
• 4-10 years' design experience with some of that on a medical/health product
• A degree in graphic design, visual design, human-computer interaction, or related field and/or relevant experience
• A portfolio that shows the ability to create attractive, user-friendly, efficient experiences
• Expertise with standard design tools (InVision, Figma, Sketch, Illustrator etc.)
• Technical skills, e.g., UX research, wireframing, prototyping, interaction design, visual communication, information architecture
• Excellent written and spoken communication skills; highly attentive to detail
• Able to share information effectively.
• Demonstrable experience working with product management
• Comfort working on a diverse team with local and distributed teammates
• Able to establish credibility and relationships with stakeholders throughout the business
• Knowledge of, and comfort with, general principles of the SDLC
• Strong problem solving and analytical design skills
• Able to validate concepts at various levels of fidelity throughout the design process, from wireframes to fully visualized prototypes

Nice-to-Have Experience and Skills
• Able to render designs in HTML, JS, CSS
• Highly motivated to explore new opportunities and raise the bar
• Experience writing copy for web interfaces (microcopy)
• Experience designing mobile apps, mobile interfaces, responsive web
• Experience designing products for patients to use at home
• Experience with wearable solutions for health management
• Familiarity with FDA-regulated environments

title: UI / UX Designer
description:
Game Taco is a premier skill-based gaming platform that joins gamers from around the world to play and compete in tournaments for fun and real cash prizes. Game Taco and WorldWinner recently combined into a new corporate entity backed by Platinum Equity and is now uniquely positioned to grow the company through user acquisitions and partnerships. It's an especially exciting time for a UI/UX... Designer to design modern and compelling experiences for our users.

Game Taco is the leading, premium skill-games destination in the United States, including popular games like Bejeweled, Wheel of Fortune, SCRABBLE Cubes, TRIVIAL PURSUIT, plus Atari classics like Breakout, Asteroids, and Centipede! We are looking for new team members in a variety of disciplines who are enthusiastic about reaching for the stars and helping us build a world-class gaming platform on mobile and beyond.

The ideal candidate will have a strong visual design background, experience in UI/UX principles and a passion for visual problem solving.

WHAT YOU'LL DO:
• Work closely with creative, product, and engineering teams to conceptualize and prototype user flows. This will include helping the product team identify goals and challenges to define feature requirements. You'll be able to articulate your problem-solving to stakeholders and discuss technical requirements with technical artists and engineers.
• Research competitor or industry standards, leverage analytics, user testing, and customer feedback, and apply them intelligently into iterative design solutions. Run simple usability tests using mocks or prototypes on usertesting.com to gather initial feedback. Collaborate with our Insights team to design and run larger tests including user interviews and live moderated usability studies.
• Identify player use-cases that need to be solved and depict the user journey with a flowchart. The flow is used as a discussion point between Product and Engineering marking what areas of our current app will be affected by additional features. Wireframes are then produced to identify what UI elements will be needed and what states of the feature they may encounter.
• Be a liaison between artists, designers, and engineers and collaborate in creating solutions for a project's needs.
• Create simple or complex prototypes depending on the level of testing needed. A simple prototype might include a flow or wires on a page-by-page basis. A complex prototype might include clickable target areas, micro-interactions, or fully connected features.
• Create user interfaces using existing components, styles, and art throughout the entire project experience using Sketch and Figma software.
• For new products, you'll work with the UI/UX Manager and Creative Director to build a new style guide and aesthetic for the audience.
• Not all functions listed may be performed and other duties may be assigned to meet business needs as determined by Game Taco.

JOB REQUIREMENTS:
• Bachelor of Fine Arts, Arts, Computer Science, or equivalent work experience
• 3+ years of experience in the field or related area
• Proficient with tools (Figma, Miro, Sketch), design principles, and industry best practices
• General knowledge of native app design
• Experience in agile development
• Proficient with Adobe Suite (Photoshop & Illustrator)

BONUS POINTS!
• Passion for making Social and Casual games a huge plus!
• Understanding of accessibility standards (W3C)
• General knowledge of HTML, CSS, and responsive web techniques
• Knowledge of design standards (Apple HIG, Google Material design)
• Strong artistic background
• 3D Knowledge and experience in Unity a plus!

BENEFITS INFORMATION:
• Exciting, creative, and fun industry where you can really make a difference
• Comprehensive health and welfare benefits program including 401(k) with matching contributions and immediate vesting
• Lucrative candidate / employee referral program. Refer your talented colleagues to help us build our bench!
• Individual and corporate professional development opportunities

EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY

Game Taco is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against employees or applicants on the basis of race, color, national origin, gender, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, disability, religion, age, genetic information, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. We will make a reasonable accommodation to known physical or mental limitations of a qualified applicant or employee with a disability unless the accommodation would impose an undue hardship on our operation or direct threat safety to the individual or others in the work environment. We also participate in the E-Verify program, a service of DHS and SSA. Applicants must be authorized to work for ANY employer in the US. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment Visa at this time.
Employment Type: FULL_TIME

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Interested in working at a company where you can have a major impact on the outcome of the company? Lightyear Strategies is looking for a versed UI/UX Designer.

About Us...

Lightyear Strategies is a public relations company with 650% growth in the past 9 months. We work with clients across all major verticals including Financial Services, Manufacturing, Technology and Services, Telecom and Media, Retail, Life Sciences and Healthcare. Our work has been recognized in Forbes, Boston Globe, CNN and many other globally recognized publications.

We are a fast-paced, entrepreneurial organization looking to revolutionize the PR industry. As experts in the field with extensive software background, the Lightyear team took it upon itself to bring to market the most advanced productivity tool for PR professionals.

The Opportunity

We are looking for a inquisitive, well-rounded UI/UX Designer to join our core team. Working closely with the product manager and engineers, you'll play a key role in enabling our cutting edge technologies. You will design esthetic and intuitive user flows & features. You will empower both developers and users alike. You'll have the opportunity to find creative solutions to thought-provoking problems. More than that.. you will create and drive new initiative, seeing them from inception through to technical design, implementation, and release.

What you will bring to the table:
• You are a skilled UI/UX designer, with at least 3+ years of experience with innovative design solutions
• You have a knack for delivering successfully on complex UX/UI challenges without compromising quality and speed
• Broad experience with design tools (Figma, UXPin, Photoshop, After Effects, Rive etc.)
• Conceive and create illustrations and graphics to accurately and effectively communicate scientific concepts and results
• Top-notch user research skills: contextual inquiry, knowledge elicitation, any other creative methods for gathering high-quality data from remote or infrequent user interaction
• You are delivery oriented and understand the tradeoffs between complete and perfect.
• Outstanding written, visual, and spoken communication skills with technical and non-technical stakeholders
• Ability to see the value of utility and practical solutions but with a tendency to think outside of the box for more effective solutions than the status quo
• Ability to thrive in iterative design process while maintaining strong organizational and time management skills
• You find motivation in being involved in planning, architecture and strategic discussions
• Produce high-fidelity clickable mockups, ensuring design objectives are clearly communicated to the development team
• Keep up on design trends, best practices, existing solutions, standards
• Familiarity with Agile development

Ideally you have also*
• Have working knowledge of frontend languages such as HTML, CSS, JS, frameworks such as React.js, Next.js, and UI Libraries such as Tailwind.

Lightyear Strategies focuses on Public Relations and Digital Marketing. Their company has offices in Boston. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees.

You can view their website at https://www.lightyearstrategies.com

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
Additional Information

This is a one-year term position with strong potential for renewal...

This position is based in Boston, but the work may be done fully or primarily remote. Any remote work must be performed in a state in which Harvard is registered to do business (CA, CT, GA, IL, MA, MD, ME, NH, NJ, NY, RI, VA, VT, and WA). Individual flexible and remote work options for this role will be discussed during the interview process. Note: Harvard employees working in California must be exempt.

The University requires all Harvard community members to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and remain up to date with COVID-19 vaccine boosters, as detailed in Harvard's Vaccine & Booster Requirements. Individuals may claim exemption from the vaccine requirement for medical or religious reasons. More information regarding the University's COVID vaccination requirement, exemptions, and verification of vaccination status may be found at the University's "COVID-19 Vaccine Information" webpage: http://www.harvard.edu/coronavirus/covid-19-vaccine-information/.

Please note that we are currently conducting a majority of interviews and onboarding remotely and virtually. We appreciate your understanding.

Harvard University offers an outstanding benefits package including:
• Time Off: 3 - 4 weeks paid vacation, paid holiday break, 12 paid sick days, 12.5 paid holidays, and 3 paid personal days per year.
• Medical/Dental/Vision: We offer a variety of excellent medical plans, dental & vision plans, all coverage begins as of your start date.
• Retirement: University-funded retirement plan with full vesting after 3 years of service.
• Tuition Assistance Program: Competitive tuition assistance program, incredibly affordable classes directly at the Harvard Extension School, and discounted options through participating Harvard grad schools.
• Transportation: Harvard offers a 50% discounted MBTA pass as well as additional options to assist employees in their daily commute.
• Wellness options: Harvard offers programs and classes at little or no cost, including stress management, massages, nutrition, meditation, and complementary health services.
• Harvard access to athletic facilities, libraries, campus events, and many discounts throughout metro Boston.

The Harvard Medical School is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position.

Basic Qualifications
• Minimum of 5 years' post-secondary education or relevant work experience

Position Description

Join our team of researchers, engineers, and designers to shape the future of biomedical research!

The Gehlenborg Lab in the Department of Biomedical Informatics at Harvard Medical School is funded to develop data visualization tools and user interfaces for multiple national and international cell atlas projects such as the Human BioMolecular Atlas Program (HuBMAP), the Cellular Senescence Network (SenNet), the Human Tumor Atlas Network (HTAN), the Kidney Precision Medicine Network (KPMP), and the Human Cell Atlas (HCA).

The ultimate goal of these efforts is to create maps of the human body at single-cell resolution with the help of cutting edge technologies that generate large and complex sequencing and imaging data sets. The maps will shape our understanding of processes like aging and usher in a new era of treatments for common human diseases.

Your responsibility will be to ensure that the user experience and user interfaces for our tools meet the needs of a broad community of scientists, clinicians, and other stakeholders. You will accomplish this by applying state-of-the-art user research techniques to elicit personas, use cases, and evaluation criteria. You will create wireframes and high fidelity user interface mockups. You will partner with the software developers and researchers on our team as well as national and international collaborators to accomplish our goals. You will also coordinate and oversee the day-to-day work of other UI/UX designers on the team and develop processes and documentation for UI/UX design work in the Gehlenborg Lab.

We value diversity, creativity, and initiative in a highly collaborative and interdisciplinary work environment. The Gehlenborg Lab has an international reputation for creating high impact data visualization tools and we are driven to solve the most challenging design and engineering problems in biomedical data science. We would love to have you on our team!

Work Environment:

The Gehlenborg Lab is using a hybrid workplace model and this position can be fully remote, hybrid, or in-person. All remote work must be performed within a state in which Harvard is registered to do business (CA*, CT, GA, IL, MA, MD, ME, NH, NJ, NY, RI, VA, VT, and WA). Occasional domestic or international travel to attend meetings will be required.

Typical Core Duties:
• Function as subject matter expert to frame, scope, and lead multiple interdisciplinary projects using a collaborative approach
• Document detailed UX specifications
• Ensure work delivery, including accurate estimation, time management, & communication
• Manage UI/UX design multiple projects simultaneously in collaboration with developer lead, project lead, and the principal investigator
• Coordinate and oversee the day-to-day work of other UI/UX designers on the team
• Represent the university internally and externally
• Abide by and follow the Harvard University IT technical standards, policies and Code of Conduct

title: UX Designer
description:
UX Designer

Planet Technology is looking for User Experience Designer who are passionate about their craft and making investing approachable for all audiences. Our client is redefining the financial services industry by changing the way they work and putting the customer first. It’s a fast-paced environment where decisions are data-focused, collaborative, and iterative. The organization deeply... values design.

The Expertise and Skills You Bring
• 4-6+ years of UX or related experience is preferred
• A degree in a related field such as interactive design, architecture, industrial design, graphic design, or human factors is preferred
• Experience working on agile teams delivering value in digital products preferred
• Experience running and/or using research to support evidence-focused design decisions preferred
• A digital portfolio we can review online is required

Skills:
• An array of design skills, which might include visual, conversational, information architecture, prototyping, strategic design methods (such as design thinking), user research, or writing
• Ability to design across all channels including web, native, and automated
• Effective communication as a writer, presenter, and facilitator; equally at ease speaking with developer partners or executives
• A foundation of development knowledge, both web and mobile
• Familiarity with the value of design systems, understanding reuse and scale, and knowing when to contribute to make them better
• Partnering with user research to identify the customer problems to tackle
• Distilling qualitative and quantitative feedback to unearth recurring themes and promote data-driven design decisions
• An unwavering curiosity to ask why
• Design brings you happiness

title: Lead UI/UX Designer
description:
Position Description:

As an artist and a creative designer, do you have a passion for User Interaction and Visual Aesthetics of Software applications? If so, this is a role for you...

Client has an immediate opening for a Lead UI/UX Designer:

Understand User interface mechanics for a visually interactive experience. Effectively uses mockups for the presentation of UX. Find creative ways to solve User Experience problems (e.g. usability, findability). Be a pioneer for UI consistency within the Factory.

Essential Duties:

Lead a team of 1-10 UI/UX Designers

Help to define product specifications

Own the journey of a User by conducting User Experience research

Perform interviews and document User Personas

Create story boards and provides barebone mockups to conduct User studies

Delegate the creation of and present story boards with polished mockups

Work with Product and Engineering teams to ensure accessibility and styling standards are met

Enforce design consistency across the organization

Teach others the User interface mechanics for a visually interactive experience

Decide layout, buttons, common componentry, etc.

Rapidly presents ideas to make educated decisions in leadership discussions

Own the Global Style Guide to enforce specific pixel perfect componentry

Mentor a team to solve User Experience problems in creative ways (e.g. usability, findability)

Analyze and report on competitive products and industry trends

Assist upper management to plan and organize work for a team of UI/UX Designers

Occasionally assist in recruiting new UI/UX Designers

Required Qualifications/Skills/Education:

3-5 years of designing user experience interfaces

B.S. in a Design related major

Proven experience as a UX Designer, UI Designer or similar role

Portfolio of design projects

Background in conducting UX research

Experience in with working across teams within an organization

Experience leading review sessions

Experience owning and enforcing sets of standards

Ability to assert design quality during design and delivery of software

Proficient in Figma design software

Additional Qualifications/Skills/Education:

Experience working with HTML/CSS, JavaScript

Portfolio of design projects

Worked with Angular Material Design

Experience gathering and reporting User Analytics

Experience with energy market graphical design and use cases

Experience leading a team of UI/UX Designers

title: Remote UI/UX Designer
description:
Are you on the hunt for exciting new challenges that boost your professional growth? If you’re an innovator by nature and a UX/UI Designer by trade, we’d love to hear from you! Read on to see if you’d be a good fit for the Scopic team of 250 professionals from over 40 countries.

At Scopic, the virtual world is our home so this is a full-time remote position. Only apply if you’re prepared for the... zero-hour commute and the thought of collaborating with colleagues from around the globe excites you!

What your day-to-day will look like:
• Design beautiful, thoughtful, and scalable interfaces for consumer and enterprise products
• Define, communicate, and get buy-in on UI/UX best practices with stakeholders across Engineering and Product
• Evolve high-level visual concepts into pixel-perfect designs (with whiteboarding and mock-ups in between!)
• Be the user-advocate, while working to align stakeholder goals and product requirements
• Gather key insights through data and user analysis to find users' unmet & unspoken needs
• Document UI/UX requirements and interactions to assist Product for development, training, and sales purposes
• Work closely with Product and Engineering to help build, test, and evaluate designs from idea to release
• Assist with training stakeholders during the Product roll-out process, providing support during the early stages of the launch

The skills and traits we’re looking for:
• Minimum 3 years of Product UI/UX experience designing consumer and enterprise products
• Must have proven experience as a UI designer with strong visual design skills and the ability to create design systems
• Solid experience with responsive, mobile, and TV app design
• Experience in the media space preferred
• Strong understanding of UX design, knowledge of UX best practices, and the ability to create wireframes, user journeys and prototypes
• Proficient with industry standard tools (i.e., Figma, Sketch, Invision, Adobe Creative Suite)
• Ability to create high fidelity designs for hand-off and collaboration with developers
• Self-sufficient, able to manage projects in a fast-paced, continuous delivery environment
• Takes initiative, team player, thoughtful, and action-and-results oriented
• Strong communication, documentation, organization, and prioritization skills
• Willingness to dive into and understand technology, workflows and structure behind Deluxe's software platforms, products and tools
• High command of verbal and written English with good communication and reporting skills
• Flexibility to work extended hours/weekends as needed

Important! Please remember to provide examples or portfolio of work with your application.

The secret ingredients that make us special:
• Your growth is our growth. We invest in your future with paid training and other professional opportunities.
• We’re industry innovators at the forefront of change. Equipped with the latest technologies and a team of knowledgeable colleagues by your side, you’ll embrace new and interesting challenges.

• Recognition and reward. We acknowledge diligence and hard work through annual pay increases for good performance.

Down to business!
• Salary Range: Negotiable based on skills and experience.
• Your starting salary is negotiable depending on your skills and experience.
• Both hourly and salary positions are available.
• Employees are paid monthly via wire transfer.

Our values:

Scopic is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, marital status, national origin, gender, veteran status, sexual orientation, age, or disability status.

Apply today to join our growing team of remote professionals from around the world

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Overview

Draper is an independent, nonprofit research and development company headquartered in Cambridge, MA. The 1,800 employees of Draper tackle important national challenges with a promise of delivering successful and usable solutions. From military defense and space exploration to biomedical engineering, lives often depend on the solutions we provide. Our multidisciplinary teams of engineers... and scientists work in a collaborative environment that inspires the cross-fertilization of ideas necessary for true innovation. For more information about Draper, visit www.draper.com .

Our work is very important to us, but so is our life outside of work. Draper supports many programs to improve work-life balance including workplace flexibility, employee clubs ranging from photography to yoga, health and finance workshops, off site social events and discounts to local museums and cultural activities. If this specific job opportunity and the chance to work at a nationally renowned R&D innovation company appeals to you, apply now www.draper.com/careers .

Equal Employment Opportunity

Draper is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. We understand the value of diversity and its impact on a high-performance culture. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or genetic information.

Draper is committed to providing access, equal opportunity and reasonable accommodation for individuals with disabilities in employment, its services, programs, and activities. To request reasonable accommodation, please contact hr@draper.com.

Responsibilities

We work on exciting projects to solve hard problems at the intersection of engineering, design, and high-stakes scenarios such as: big data analytics, decision support tools, team collaboration systems, human-robot interaction, augmented reality, and contextual situation awareness tools in both the commercial and national security arenas. You will apply user-centered research, interaction, and visual design principles to create usable, engaging, modern, and intuitive interfaces for cutting-edge systems sponsored by the US Government, commercial customers, and internal R&D projects. Our users experience difficult challenges such as: high cognitive workload situations, high stakes tactical scenarios, complex data problems (including data visualization and overcoming cognitive bias), safety critical operations, and collaboration across distributed teams. The ideal candidate is an assertive self-starter that can bring user-centered approaches to an engineering environment and engage with colleagues to build ideas into solutions in a team-centered environment.

Qualifications
• B.S., Masters, or formal training in Human-Computer Interaction, Human Factors, Design, Computer Science, Product Management, Data Visualization, or similar field
• A portfolio or case study of work showcasing UX, IX, UI, or Data Visualization design and concept validation – please share a link to work samples in your application; Demonstrated capability and attention to detail in design
• Top-notch user research skills: contextual inquiry, knowledge elicitation, any other creative methods for gathering high-quality data from remote or infrequent user interaction
• Good written, visual, and spoken communication skills
• Familiarity with Agile development and Atlassian’s agile suite in particular

Preferred Qualifications
• UX Research - Comfort and confidence leading user research sessions, coming prepared with a plan and being resilient to rapid scheduling / focus changes, delivering artifacts that support software development decisions
• IX Design – ability to apply skillset to new subject matter areas and ability to incorporate new knowledge into documented best practices with the intention to improve future work and capture a knowledge base of relevant subject matter areas, building design artifacts as probes for user research questions
• UI Design - Creation of initial sketch concepts / scalable libraries / design toolkits for product lines
• Experience working closely and iteratively with engineering and development teams

Security Clearance Requirements
• TS/SCI Clearance

title: Co-op, UI-UX Designer
description:
Company Description

At Biogen, our mission is clear - we are pioneers in neuroscience. Biogen discovers, develops, and delivers worldwide innovative therapies for people living with serious neurological and neurodegenerative diseases. Together, our employees create, commercialize, and manufacture transformative therapies for our patient population...

We at Biogen are committed to building on our culture of inclusion and belonging that reflects the communities where we operate and the patients who we serve. We are focused on strengthening our foundation to advance our overall Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DE&I) strategy and, most importantly, ensure all our employees feel included.

As an intern or co-op at Biogen, you can expect to be placed on a real project, under the guidance of experienced professionals and subject matter experts who are invested in your career and academic growth. We also ensure that you have plenty of opportunities to build your network, learn more about our organization through weekly lunch and learns led by leaders from across the company, and join us for several fun events.

Job Description

This application is for a 6-month student role from January - June 2023. Resume review begins in October 2022.

The Data Office of Biogen Digital Health generates tools, technologies and techniques that connect the patient journey living with complex disease in real world setting to scientific knowledge production, clinical improvement, and discovery processes and practices. We implement new technologies, design with the end user in mind, and assess how to best bridge gaps between our ability “to measure” and “to know”. We are seeking UI-UX Designers to work alongside clinical informaticists, data scientists, software developers, science and medical leaders, and platform architects.

Position Description

As a UI-UX Design co-op, you will work to understand end-user needs, workflow, and experience to enable the design and implementations of solutions to onboard users to new data and software products, applications, or features. You will join Agile Scrum teams and work alongside subject matter experts in fields like Real World Data, Distributed Clinical Trials, and ML Ops for Biomedical Image and Instrumentation Pipelines.

You will shadow multiple teams across the Data Office and our stakeholders, including data science, clinical operations, medical and science staff. You will observe, interview, and align stakeholder needs with opportunities to improve the user experience. You will also build data visualization frameworks to help bring data directly to users in order to improve their ability to derive insights from the intersection of their day-to-day work experience and the data lifecycle. In addition, you will generate mechanisms for understanding how explicit user desires intersect with the day-to-day utilization patterns of platforms and applications and create assessment frameworks to understand onboarding and utilization best practices driven by insights from things like application logs.

Deliverables during this co-op will include:
• Wireframes and mock-ups
• Personas, user stories, and user journey maps
• Data visualizations and dashboards
• Design documents

Example projects may include:
• Assessing gaps in onboarding and training materials for improvements, driven by application adoption
• Defining new features to improve clinical operations, study data management, or scientific knowledge creation
• Implementing dashboards and data visualizations to improve day-to-day operations of a global team

Qualifications

Candidates should have the following qualifications:
• Experience in user-centered design
• Understanding of mock-ups, visualizations, and wireframes and where each fit into a product lifecycle
• Interest in employing UI-UX design methodology across a number of Agile Scrum projects
• Experience working with web-based applications and “front-end” libraries like React.js
• Familiarity with cloud computing frameworks

Ideal candidates will also have interest or experience with:
• Deadline-oriented settings
• Data visualization tools or platforms (Tableau, PowerBI, Databricks)

To participate in the Biogen Internship Program, students must meet the following eligibility criteria:
• Legal authorization to work in the U.S.
• At least 18 years of age prior to the scheduled start date
• Be currently enrolled in an accredited college or university

Education
• Master’s or above in a relevant field (Computer Science, Public Health, Biomedical Engineering, Biology, Interaction Design)
• UI-UX specific coursework

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
The financial industry is growing at a record pace, but our data providers are still stuck in the past — with cumbersome onboarding processes, complicated APIs, slow infrastructure, and expensive licensing costs.

Databento is the next-generation market data provider — with the radical idea that you should only pay for the data that you use. We power the world's largest finance and fintech... institutions and lower the barrier of entry for small startups.

Since starting in 2019, we've raised over $27.8M in funding and have over 2,000 companies signed up pre-launch. Our team consists of former data users from firms like Two Sigma, Belvedere, Pico, Bloomberg, Pinterest, and Google.

We offer health, dental, disability, and life insurance benefits, as well as 401(k) matching and visa sponsorships. We accommodate 100% remote work, with teammates living around the globe and paid in their local currency.
Responsibilities

As a Senior UI/UX Designer, you'll be working closely with our product and engineering teams to design and improve on our core product and implement growth strategies to widen our user base. You'll be:
• Designing and improving everything from end-to-end user flows to visual optimizations for specific features.
• Implementing both high-fidelity prototypes and low-fidelity wireframes.
• Working with engineers to bridge the gap between design and technical implementation.
• Working with external and internal (CEO, CTO, community team) stakeholders to identify and prioritize user needs.
• Conducting user testing and assimilating customer feedback.
• Planning and conducting user research and interviews.
• Motivating design-oriented decisions and standards firm-wide.
The product

Our core products are an API service and an enterprise web application. Here are some key highlights of our product strategy:
• Product-led growth with low touch sales. We rely on product features like referrals, team invites and self-signup process instead of a traditional sales pipeline to scale our user base.
• Enterprise-grade, consumer-scale product. (Like Slack or GitHub.) Our competitors adopt a traditional enterprise SaaS strategy, opting to hide their product behind a "request for quote/demo" and employing a high touch onboarding process with big sales teams. We believe we can outpace their growth by targeting the same enterprises with an institutional-grade product that instead has the ease of adoption and transparency of a consumer product.
• Targeting a developer-centric user base. (Like AWS, Stripe or Plaid.) We pursue the exponential effect of providing products that enable developers to build an ecosystem of other products and tools.
• Fast iteration. With multiple deployments per day.
• Putting product needs before technical limitations. We have great engineers who will walk over hot coals to actualize difficult product requirements.
What makes being a UI/UX designer at Databento exciting
• You'll impact high-level product decisions as well as shape product design culture. As one of our initial design hires, you will largely influence the product design culture and help set the stage for our product's growth. As such, we value designers who take initiative and can design with ambiguity, and can contribute feedback on how to improve our design processes.
• We're focused on product-led growth, not sales-led growth. We resonate with the pain that design is less prioritized in many enterprise products. At Databento, our product is the central driver of growth, and you'll be at the center of developing our product experience. Not only are our founders always raising the bar of our product's design quality, but our engineers, who usually fall into target user profile, contribute to advocating for and improving user experience.
• You'll receive timely compensation rewards that reflect your impact Here, we believe in giving kudos when it's due. We measure your value based on your work and direct contributions you put in, and reward frequently and accordingly when it comes to pay and promotions. Additionally, we offer competitive base pay that is comparable to other top tech companies.
Requirements
• 5+ years of experience as a UI/UX Designer or Product Designer.
• Proficiency with design tools (Figma, Adobe).
• Experience collaborating with engineers and other designers.
• Experience performing user research, user flow mapping and presenting options to stakeholders.
• Understanding of color theory, typography, interaction design, motion principles and visual hierarchy.
• Keen eye for design improvements and visual detail.
• A strong portfolio.
• Bachelor's degree in a design or technical field, such as HCI, Design or Information Architecture.
Bonus qualifications
• Experience with designing enterprise web applications or API products (e.g. Stripe, Twilio, Plaid, Segment, Algolia, Agora).
• Industry knowledge in fintech.
• Familiarity with responsive design.
• Familiarity with collecting user metrics and analyzing user sessions (e.g. Amplitude, Heap, Mixpanel).
• Experience with front-end web development (HTML/CSS, JavaScript).
• Exposure to product management at high growth startup.

Please include a sample portfolio or website in your application, if possible.

Our recruiting data suggests that underrepresented applicants often downplay their skills. Even if your experience doesn’t exactly match the qualifications listed, we still want to hear from you. Please apply

title: User Experience (UX) Designer
description:
We are looking for a dynamic UI/UX Designer with 2+ years of relevant experience for our B2B technology client in Greater Boston. The UI/UX Designer will be responsible for the user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) design of our various digital assets. The UI/UX Designer will ensure that all elements of the online user experience are optimized for improved usability, usefulness, and... exceptional visual design. This position is a mostly remote role. Client would prefer to have someone who can work onsite once a month in Greater Boston. Client would also consider fully remote as well. Target salary is 85K.

The successful candidate will show evidence a passion for delivering adaptive and creative solutions to UI/UX design problems by staying up to date with best practices and emerging trends in user experience design and user interface technology.

Responsibilities:
• Developing and conceptualizing a comprehensive UI/UX design strategy for the user and brand.
• Producing high-quality UX design solutions through wireframes, visual designs, workshops, flow diagrams, storyboards, site maps, and prototypes.
• Skills/knowledge of front-end coding of websites and other digital online platforms.
• Designing UI elements and tools such as navigation menus, CTAs, carousels, search boxes, for our digital assets library.
• Collaborating with the marketing team and developers to ensure the creation and delivery of tailored experiences for the digital user.
• Communicating with various stakeholders and holding meetings to presents visual concepts and research.
• Providing advice and guidance on the implementation of UX research methodologies and testing activities to analyze and predict user behavior.
• Meeting team’s deadlines, organizing your time wisely while working in an agile environment and a team of designers, developers, and user strategists.

Requirements

Requirements:
• A Bachelor's degree and a minimum of 2+ years’ UI/UX design experience for digital products or services
• Working knowledge of the following technologies and software: Figma, InVision, Axure, HTML, CSS, Design Systems, Miro and Adobe Creative Suite.
• A team player but can work independently too.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
• Multi-tasking and time-management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks.
• Up-to date portfolio detailing skill sets

title: Ui ux designer
description:
UX / UI Designer

We are seeking an energetic, creative, organized, smart UX / UI Designer to help us deliver amazing visual experiences to our customers and fundamentally change how they interact with their products or experiences...

This person should be familiar or interested in learning the principles of designing for user experiences. This person should have proven experiences building visual systems with typography, layout, iconography, image making and other user interface signifiers and / or designed interactive experiences through an architectural / navigational perspective.

What You'll Do :
• Participate as a contributor to an interdisciplinary team that includes user experience designers, industrial designers, design researchers, and developers and or engineers.
• Actively participate in brainstorms, concept development and group growth.
• Understand and communicate the brand attributes and how they translate to visual communication.
• Develop creative concepts and directions from creative briefs, wireframes, etc.
• Present and defend clear ideas and concepts to clients and other team members.
• Be both hands-on and provide clear direction for others.
• Ensure exceptional design execution.
• Document design specification in fine detail.
• Communicate ideas with the tech team and respond to issues as they arise.

Requirements :
• Bachelor's or Master's degree in Visual Communication, Interaction Design or similar study.
• US Citizens or Green Card holders only at this time
• Strong conceptual thinking.
• Intimate knowledge of Sketch, Invision, and the Adobe Creative Suite.
• 2+ years of visual design experience.
• Ability to work with different disciplines.
• A solid understanding of designing intuitive user interfaces, interactive behaviors and navigation.
• Experience working collaboratively with designers and copywriters to build great user and brand experiences.
• Great communications skills - both with internal teams and communicating with / presenting to clients.
• Flexibility and a can-do attitude!

More About Us

Our work bridges physical and digital products and services. As a result, our design team aims to enhance holistic user experiences.

A cross-section of our recent work includes consumer products, professional equipment, medical devices, health and wellness platforms / communities, green' building initiatives, and athletic performance monitoring systems.

Our office is a casual, loft-like, studio atmosphere with very convenient access to public transit.

Essential provides competitive compensation and benefits packages.

description:

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
Position Description

Join our team of researchers, engineers, and designers to shape the future of biomedical research...

The Gehlenborg Lab in the Department of Biomedical Informatics at Harvard Medical School is funded to develop data visualization tools and user interfaces for multiple national and international cell atlas projects such as the Human BioMolecular Atlas Program (HuBMAP), the Cellular Senescence Network (SenNet), the Human Tumor Atlas Network (HTAN), the Kidney Precision Medicine Network (KPMP), and the Human Cell Atlas (HCA).

The ultimate goal of these efforts is to create maps of the human body at single-cell resolution with the help of cutting edge technologies that generate large and complex sequencing and imaging data sets. The maps will shape our understanding of processes like aging and usher in a new era of treatments for common human diseases.

Your responsibility will be to ensure that the user experience and user interfaces for our tools meet the needs of a broad community of scientists, clinicians, and other stakeholders. You will accomplish this by applying state-of-the-art user research techniques to elicit personas, use cases, and evaluation criteria. You will create wireframes and high fidelity user interface mockups. You will partner with the software developers and researchers on our team as well as national and international collaborators to accomplish our goals. You will also coordinate and oversee the day-to-day work of other UI/UX designers on the team and develop processes and documentation for UI/UX design work in the Gehlenborg Lab.

We value diversity, creativity, and initiative in a highly collaborative and interdisciplinary work environment. The Gehlenborg Lab has an international reputation for creating high impact data visualization tools and we are driven to solve the most challenging design and engineering problems in biomedical data science. We would love to have you on our team!

Work Environment:

The Gehlenborg Lab is using a hybrid workplace model and this position can be fully remote, hybrid, or in-person. All remote work must be performed within a state in which Harvard is registered to do business (CA*, CT, GA, IL, MA, MD, ME, NH, NJ, NY, RI, VA, VT, and WA). Occasional domestic or international travel to attend meetings will be required.

Typical Core Duties:
• Function as subject matter expert to frame, scope, and lead multiple interdisciplinary projects using a collaborative approach
• Document detailed UX specifications
• Ensure work delivery, including accurate estimation, time management, & communication
• Manage UI/UX design multiple projects simultaneously in collaboration with developer lead, project lead, and the principal investigator
• Coordinate and oversee the day-to-day work of other UI/UX designers on the team
• Represent the university internally and externally
• Abide by and follow the Harvard University IT technical standards, policies and Code of Conduct

Basic Qualifications
• Minimum of 5 years’ post-secondary education or relevant work experience

Additional Qualifications and Skills
• Minimum of 3 years of UI/UX design work including user studies, user interface design, and evaluation
• Master’s degree in a relevant field preferred but not required
• Comprehensive knowledge of and hands-on experience with user interface and user experience research and design techniques
• Expert knowledge of Figma or state-of-the-art user interface design tools
• Strong graphic design skills and experience in creating visual identities
• Hands-on experience with GitHub or other collaborative version control systems
• Working knowledge of the web application development life cycle
• Experience with IRB protocols for human subjects research
• Understanding of basics of molecular biology and biomedical research is helpful but not required
• Motivation for mentoring junior team members, interns, and trainees and collaborating with peers across multiple sites

Additional Information

This is a one-year term position with strong potential for renewal.

This position is based in Boston, but the work may be done fully or primarily remote. Any remote work must be performed in a state in which Harvard is registered to do business (CA*, CT, GA, IL, MA, MD, ME, NH, NJ, NY, RI, VA, VT, and WA). Individual flexible and remote work options for this role will be discussed during the interview process. *Note: Harvard employees working in California must be exempt.

The University requires all Harvard community members to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and remain up to date with COVID-19 vaccine boosters, as detailed in Harvard’s Vaccine & Booster Requirements. Individuals may claim exemption from the vaccine requirement for medical or religious reasons. More information regarding the University’s COVID vaccination requirement, exemptions, and verification of vaccination status may be found at the University’s “COVID-19 Vaccine Information” webpage: http://www.harvard.edu/coronavirus/covid-19-vaccine-information/.

Please note that we are currently conducting a majority of interviews and onboarding remotely and virtually. We appreciate your understanding.

Harvard University offers an outstanding benefits package including:
• Time Off: 3 - 4 weeks paid vacation, paid holiday break, 12 paid sick days, 12.5 paid holidays, and 3 paid personal days per year.
• Medical/Dental/Vision: We offer a variety of excellent medical plans, dental & vision plans, all coverage begins as of your start date.
• Retirement: University-funded retirement plan with full vesting after 3 years of service.
• Tuition Assistance Program: Competitive tuition assistance program, incredibly affordable classes directly at the Harvard Extension School, and discounted options through participating Harvard grad schools.
• Transportation: Harvard offers a 50% discounted MBTA pass as well as additional options to assist employees in their daily commute.
• Wellness options: Harvard offers programs and classes at little or no cost, including stress management, massages, nutrition, meditation, and complementary health services.
• Harvard access to athletic facilities, libraries, campus events, and many discounts throughout metro Boston.

The Harvard Medical School is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position.

Job Function

Information Technology

Location

USA - MA - Boston

Job Code

I1658P IT User Experience Prof IV

Sub-Unit

00 - Non Union, Exempt or Temporary

Commitment to Equity, Diversity, Inclusion, and Belonging

We are committed to cultivating an inclusive workplace culture of faculty, staff, and students with diverse backgrounds, styles, abilities, and motivations. We appreciate and leverage the capabilities, insights, and ideas of all individuals. Harvard Medical School Mission and Community Values

EEO Statement

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions, or any other characteristic protected by law
