title: Senior UI/UX Front-End Developer Jobs
description:
Description

STR is seeking an experienced front-end developer to work with our system engineering teams in designing and building beautiful and usable data-centric websites. The successful candidate will be someone who is currently front-end focused and is interested in expanding their knowledge of user experience and back-end development. This role offers an opportunity to work from the very... beginning of an idea all the way to deploying a final, production-ready web application.

The Role:
Work as part of a tightly knit team to design, develop, implement, and demonstrate web-based applications
• Conduct research and deconstruct our users' digital intentions and habits
• Create and maintain digital assets, such as interface design files, wireframes, and interactive mockups using XD, and Photoshop
• Design, build, and maintain highly reusable JavaScript, HTML and CSS code, preferably in the React, JavaScript, Node stack or a comparable framework
• Create UI and UX strategies based on our goals
• Work as a member of an Agile/Scrum software team
• Work across numerous programs and divisions within the company

Who You Are:
• Bachelor's degree
• 3+ years' experience as a front-end developer
• 2+ years' experience as a UI/UX designer
• Demonstrated expertise in JavaScript, CSS, CSS extension languages (LESS, Sass), CSS preprocessor tools, HTML5 and its best practices
• Understanding of SOLID design principles
• Demonstrated expertise in designing interfaces and building clickable prototypes
• Experience deconstructing user behavior to create an improved experience for users (with or without real users available)
• Proficient with Git version control
• Proficient using the command line
• Proficient with at least one of: React, Flask, Django, Node, Vue
• Able to work independently
• Ability to obtain a Security Clearance

Even Better:
• Active Security Clearance
• Experience managing subcontractors

STR is a rapidly growing technology company with locations north of Boston, MA, Arlington, VA and near Dayton, OH. We specialize in advanced research and development for defense, intelligence, and national security, trying to understand how to protect our society: from stopping malicious botnet attacks, to understanding cyber vulnerabilities, providing next generation sensors, radar, sonar, communications, and electronic warfare to developing artificial intelligence algorithms and analytics to make sense of the complexity that is exploding around us.

STR is committed to creating a collaborative learning environment that supports deep technical understanding and recognizes the contributions and achievements of all team members. Our work is challenging, but you go home at night knowing that you pushed the forefront of technology and made the world a little safer. We recognize that the world is changing, that it is becoming more connected than ever before, making things change faster than before, and reshaping society in the process. We all want to understand this changing world and leave it better for our work.

STR is not just any company. Our people, culture, and attitude along with their unique set of skills, experiences, and perspectives put us on a trajectory to change the world. We can't do it alone, though - we need fellow trailblazers. If you are one, join our team and help to keep our society safe! Visit us at www.str.us for more info.

STR is an equal opportunity employer. We are fully dedicated to hiring the most qualified candidate regardless of race, color, religion, sex (including gender identity, sexual orientation and pregnancy), marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

If you need a reasonable accommodation for any portion of the employment process, email us at appassist@str.us and provide your contact info.

Pursuant to applicable federal law and regulations, positions at STR require employees to obtain national security clearances and satisfy the requirements for compliance with export control and other applicable laws

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
ABOUT US:

Braintrust is the only network that gives in-demand talent all the freedom of freelance with all the benefits, community and stability of a full-time role. As the first decentralized talent network, our revolutionary Web3 model ensures the community that relies on Braintrust to find work are the same people who own and build it through the blockchain token, BTRST. So unlike other... marketplaces that take 20% to 50% of talent earnings, Braintrust allows talent to keep 100% of earnings and to vote on key changes to improve the network. Braintrust is working to change the way freelance works – for good.
• JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)
• LOCATION: Remote - Work from anywhere (TimeZone: EST | Partial overlap)
• HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $50 – $80/hr
• ESTIMATED DURATION: 40h/week - Long term

THE OPPORTUNITY

Must haves:
• Minimum 5 years of proven UX/UI design experience
• Knowledge of usability testing and analysis
• Experience working closely with brand management, creative teams, product management, engineering leadership, and business stakeholders to champion design at every step
• Knowledgeable in wireframing tools, storyboards, user flows, and site mapping
• Advanced experience with Figma
Wants:
• In-depth understanding of UI; an understanding latest design and technology trends and their role in a commercial environment
• Artistic eye for design, user interaction, functionality, and readability
• Able to think creatively while maintaining accuracy and attention to detail
• Able to multitask, prioritize, and manage time efficiently

About the client:

Client is revolutionizing financial services by making access to low-interest asset-backed loans 10x easier.

Project Summary:

Their first product focuses on making it significantly faster and easier for consumers to access their home equity. Our client is a seed-stage startup backed by top-tier venture investors in fintech and proptech from NFX, GFC, and other reputable angel investors. Their initial product launched recently, and they are looking to build out this product rapidly.

They are looking for a UX/UI Designer to join their team.

First Deliverables:
• Design the online consumer application
• Design the back end loan officer portal

Apply Now

ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:

Qualified candidates will be invited to do a screening interview with the Braintrust staff. We will answer your questions about the project, and our platform. If we determine it is the right fit for both parties, we'll invite you to join the platform and create a profile to apply directly for this project.

C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we'd welcome your application.

Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Alohop is an entertainment booking platform where you can discover and book fun experiences in minutes. We have strong data on product-market-fit and are focused over the next 18 months to grow in Boston before expanding to other cities. We have raised our seed round and are backed by institutional and private investors. We are building a founding team that will get the opportunity to establish... the foundation of the company.

Job Brief

We are looking for an experienced UI/UX designer who will build our product design across Web and Mobile. At Alohop, we strive to create products that are effortless to use; products that users will want to go back to regularly; products that users will be crazy to tell their friends about. Our key design principle is to leverage human-centered design to build products that solve user needs. If you are an experienced designer who is interested in solving boredom, then Alohop is the right place for you.

Responsibilities
• Practice human-centered design in creating user experiences and user interfaces that are easy to use and solve the challenges of Alohop’s target market.
• Produce designs that are laser focused on solving user and business problems, and which consider not just the ideal user flow but the realistic experiences for all use cases.
• Establish beautiful, expressive, and intuitive visual, motion, and interaction design with principles and patterns, across all platforms (Web and Mobile)
• Create user scenarios, user journey, wireframes, UI designs and prototypes throughout the full cycle of the product development process.
• Provide high-fidelity assets and specs ready for engineering.
• Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and marketers to understand requirements, and provide creative, thoughtful solutions.
• Use quantitative data and qualitative feedback to inform the design decisions iteratively.
• Contextualize the holistic impact of your design in the dynamic ecosystem of the three-sided marketplace.
• Write documentation and guidance on how and why components, styles, and patterns are applied in code and design.
• Ensure that the interface is optimized for SEO

Requirements
• 2+ years of experience with end-to-end Product design.
• Native or very high proficiency in the English language.
• Bachelor's degree in Design (e.g., Interaction, Graphic, Visual Communications, Product, Industrial, etc.), Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), or a related field or equivalent practical experience.
• Have cross-platform design experiences (Web, Mobile, emails).
• Experience in human-centered design, design thinking, user-centric design.
• High proficiency in Figma, Photoshop, and other design tools.
• Understanding of search engine optimization and inbound marketing
• Experience launching software at scale in a fast paced product organization.
• Excellent written and verbal communication with ability to influence with storytelling.
• Hustle. Thrives in an evolving, fast paced, ambiguous work environment.
• Extremely high attention to detail. You set the bar for what we aim to do in our products.
• Proficiency in graphic design to make creative web illustrations and marketing collateral is a plus.

Alohop focuses on Marketplaces, Online Reservations, Lifestyle, Consumer, and Local Discovery. Their company has offices in Boston and Cambridge. They have a small team that's between 1-10 employees.

You can view their website at https://www.alohop.com or find them on Facebook and LinkedIn

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
Vicarious Surgical is hiring a Senior UI/UX Designer to join the product team in Waltham, MA. As a Senior UI/UX Designer, you will be responsible for owning the UI/UX design of the system’s multiple interfaces and working with your human factors engineering, industrial design, and clinical development engineering colleagues to design a best-in-class user experience for surgeons and operating room... staff.

You’re a master of your craft and have experience defining a design approach that leads to successful design solutions. You are passionate about challenging the status quo to elevate the user experience and create designs that delight users. You’re a team player with a user-centered design mindset and have the ability to understand complex processes and take a design from concept to high fidelity. As a senior UI/UX designer, you’ll collaborate with the rest of the Product Team to create workflows and wireframes, set the visual direction, and work with engineering teams to create development-ready designs, all while keeping your eye on our strategic goals.

You are passionate about learning about users and their needs, and you are committed to creating thoughtful solutions that enable them to realize the full potential of our robotic system. You enjoy observing surgical cases and speaking with surgeons and subject matter experts to identify opportunities to surprise and delight within the clinical environment.

You inspire confidence immediately with teammates and stakeholders and are able to articulate design decisions and provide design expertise to other teams. As a senior member on the UI/UX design team you will act as a mentor to more junior designers, uphold the design quality bar, and maintain good process.

This is a terrific opportunity for an experienced UI/UX design professional to join our company at a very exciting time and be a key member of a growing product team that will bring our robotic solution to life.

Responsibilities:
• Develop an understanding and empathy for our users on how they value and interact with our digital products.
• Develop an understanding of the clinical workflow to ensure design solutions meet clinical needs.
• Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and cross-functional stakeholders to understand requirements, and provide creative, thoughtful solutions and build concise user-centric visions and journeys.
• Own and deliver interactions and designs across multiple platforms (i.e., patient cart and surgeon console interfaces), from wireframes, flow diagrams, and storyboards, to interactive designs and high fidelity prototypes to final product design specifications that will differentiate Vicarious Surgical
• Integrate user feedback, user research, and product metrics into all designs
• In this role, you will design for delight — creating clear, high-impact experiences that are welcoming and intuitive. You’ll work on information architectures, navigation models, and interfaces that shape the very way people perceive and understand our products.
• Ability to lead and grow user-centered design teams while maintaining responsibilities as an individual contributor
• Contribute to UX vision and strategy, build strong relationships generating buy-in and operationalizing strategy across larger teams and timelines.
• Advocate for the prioritization of design centered changes driven by user research, conduct refinements and improvements, and present concepts, proposals, and updates to executive stakeholders.
• Formalize our design component library and help establish criteria to govern its use, adoption, and evolution that are adoptable across teams.
• Maintain knowledge on current design trends and standards and how they may or may not apply for our products and our patients.
• Experience the products and user groups first-hand by undertaking shadowing visits in clinics and practices, and through training on the devices.

About You
• You have 4-6 years of progressively complexUI/UX design experience within a relevant technical environment
• BA or BS or higher degree in Industrial Design, Graphic Design, or related field
• You have an excellent online portfolio showcasing UX, UI and visual and typographic design work showing interactions between different systems
• You have mechanical aptitude, an affinity for consistency, color use, typography, and a keen eye for subtle details. While exercising a good eye for aesthetics, you are able to grasp and distill highly complex issues and translate them into clean, focused, understandable solutions.
• You are able to showcase your end-to-end design process across multiple projects, that include interaction and visual design artifacts, multiple iterations, high-fidelity prototypes, and application of existing design systems
• You have expertise in prototyping to test and demonstrate interactions, flows and component functionality

title: Principal User Experience Designer
via: via Jobs And Careers At Carrier
description:
Date Posted:
2022-09-13-07:00
...
Country:
United States of America

Location:
CAM60: Sensitech, Inc 800 Cummings Center, Beverly, MA, 01915 USA

Job Title: Principal User Experience Designer, (UXD)

Department: User Experience (UX)

Business: Sensitech, a division of Carrier Corporation

REPORTING RELATIONSHIPS

Position Reports To Director, User Experience (UX)

Department/Positions Supervised: N/A

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND BASIC DUTIES

The Opportunity:

Our customers come from all walks of life and so do we. We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just, because it is the right thing to do, but because it makes Sensitech stronger. If you share our values and our enthusiasm, you will find a home at Sensitech. At Sensitech, we take care of each other, value differences, win, and have fun. You will be joining a people-focused company as a member of a dynamic team shaping the future of our process and automation.

At Sensitech we value a user-centric approach at all stages of our product lifecycle from conception through design, development, and customer experience. We are looking for a dynamic UI/UX Designer to create easy-to-use business-to-business applications and mobile experiences involving big data enterprise systems and IoT hardware interactions.

The Principal UX Designer’s responsibilities include gathering user requirements, designing intuitive enterprise software, and mobile applications, creating visual styles, and conducting research to inform and validate the user experience.

To be successful in this role, you should have experience with user research, enterprise software design, and prototyping as well as a portfolio of professional design projects that include work with responsive web UI and mobile business applications. You will lead the creation of functional and appealing features that address our client's needs and help us grow our business through a user-centered approach to product design.

The Principal UX Designer works closely with a team including other UX/UI designers, UX researchers, product stakeholders, software engineering, and external teams.

Duties include, but are not limited to:

Project Lead Responsibilities:
• Lead designs through the full product design lifecycle on multiple projects and initiatives from early ideation, to detailed execution, through launch
• Facilitate user research, evaluate user feedback, report and document findings for stakeholders, and translate findings into actionable requirements
• Manage a collection of customer insights and gather data to deepen our understanding of user needs, behaviors, and mental models
• Collaborate to define innovation activities for future initiatives and product ideas
• Present design reviews and innovation concepts to cross-functional teams
• Provide guidance and mentorship to other team members in UI and UX design best practices including Jr. team members, Co-Op Students, and interns.
• Collaboration is key… Must be skilled in leading design discussions to foster a collaborative approach to advising stakeholders, requirements collection, solution review, and ongoing feedback.
• Develop, document, and promote design guidelines, best practices, and standards across the product portfolio, working with stakeholders and product teams. Manage design pattern systems.
• Build a deep understanding of business goals to help drive results. Challenge the goals when necessary to align with the user’s needs.
• Perform out-of-the-box design thinking, collaborate with others, and make a difference every day!

Direct Responsibilities:
• Gather, inform, and evaluate requirements in collaboration with cross-functional teams
• Demonstrate interaction and design ideas using storyboards, journey maps, and prototypes
• Design graphical user interface elements and build out pages and navigational components
• Develop UI mockups and prototypes that clearly illustrate how products look and behave
• Define complex data visualizations that communicate clearly to end users
• Create original graphic design elements (e.g. images, icons, and other graphics)
• In collaboration with Product Management, prepare and present design solutions to stakeholders
• Identify and troubleshoot UX problems (e.g. responsiveness, findability, configuration tools, etc.)
• Propose opportunities for improvement based on user feedback and research
• Evaluate UX effectiveness of current mobile applications

QUALIFICATIONS

ESSENTIAL KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS:
• BS in Interaction Design, Human Factors (HCI), Computer Science, or relevant field
• 8+ years of proven experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar role
• Portfolio of design projects highlighting design for mobile applications & enterprise software
• Up-to-date knowledge of design and wireframe tools (e.g. Axure, Figma, Adobe)
• Experience with IoT hardware device usability is a plus
• Engaged team player; strong communication and listening skills to collaborate with various stakeholders including executives, sales and support teams, and end users.
• Ability to work well with ambiguity or when requirements are changing
• Proven experience showing a clear understanding of the intersection between user needs, technology requirements, and business goals
• Artistic eye for design and ability to think creatively while maintaining accuracy and attention to detail
• Strong problem-solving and innovation ability
• Excellent organizational, time, and project management skills
• An understanding of the latest design and technology trends and their role in a commercial environment
• Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process

TRAVEL:
• Ability and willingness for periodic travel are expected to support user research

EH&S REQUIREMENTS
• Comply with the EH&S Policy and applicable regulatory and company EH&S rules and requirements
• Report to supervision conditions or practices that are either unsafe or that may adversely impact the environment, to ensure prompt resolution of potential hazards
• Attend a scheduled EH&S training program
• Actively support the organization’s efforts to meet or exceed EH&S goals and plans
• Recommend improved EH&S practices

Carrier is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age, or any other federally protected class.

title: Senior UI/UX Design
description:

title: UI/UX Designer (Virtual + Augmented Reality)
description:
Three Space Lab (3SL) is an early-stage MIT Media Lab spin-off company working on mixed reality software solutions for team collaboration and learning. The current portfolio of projects is divided between these two areas, while sharing a common infrastructure across all of them. On the education side, we make tools and content for middle school, high school, and university-level learning, with an... emphasis on STEM. Our approach is centered around interactive spatial visualization and simulation. On the team collaboration side, we are building a product that we plan to release in summer of 2022. Past company projects have focused on electricity and magnetism, crystal structures, 3D scanning, and tools for collaborative visual design.

We are math and physics geeks with an artsy side (dance, drawing, music), and we welcome people of any gender, race, ethnicity, color, ability, class, religion, culture, or nationality. We believe that working with people who have diverse perspectives, experiences, and backgrounds enhances our ideas, enriches our lives as individuals and as a team, and is invaluable for understanding how we can best have a positive impact.

Three Space Lab is seeking a UI/UX Designer collaboratively envision and implement innovative interfaces for mixed reality products related to team collaboration and learning. The ideal candidate should have experience with 3D and immersive interaction design, along with the related asset pipelines, including dynamic, algorithmic representations for UI elements. The ability to maintain design consistency across a portfolio of related projects is essential. Candidates should also be enthusiastic about sharing their process and design rationale with other team members.

Responsibilities:
• Facilitate development of a unified UI/UX system for 3SL's VR and AR applications
• Prototyping and creation of interactive assets for VR applications in collaboration with other development team members

Top Priority Attributes:
• Bachelor's degree in art and/or design (or equivalent work experience)
• Experience with UI/UX design
• Skilled at communicating their design rationales, responding to and integrating feedback
• Experience creating interactive assets for VR applications
• Familiarity with industry-grade modeling tools such as Blender or Maya
• Experience working with design teams on 3D and/or VR assets

To apply, please submit:
• CV/Resume with link to online portfolio, if possible
• Cover letter (optional)

We are open to a fully remote team model. Special places for us are Cambridge, MA and Berlin, Germany,

Benefits: Salary and benefits are competitive.

At Three Space lab, we don't just accept difference—we celebrate and support it. Not only because it's the right thing to do, but because we draw on the differences in who we are, what we've experienced, and how we think to make Three Space Lab thrive. Three Space Lab is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, protected veteran status, and any other characteristic protected under applicable State or Federal laws and regulations

title: Ui ux designer
description:
ABOUT US :

Braintrust is the only network that gives in-demand talent all the freedom of freelance with all the benefits, community and stability of a full-time role...

As the first decentralized talent network, our revolutionary Web3 model ensures the community that relies on Braintrust to find work are the same people who own and build it through the blockchain token, BTRST.

So unlike other marketplaces that take 20% to 50% of talent earnings, Braintrust allows talent to keep 100% of earnings and to vote on key changes to improve the network.

Braintrust is working to change the way freelance works for good.
• JOB TYPE : Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies / C2C - see notes below)
• LOCATION : Remote - Work from anywhere
• HOURLY RANGE : Our client is looking to pay $30 $40 / hr

About The Role

Our client is looking for a UI / UX designer to join their team part-time. To apply you must be familiar with common UI design patterns, have experience creating wireframes and prototypes and have a basic understanding of HTML, CSS, JS.

You will be working closely with their main UI / UX designer to implement design systems throughout Keyo’s products as well as create new product screens and add to their UI Kit.

You will also be supporting QA / QC in quality control.

Key Responsibilities :
• Implement design systems
• UI / UX Design
• UI Kit Design System Addition
• Proactively pitch ideas for UI / UX Changes

About You
• 1-3 years experience in UI / UX design
• Proficient in Figma
• Willingness to learn new trends and bring ideas to the team
• Proactive and thoughtful communicator
• Highly motivated and able to operate without any hand-holding or micromanagement
• Must be fluent in English - Spanish / Ukrainian is a plus

To Apply

Please submit your design portfolio with UI / UX projects.

About Our Client :

They are building a company that reflects the world in which they want to live. One where they can enjoy the convenience of biometrics without compromising their privacy or personal freedom.

To make this a reality, their technology allows businesses of all kinds to adopt biometric authentication quickly and easily.

With Keyo, people are clocking into work, paying for a coffee, and unlocking doors with a wave of their hand. The team is remote first, by design.

Their talented employees work from all over the world because they want Keyo to reflect the people who use it : global citizens who bring their diverse perspectives to solve unique problems.

They are at an exciting juncture and looking for new voices and ideas to continue building their vision for the company. They believe that the things that make them unique are their greatest strengths.

Our client has an inclusive, global, remote-first workplace that comprises people from all different lifestyles, backgrounds, abilities, and nationalities.

Apply Now!

ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS :

Qualified candidates will be invited to do a screening interview with the Braintrust staff. We will answer your questions about the project, and our platform.

If we determine it is the right fit for both parties, we'll invite you to join the platform and create a profile to apply directly for this project.

C2C Candidates : This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC / corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.

Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: User Experience Designer Intern - Graduate Students
description:

MathWorks has a hybrid work model that enables staff members to split their time between office and home. The hybrid model provides the advantage of having both in-person time with colleagues and flexible at-home life optimizations. Learn More: https://www.mathworks.com/company/jobs/resources/hybrid-model.html...

Are you looking for Spring, Summer or Fall 2022 UI and UX Designer internship?

We are looking for a highly motivated individual to work with members of a cross-functional development team to help design user interactions and improve user experience.

As an intern, you will receive a combination of practical experience and training in a work environment that fosters and rewards cooperation, teamwork, learning, and fun.

This internship will prepare you for a career at MathWorks starting in our Engineering Development Group (EDG).

MathWorks nurtures growth, appreciates diversity, encourages initiative, values teamwork, shares success, and rewards excellence.

After training on MathWorks development processes and tools, you will work with the User Experience team on projects to
• Drive the full user-centered design lifecycle, from concepting through final visual design.

• Translate requirements into storyboards, user flows, wireframes, and visual design mockups to effectively conceptualize and communicate detailed interaction behaviors.
• Participate in user research, usability tests and other evaluation activities.
• Help the team interpret and understand user feedback and provide recommendations to design decisions based on that feedback.
• Research and showcase knowledge in industry trends and the latest technologies across a variety of platforms.
• Contribute to requirements and design documents.

title: UX/UI Manager
description:
Demiurge is searching for an experienced UX designer/UI artist to manage and guide our talented UX team through their career development. You have led teams and mentored individuals carefully over years, balancing project needs and individual growth. You are a diligent student of the best and newest game interface, across all platforms. You're comfortable making a wireframe, creating the perfect... 'play' button, or picking fonts for a UI style guide. And you're an empathetic soul who intuits how interfaces can frustrate or delight our players.

At Demiurge you'll find a stable studio with an amazing, collaborative culture and a deep respect for UX in our mobile games. Our dedication to sane and sustainable development is well known in the Boston game community. We're working on exciting new projects with tons of fascinating UI challenges and opportunities. This is a great opportunity to flex your skills and develop new ones - join us!

Please note, relocation assistance to Massachusetts or remote work within the United States may be available for this role.
Primary Responsibilities:
• Guide and grow a team of UX/UI designers
• Work closely with design and engineering to establish UI development pipelines and feature requirements
• Share your techniques and mentor folks
• Provide direction for external artists/teams
Qualifications:
• 1+ shipped title as UX Lead
• 5+ years experience working on Game UX and UI
• Leadership history on prior projects
• Excellent personal, written and oral communication skills
• Broad knowledge of the many requirements and steps involved in delivering high quality interface art
• Skilled with industry tools: Illustrator, XD, Figma, Photoshop, Sketch
• Experience working in game engines: Unreal, Unity, or equivalent
• Portfolio or demo reel that demonstrates breadth of skill, styles, genres
• 3+ years game industry employment
• Must be eligible to work in United States
Preference To Applicants With:
• Experience in mobile, console, and pc interface development
• 2+ shipped titles
• Love for games, and who play them regularly
• Outside interests!
About Us:

A steadily growing game production studio located in Boston, MA. Developing games is our passion and we bring over 20 years of expertise to our projects. The teams at Demiurge build fun, accessible games like our hit, Marvel Puzzle Quest. We also provide co-development services to larger, best-in-industry games such as Hearthstone, Bioshock, Rock Band, and Mass Effect. Now is a great time to join Demiurge, as we are about to begin development on our next hit game!

Demiurge Studios is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to diversity, equity and inclusion. title: Lead UX Designer
description:
Fairmarkit is the intelligent sourcing platform that empowers organizations to more efficiently purchase the goods and services they need. By equipping procurement and supply-chain teams with automation and data, Fairmarkit promotes competitive bidding while reducing manual work within existing processes. Fairmarkit has been recognized with awards by organizations such as Gartner and IDC, and is... backed by strategic investors like GGV Capital, Insight Partners, 1984.VC, and Newfund.

Headquartered in Boston, and backed by a $35.6M Series C led by OMERS Growth Equity, with participation from GGV Capital, Insight Partners, Highland Capital Partners, and ServiceNow, we are looking for exceptional candidates who want to help grow our company into a global enterprise and make their mark on the B2B tech industry. Come soar to new heights with us!

Fairmarkit is looking for an experienced, talented, and motivated leader for our UX design team, who will guide high-quality experiences for our end users. In this role, you will work to create new design patterns and guidelines while collaborating with cross-disciplinary teams to bring your visions to life. You’ll have the opportunity to shape the user experience in meaningful and ethical ways, making life better for our end users and customers. You know how to work collaboratively with customers, Product Management, Engineering, and others to create UX designs. As a leader, you will lead a team of UX designers, nurture their career and establish key UX processes within the organization. You are ultimately responsible for the complete lifecycle of the design experience across Fairmarkit’s platform and take pride in delivering excellent experiences that enable our customers to achieve their goals.

If you are a problem-solver who can deliver quality content, then this may be your perfect opportunity to take your career to the next level on an agile team at a fast-growing company. This is a great opportunity to be a critical part of an innovative, fast-growing team.

Responsibilities

Here’s what you will be doing:
• Understand all the core user journeys and business processes that Fairmarkit automates; Design optimal user experiences that help our end users to effectively automate their tasks on Fairmarkit’s platform.
• Create compelling user journeys, wireframes, detailed UX flows, pixel perfect screens, and prototypes that show micro interactions and full experiences.
• Create user-centered designs by considering market analysis, data, customer feedback, user research and technical constraints/opportunities
• Validate and iterate on your design solutions through feedback sessions, usability lab testing, live testing.
• Conduct user interviews and UX research by helping recruit participants, run research, and report on all aspects of customer feedback. This user research should include concept testing, usability testing, and customer/user feedback
• Continuously maintain a high awareness of market/competition UX design, and overall design of our unannounced product details to design and lead the delivery of best in class UX with assigned UI team.
• Perform UX audits and tests to iterate over existing designs and optimize the user experience on a recurring basis
• Create and facilitate an environment, process and design system that supports consistent UX principles and processes across devices and channels.
• Help teams to translate deep technical conversations through a lens of user needs; You have the tenacity and creativity to work through ambiguity and tell the story of what’s possible.
• Contribute to and shape our design team’s platform style guide, tools and practices to scale our impact across the organization.
• Ensure active collaboration with cross-functional teams within Fairmarkit including engineering, product management, technical writers, and support.
• You proactively respond to and seek documentation feedback from internal and external customers.

Key Competencies
• 6+ years of experience with UX design
• Past experience in managing teams of 2 or more UX designers
• Background in HCI, Design, or a related field; Know the theory behind interaction design, and are an expert at using design tools like Figma to translate ideas into working products
• An expert in hands-on knowledge for creating a powerful UX/UI for enterprise SaaS applications
• Should be able to work in result driven environment with data driven approach
• Proficient with rapid prototyping and visualization tools such as Figma, Sketch, Invision, Adobe CC, and similar design tools
• Strong problem solving skills
• Good verbal, written, and listening communication skills
• Ability to empathize with the customer
• Strong understanding of agile software development
• Excellent cross-functional collaboration and communication skills

title: UX Designer (iOS)
description:
Lose It! is looking for a UX Designer to help improve the experience of our top-rated iOS app. We’re looking for a self-starter with a blend of interaction design, visual design, and prototyping skills that loves trying new ideas and iterating until the design is just right. An ideal candidate is empathetic, resourceful, and has a strong point of view. This person is a problem solver that can... rally stakeholders around their designs. This role will report to the VP of Product and work directly with product managers and engineers to deliver effective, easy-to-use experiences to our members. Come join an exciting environment where you can design a product that helps millions of users live healthier lives.

This full-time position is located in our Boston office (currently remote, with plans to be in the office two days a week by Summer 2022).

What will you be responsible for?
• Create designs for new features of our iOS app while working closely with product managers and engineers
• Understand the value behind product decisions and design for usuability
• Identify design gaps and inconsistencies in our iOS app and become an advocate for design quality
• Collaborate with the Android UX designer to ensure parity and clarity across platforms
• Establish iOS design standards and conventions that make front-end development more efficient

What are we looking for in a team member?
• 2+ years of experience designing iOS apps
• Advanced knowledge of user-centered design principles
• A good grasp of iOS design standards and conventions
• Demonstrable fluency with Photoshop or Figma
• Deep understanding of interaction design in addition to aesthetics
• Strong collaborative skills and ability to adjust designs to technical feasibility
• Ability to manage through conflicting priorities, ambiguity, and conflict to deliver great designs
• A positive attitude and the ability to resolve issues with best practices
• Someone who lives the Lose It! Values of being Purpose Driven, Humble, Inclusive, Transparent, An Owner, and Results Oriented
• Experience working with consumer-facing apps is a plus
• Passion for health and wellness is a plus
• Lose It! focuses on Mobile, Fitness, Personal Health, and Mobile Health. Their company has offices in Boston. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees. To date, Lose It! has raised $5.5M of funding; their latest round was closed on February 2012.

You can view their website at http://www.loseit.com/ or find them on Twitter, Facebook, and LinkedIn

title: Lead UI/UX Designer
Lead UI/UX Designer Role ( Marketing Platform Corporation )
description:
Job Description

This company is hiring a Lead UI/UX Designer to join their team in a remote role. They provide a platform for B2B marketing clients to host virtual events, things as webinars, virtual summits, and company meetings. The other part is data analytics and insights from their events to understand and measure customer engagement. These companies' approach to design is fascinating as... they emphasize user research and designing around their problems to improve usability and a coding aspect, in which designers’ author and test code for high resolution.

The ideal candidate for this position will be able to visualize an experience in the abstract, break down complex use cases and then drive the vision into solid design deliverables. You think first from the customer's perspective, use research and data to influence your designs, set relentlessly high standards for yourself, and deliver best-in-class customer experiences.

Required Skills & Experience
• A degree or background in design with 4+ years of experience in delivering design solutions as a UI/UX designer.
• Has a portfolio that demonstrates a firm grasp of visual design principles, the ability to solve user problems and experience creating design deliverables for product development.
• Has experience in agile product development and UI design across desktop and mobile.
• Willingness to work hands-on to build and deliver delightful designs, as well as mentor and lead a team of designers. This role will start as an individual contributor but grow quickly to lead a team of designers.
• Need HTML and CSS ability, High Fidelity, and Prototypes.

Desired Skills & Experience
• Familiarity with the technical considerations needed when designing, and experience collaborating with product managers and engineers to bring designs to life through the full product life cycle.

What You Will Be Doing

Tech Breakdown
• As a UI/UX Designer, you will collaborate with product managers, engineers, and other designers and together you will optimize product experiences that drive revenue and improve retention.
• You will own Goldcast’s user experience and visual design language and advocate for an exceptional user experience as part of a fully remote team that values experimentation, iteration, and a willingness to take risks.

You will receive the following benefits:
• Medical Insurance
• Dental Benefits
• Vision Benefits
• Paid Time Off (PTO)
• 401(k)
• Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the US on a full-time basis now and in the future.

Research show that women and underrepresented groups only apply to jobs only if they feel they meet 100% of the qualifications. Motion Recruitment encourages you to break that statistic and apply. No one ever meets all the qualifications. We look forward to your application.

Motion Recruitment provides IT Staffing Solutions (Contract, Contract-to-Hire, and Direct Hire) across 11 major North American markets. Our unique expertise in today’s highest demand tech skill sets, paired with our deep networks and knowledge of our local technology markets, results in an exemplary track record with candidates and clients.

title: User Experience and User Interface (UX/UI) Design
description:
By clicking the “Apply” button, I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that the information I provide in my application will be processed in line with Takeda’sPrivacy Noticeand Terms of Use. I further attest that all information I submit in my employment application is true to the best of my knowledge.

Job Description...

At Takeda, we are a forward-looking, world-class R&D organization that unlocks innovation and delivers transformative therapies to patients. By focusing R&D efforts on four therapeutic areas and other targeted investments, we push the boundaries of what is possible in order to bring life-changing therapies to patients worldwide.

Join Takeda as a User Experience and User Interface (UX/UI) Design where you will support the user-centered design of medical devices and combination products. You will also harness user needs, product requirements, and usability evaluation as inputs into the design and development of the product user interface, such as hardware, software, and instructional materials to support the safe and effective use of the product for the intended use by the intended users in the anticipated use environment. You will manage UX Research planning and execution, UX/UI design conceptualization, prototyping, testing, and evaluation. As part of the UI/UX, you will report to Associate Director, User Experience and User Interface (UI/UX) Design Lead.

How you will contribute:
• Design User Interfaces for print and digital platforms.
• Develop research strategy.
• Conduct user experience research.
• Visualize data from research.
• Mapping user experience.
• Translating user needs into user experience and interface requirements.
• Visualize design ideas through sketches and digital renderings.
• Evaluate user interface concepts iteratively.
• Build low and high-fidelity wireframes and prototypes.
• Create medical illustrations and animations.
• Contribute to a design system and guidelines.
• Provide empirical UX design insights for product development.
• Collaborate cross-functionally with engineering, packaging, labeling, quality, clinical & medical affairs, regulatory affairs, commercial, legal, and purchasing.

Minimum Requirements/Qualifications:
• B.S. in UX Design / Industrial Design / Information Design / Human Factors Engineering, and a minimum of 4 years of UX/UI Design experience or
• M.S. in UX Design / Industrial Design / Information Design / Human Factors Engineering, and a minimum of 2 years of UX/UI Design experience.
• A UX/UI Design portfolio is required.
• Experience working on MS Windows with Adobe CC Suite is required.
• Experience working with Figma and Axure is preferred.
• Experience working in safety-regulated environments such as Healthcare technology is preferred.
• This position may require up to 15% yearly travel, including domestic and international.

What Takeda can offer you:
• Comprehensive Healthcare: Medical, Dental, and Vision
• Financial Planning & Stability: 401(k) with company match and Annual Retirement Contribution Plan
• Health & Wellness programs including onsite flu shots and health screenings
• Generous time off for vacation and the option to purchase additional vacation days
• Community Outreach Programs and company match of charitable contributions
• Family Planning Support
• Flexible Work Paths
• Tuition reimbursement

More about us:

At Takeda, we are transforming patient care through the development of novel specialty pharmaceuticals and best in class patient support programs. Takeda is a patient-focused company that will inspire and empower you to grow through life-changing work.

Certified as a Global Top Employer, Takeda offers stimulating careers, encourages innovation, and strives for excellence in everything we do. We foster an inclusive, collaborative workplace, in which our teams are united by an unwavering commitment to deliver Better Health and a Brighter Future to people around the world.

Base Salary Range: $79,800 to $114,000, based on candidate professional experience level. Employees may also be eligible for Short Term and Long-Term Incentive benefits as well. Employees are eligible to participate in Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, 401(k), Charitable Contribution Match, Holidays, Personal Days & Vacation, Tuition Reimbursement Program and Paid Volunteer Time Off.

In accordance with the CO Equal Pay Act, Colorado Applicants Are Not Permitted to Apply.

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
Job Requisition ID #

22WD64556...

Position Overview

At Autodesk Construction Solutions, our mission is to help teams meet the world’s rapidly expanding building and infrastructure needs, while making construction more predictable, safe and sustainable. Over $100 billion in new construction is managed on our platform every month. From major stadiums to local schools and hospitals, our tools are helping cities grow and communities come together.

As a Senior UX Designer, you will collaborate with your Product Management and Engineering partners to support our Takeoff & Estimating products in the Autodesk Construction Cloud ecosystem. You will help shape the tools that enable our customers to efficiently and safely build the world around us. We’re looking for someone who is a champion for human-centered design, a relentless advocate for user needs, and has a track record of driving design strategy in complex problem spaces to deliver compelling user experiences.

This position can be based in the United States or Canada. Please include resume, portfolio and password when applying.

Responsibilities
• Partner with product managers, engineers, researchers and other designers to define great experiences from initial concept through successful implementation
• Visualize and prototype intended solutions at various levels of fidelity including high-level wireframes, conceptual designs, design presentations and detailed specifications
• Collaborate closely with one or more local or remote Agile Scrum teams, working iteratively to deliver customer value
• Use customer insights that come from analytics and customer interactions to help inform business and design decisions
• Help to facilitate and participate in user research like interviews and usability testing to validate designs and make iterative improvements
• Contribute to efforts to create scalable experience design standards and improve design processes
• Participate in and lead design-thinking exercises to break through organizational silos and collaboratively solve complex design challenges​

Minimum Qualifications
• 5+ years of related professional experience
• Quality portfolio of recent work
• Excellent communication and storytelling skills, with the ability to distill complex ideas to their essence
• Demonstrable experience utilizing a variety of human-centered design methods and best practices
• Understanding of task analysis, experience mapping, low-fidelity prototyping, user testing and more. And you know how to choose the right tool at the right time to drive results
• Experience leveraging research and data to inform design decisions, and comfortable defining performance metrics to measure results
• Experience leading user research - interviews, ethnography, user testing, etc.
• Comfortable in a highly collaborative, fast-paced environment with multiple stakeholders, and can adjust to changing priorities​

Preferred Qualifications
• BA/BS or graduate degree in HCI, interaction design, or equivalent experience
• Experience with agile software design methods
• Experience supporting a complex ecosystem with multiple products
• Comfortable working on a distributed team and collaborating remotely​

The Ideal Candidate
• Passionate about designing things people love to use
• Brave in the face of complexity and adversity
• Positive, can-do approach that invites collaboration
• Takes the lead on projects with minimal oversight
• Leans into complex problem spaces and proactively engages with teammates to drive towards shared understanding and clarity
• Brings expertise and experience to the team and makes others around them better by sharing best practices, ideas and feedback
• Naturally curious and proactively asks questions to increase understanding of customer needs and business strategy
• Works to develop empathy for customers and is a strong advocate for their needs
• A systems thinker – loves exploring how different parts of a complex system fit together and can be made to work seamlessly
• Seeks feedback on designs, and provides thoughtful feedback to others

title: UI – UX Designer
description:
Remote UI/UX Designer

Location: Anywhere...

Full-time

Allows Remote

Are you on the hunt for exciting new challenges that boost your professional growth? If you’re an innovator by nature and a UX/UI Designer by trade, we’d love to hear from you! Read on to see if you’d be a good fit for the Scopic team of 250+ professionals from over 40 countries.

At Scopic, the virtual world is our home so this is a full-time remote position. Only apply if you’re prepared for the zero-hour commute and the thought of collaborating with colleagues from around the globe excites you!

What your day-to-day will look like:
• Design beautiful, thoughtful, and scalable interfaces for consumer and enterprise products
• Define, communicate, and get buy-in on UI/UX best practices with stakeholders across Engineering and Product
• Evolve high-level visual concepts into pixel-perfect designs (with whiteboarding and mock-ups in between!)
• Be the user-advocate, while working to align stakeholder goals and product requirements
• Gather key insights through data and user analysis to find users’ unmet & unspoken needs
• Document UI/UX requirements and interactions to assist Product for development, training, and sales purposes
• Work closely with Product and Engineering to help build, test, and evaluate designs from idea to release
• Assist with training stakeholders during the Product roll-out process, providing support during the early stages of the launch

The skills and traits we’re looking for:
• Minimum 3+ years of Product UI/UX experience designing consumer and enterprise products
• Must have proven experience as a UI designer with strong visual design skills and the ability to create design systems
• Solid experience with responsive, mobile, and TV app design
• Experience in the media space preferred
• Strong understanding of UX design, knowledge of UX best practices, and the ability to create wireframes, user journeys and prototypes
• Proficient with industry standard tools (i.e., Figma, Sketch, Invision, Adobe Creative Suite)
• Ability to create high fidelity designs for hand-off and collaboration with developers
• Self-sufficient, able to manage projects in a fast-paced, continuous delivery environment
• Takes initiative, team player, thoughtful, and action-and-results oriented
• Strong communication, documentation, organization, and prioritization skills
• Willingness to dive into and understand technology, workflows and structure behind Deluxe’s software platforms, products and tools
• High command of verbal and written English with good communication and reporting skills
• Flexibility to work extended hours/weekends as needed

Important! Please remember to provide examples or portfolio of work with your application.

The secret ingredients that make us special:
• Your growth is our growth. We invest in your future with paid training and other professional opportunities.
• We’re industry innovators at the forefront of change. Equipped with the latest technologies and a team of knowledgeable colleagues by your side, you’ll embrace new and interesting challenges.
• Your location. Your schedule Pick your time-zone, choose your preferred hours, and work from the place where you feel most at home.
• Flexibility and freedom are in our DNA! As long as you have a stable internet connection and the drive to thrive, you can travel and work from anywhere you like.
• A workload you can rely on. We’ll set you enough tasks to keep that mind busy! At Scopic, we’ll ensure you always have a consistent flow of engaging, challenging work to do.
• Recognition and reward. We acknowledge diligence and hard work through annual pay increases for good performance.

Down to business!
• Salary Range: Negotiable based on skills and experience.
• Your starting salary is negotiable depending on your skills and experience.
• Both hourly and salary positions are available.
• Employees are paid monthly via wire transfer.

Our values:

Scopic is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, marital status, national origin, gender, veteran status, sexual orientation, age, or disability status.

Have the skills, the drive, and the passion to join the Scopic family?

Apply today to join our growing team of remote professionals from around the world

• Leadership history on prior projects
• Excellent personal, written and oral communication skills
• Broad knowledge of the many requirements and steps involved in delivering high quality interface art
• Skilled with industry tools: Illustrator, XD, Figma, Photoshop, Sketch
• Experience working in game engines: Unreal, Unity, or equivalent
• Portfolio or demo reel that demonstrates breadth of skill, styles, genres
• 3+ years game industry employment
• Must be eligible to work in United States

Preference To Applicants With:
• Experience in mobile, console, and pc interface development
• 2+ shipped titles
• Love for games, and who play them regularly
• Outside interests!

About Us:

A steadily growing game production studio located in Boston, MA. Developing games is our passion and we bring over 20 years of expertise to our projects. The teams at Demiurge build fun, accessible games like our hit, Marvel Puzzle Quest. We also provide co-development services to larger, best-in-industry games such as Hearthstone, Bioshock, Rock Band, and Mass Effect. Now is a great time to join Demiurge, as we are about to begin development on our next hit game!

Demiurge Studios is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to diversity, equity and inclusion. title: User Experience Design and Research Intern
via: via Jobs And Careers At Carrier
description:
Date Posted:
2022-08-19-07:00
...
Country:
United States of America

Location:
CAM60: Sensitech, Inc 800 Cummings Center, Beverly, MA, 01915 USA

User Experience Design and Research Intern

Reports to Director of User Experience, Sensitech

Built on Willis Carrier’s invention of modern air conditioning in 1902, Carrier is a leading provider of heating, ventilating, air conditioning and refrigeration systems, building controls and automation, and fire and security systems leading to safer, smarter, sustainable, and high-performance buildings. We constantly build upon our history of proven innovation with new products and services that improve global comfort and efficiency. Today, Carrier needs your talent to build upon this legacy and create solutions that matter for people and our planet!

We value a user-centric approach at all stages of our product lifecycle at Sensitech, from conception through design, development, and customer experience. Our UX Intern will be responsible for aiding and supporting our User Experience team with UX design, UI visual graphic design, wireframing, prototyping, and user research. The UX Intern will work closely with UX Designers, Researchers, Product Owners, and stakeholders to produce design assets and assist with research activities leading to the development and delivery of enterprise applications and mobile app software.

To be successful in this role you must display a genuine interest in the UX discipline, designing interactions, and conducting user research. You should be naturally inquisitive and comfortable working with people as part of a larger team. You must possess strong written and verbal skills to assist in delivering research findings through written, oral, and visual presentation methods.

We are seeking a motivated, results-oriented college student to join our team for the summer of 2023. The Carrier internship experience offers interns an environment that provides practical, challenging, and meaningful on-the-job work experience, and the opportunity to apply knowledge and demonstrate strengths in efforts to assist Carrier in achieving its business strategy.

As a User Experience Design and Research Intern, you will gain experience including, but not limited to duties and tasks listed below.

Duties include, but are not limited to:
• Conduct user research, evaluate user feedback, and present research findings
• Gather and evaluate UI/UX/Research requirements
• Demonstrate interaction and design ideas using storyboards, user flows, and prototypes
• Create original graphic designs (e.g., images, icons, and other graphics)
• Artistic eye for design and ability to think creatively while maintaining accuracy and attention to detail
• Collaboration is key. Must have an inquisitive and open nature to contribute to discussions and foster a collaborative approach to research and information gathering
• A true desire to learn new things, be engaged, and want to make a difference every day

Essential Knowledge and Skills
• Experience using design tools such as Adobe Creative Cloud, Axure, Sketch, or similar tools.
• Familiar with UX research methods and tools
• Working knowledge of CSS and JavaScript is a plus
• Engaged team player; strong communication and listening skills to collaborate with various stakeholders and teams
• Strong problem-solving and innovative thinking

Experience/Qualifications
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications
• Strong organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills
• Self-driven and proactive
• Ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities
• Ability to communicate effectively at all levels
• Team player and willing to collaborate with others on projects
• COVID-19 vaccines will be required for all newly hired Carrier U.S. Salaried employees

Education
• Must be currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree program, majoring in Human Factors (HCI), Interaction Design, or related field of study
• GPA must be greater than or equal to a 3.0 GPA
• Relevant coursework or previous internships preferred

title: UI/UX Web Designer
description:
Our Mission:
Jetsonify is a social event and travel planner that enables members to create crazy awesome experiences
...
Our Team:
Our team is made up of serial entrepreneurs including a Co-Founder & CEO, Co-Founder & CMO, Chief of Operations, and a Product Manager.

Our Environment:
Inspiring & Innovative
Trustworthy, Dependable and Committed
Cutting Edge Technology
Masters of Planning

Let’s face it. You’ve always dreamed of working with a start-up from the ground up where your brilliant design ideas could be applied to a wicked cool new product. We’re talking about a product that will not only revolutionize an industry, but more importantly for your sake, one that you and your friends will use, and one that you’ll be happy to brag about. Sound intriguing?

If you think you’ve got enough spunk and also possess some mad skills, keep reading.

We’re looking to bring on a talented UI/UX web designer with excellent HTML and CSS skills to join our dynamic team. The right individual will have experience designing User Interfaces for web and mobile applications, will have good typographical skills, a strong foundation in design principles, semantic markup, web standards. We’ll be looking for a solid and passionate designer who will enjoy leading the user experience efforts from interaction, usability, and graphic design all the way to HTML and CSS. They’ll also be focused on continuous UI improvement based on evolving requirements and customer feedback.

Within the context of a team, the designer will have prime responsibility for making sure the product being built provides an awesome user experience. This means communicating with the product manager, developers, and any other stakeholders to address concerns and then find solutions. While we stress the importance of functionality and usability, we still expect a high level of visual refinement to our products. An excellent understanding and use of grids, typography, color, etc. are essential for building quality, compelling products.

The UI designer creates prototypes and wireframes, works closely with project teams and product management, documents the design in technical specs, and creates UI code (HTML, CSS) that can be utilized by the development team. The UI designer will also ensure that the design is consistent throughout. Staying up to date with the latest UI technologies is second nature to the right candidate and they’ll also inherently possess the creativity to conceive new breakthrough UI approaches. Jetsonify is currently operating in “stealth mode” for the time being, but feel free to get in touch for more info if you think that you’re the rock star that we’re looking for.

Ideally we’d love for someone to join our team full time in Cambridge/Boston, MA. But seeing as how life is rarely ideal, we’d also be open to talking to designers in San Fran or Atlanta. If you’re reading this and you’re outside of these areas but still think you deserve a shot at the title, we’ll entertain your plea for working virtually if you make an impressive case for us to consider, in 3 sentences or less.

Duties/Responsibilities

• Design the User Interfaces for complex software applications for the web, desktop and mobile applications.
• Participate and lead design reviews.
• Develop detailed design specifications based on functional requirements and the created prototypes.
• Work with engineers and product manager to ensure the product is being developed as per the design specifications.
• Educate the organization in UI best practices and new technologies.
• Work with teams on early prototypes that help gather ideas and shape future product enhancements.

Required Skills/Education

• 3-5 years experience in UI design, user interaction, and/or UX design
• Highly skilled in HTML, CSS
• Expertise in usability

• Designing User Interfaces

title: Senior UX/UI Designer
description:
Senior UX/UI Designer

We are seeking an energetic, creative, organized, smart Senior UX/UI Designer to help us deliver amazing experiences to our customers and fundamentally change how they interact with their products or experiences. This person should be skilled in user-centered design principles to produce high-quality, inspiring visuals - from concept to execution - across multiple platforms... and/or creating easy-to-use user experiences out of complex workflows.

What You'll Do:
• Shape the product direction and design innovative solutions and experiences for our customers by working with your peers in research, product and engineering.
• Then wow them with beautiful, intuitive execution.
• Drive product teams to explore and articulate requirements to shape up architectural and navigational concepts.
• Conceptualize on how to bring simplicity and user-friendliness to complex workflows and design roadblocks.
• Wireframe, storyboard, layout user and process flows and create sitemaps to work through and share your interaction and design ideas with the team for feedback and iteration.
• Present and defend designs and key milestone deliverables to peers and executive-level stakeholders.
• Lead workshop activities around requirements gathering
• Improve overall design through design reviews with the UX team and other stakeholders that facilitates articulating the concepts behind the design work, and the team giving and receiving constructive feedback.
• Own and execute all visual design stages from concept to the final hand-off to development.
• Get in the heads of our users through speaking to internal and external customers (and prospective customers).
• Evaluate feedback on released product and designs to determine what to iterate on.
• Assist in the planning and scoping of new project leads

Qualifications:
• 5+ years of experience in designing great user experiences for products/services, with a mobile-first mentality.
• Up-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques and technologies.
• A passionate advocate for the user experience.
• Great communicator and listener.
• You are able to communicate design decisions effectively to all levels of stakeholders and are open to different perspectives and feedback to deliver a better experience.
• Someone who also understands the business side of design and execution.
• A portfolio with work demonstrating mastery of interaction design, user experience and visual design.
• A demonstrated sensitivity to user-system interaction.
• Demonstrated ability to create wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows and site maps.
• Proficiency in Creative Suite, Sketch, InVision, or other visual design, wireframing and prototyping tools.
• Proficiency in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for rapid prototyping.
• Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process.
• A creative problem solver able to see things from a different perspective and create the best solution.

More About Us

Essential Design, located in Boston, has developed an award-winning portfolio of products and services in collaboration with clients from consumer, commercial, and medical domains – ranging from start-ups to Fortune 500s. Our work bridges physical and digital products and services. As a result, our design team aims to enhance holistic user experiences. A cross-section of our recent work includes consumer products, professional equipment, medical devices, health and wellness platforms/communities, ‘green' building initiatives, and athletic performance monitoring systems. Our office is a casual, loft-like, studio atmosphere with very convenient access to public transit.

Essential provides competitive compensation and benefits packages

title: Manager, UI/UX Design
description:
Xylem |ˈzīləm|

1) The tissue in plants that brings water upward from the roots...

2) a leading global water technology company.

We’re a global team unified in a common purpose: creating advanced technology solutions to the world’s water challenges. Developing new technologies that will improve the way water is used, conserved, and re-used in the future is central to our work. Our products and services move, treat, analyze, monitor and return water to the environment, in public utility, industrial, residential and commercial building services settings. Xylem also provides a leading portfolio of smart metering, network technologies and advanced analytics solutions for water, electric and gas utilities. In more than 150 countries, we have strong, long-standing relationships with customers who know us for our powerful combination of leading product brands and applications expertise with a strong focus on developing comprehensive, sustainable solutions. For more information, please visit us at www.xylem.com

If you are excited and passionate about helping us solve water, we want to hear from you!

The Role: Xylem is looking for a UI / UX Manager to lead our distributed and growing group of designers and continue to evolve our company wide design standards.

You will work alongside engineers, product managers, and other designers to create simple and powerful products. You should have a keen eye for detail and color, an ability to ask the right questions and know when to ask them, stellar communication skills, and a passion for creating products that balance simplicity and intuitiveness with complex data across a variety of devices.

You should also be able to effectively lead and mentor a team of designers in different time zones, providing feedback, strategy and direction, ensuring adoption of our design standards and design support across the organization.

Xylem is focused on helping utility companies to understand their data in order to reduce costs and improve their operation. We’re looking for people who are passionate about design, patient and confident in their communication, and who change directions quickly. If this sounds like you, then we want to talk!

Essential Duties/Principal Responsibilities:
• Lead a global team of designers working across our entire business, who will need support and direction to be effective.
• Recruit and support designers in their career.
• Lead the visual direction of our global design standards for the entire organization, including leading our design system team, and creating and documenting necessary patterns and components to support our business.
• Work collaboratively with designers, product managers and engineers to deliver compelling solutions for our users.
• Design and communicate intuitive user experiences through a deep understanding of the problem, our customer’s, and their needs. You consider problems from multiple angles and explore different approaches until you’ve identified the best solution.
• Demonstrate an ability to know how and when to conduct user and market research, and understand how to look at the results.
• Create low fidelity wireframes to communicate early stage concepts, create high fidelity mockups to communicate final ideas, and all of the other things in-between.
• Partner with the design team to develop, follow, and promote long term UX design thinking and guidelines.
• Lead the continued architecture of a design pipeline of tools and workflows streamlining the efforts of designers and engineers.

Minimum Qualifications: Education, Experience, Skills, Abilities, License/Certification:
• BA/BS degree or equivalent work experience
• 5 + years experience as a UX designer or similar.
• Previous experience leading a design team.
• You feel confident presenting your designs to peers and executive level stakeholders.
• You can demonstrate and communicate your UI/UX design skills with a strong portfolio.
• Experience creating prototypes that satisfy the different needs that arise through the life or a project, and enjoy all stages of app design, from sketching to polishing
• Highly proficient in Figma or similar design tools (Sketch, Adobe XD, etc).
• You’re up-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologies.
• Experience with Agile/Scrum.
• You are a fantastic team player, communicator and facilitator and enjoy working with others to solve complex problems

Physical Demands:

(The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.)
• Regularly required to sit or stand, reach, bend and move about the facility

Work Environment:

(The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.)
• Office: Standard office equipment; work usually performed in an office setting free from any disagreeable elements.
• Standard weekly job hours: 40 hours

Xylem is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. A reasonable estimate of the current range is $130,000 to $160,000 plus bonus. At Xylem, it is not typical for an individual to start at the top end of the range for the role however compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. We offer a generous benefit package, including Medical, Dental, Vision plans, 401(k) with company contribution, paid time off, paid parental leave and tuition reimbursement
