title: UX Design Manager
description:
Description

UX Design Manager

Green Pixel Studios is charged with pushing the envelope on user experience design in digital. This role will help set the stage for the evolution of user experience in financial services. We're looking for someone who is passionate about envisioning experiences that push imaginative solutions to enable the bank's clients to fulfill their financial dreams.

The UX Design Manager will work as part of the User Experience Studio's extended leadership team within the Enterprise Experience Division to create best in class digital experiences. The ideal candidate should have design expertise and possess superior UX/UI skills. The position will manage a team of UX designers that contribute to creating and aligning user experience across a variety of platforms and devices for Citizens. This individual will help solve complex problems to improve the team's development and will play a strategic role creating the vision, designing, and continuously expanding the... Citizens Design System.

Qualifications

Primary responsibilities:
• Mentoring, motivating, coaching, and managing user experience design colleagues
• Being accountable for the performance, quality control, and the results of a group of UX designers
• Assisting an experience journey leader at a full journey or component experience level through supporting growth and development of UX design resources deployed to work in those journey areas.
• Helping identify any issues impeding the UX design talent and recommending plans of action to remediate
• Ability to coach development and standards across multiple UX designers to support growth in t-shaped UX skills.
• Collaborate with internal and external partners to conceptualize ideas and implement compelling customer-focused solutions across all digital touch points
• Support resources working with complex problems in product and journey areas.
• Coach and expand a UX team of designers that work in an agile environment supporting upskilling and common experience standards across ways of working
• Ability to build a UX design talent pipeline
• Motivate, inspire, and influence others in the organization to engage with design thinking and best UX practices
• Ability to conduct UX workshops and design sprints utilizing multiple techniques and influence cross functional colleagues to understand and support superior experience Participates in identifying and defining strategic initiatives to support ux designer development and supporting further ways of working improvement for designs working across distributed agile teams

Qualifications:

Required Skills/Experience:
• 3+ years in team management
• Have at least 8+ years in UX Design
• Proven UX/UI experience with a strong portfolio
• Proficiency with design in Figma
• Ability to present your designs and sell your solutions to various stakeholders
• A broad understanding of web/mobile UI standards, usability, and practical experience in design and development of user interfaces for web and mobile applications.
• Strong prioritization skills and ability to quickly re-prioritize in a dynamic environment, manage multiple projects at the same level of detail
• Knowledge of ADA standards for UI
• Bachelor's Degree in design, human-computer interaction (HCI), or equivalent professional experience
• Experience with Agile Development strongly preferred

Hours & Work Schedule
• Hours per Week: 40
• Work Schedule: Mon-Fri, 8:30 - 5:00

title: UX Designer
description:
Company Description

Founded on a simple belief – do what’s right for our clients and our people. TrueBridge leverages proven talent identification / attraction / screening solutions to match highly qualified IT and business professionals with great opportunities...

We made the Staffing Industry Analyst's 'Fastest Growing'​ list in 2013 and 2014

Job Description

This position requires a creative, senior-level visual designer with mastery in digital site design. Candidates should possess a strong background in user experience, digital design and a demonstrated ability to produce clean and simple layouts and components that solve users’ needs.

As part of the UX visual design team, the successful candidate will lead multiple interactive projects, supervise day-to-day maintenance of existing experiences, and generate design through the use of appropriate tools, resources and processes. The candidate will collaborate with and lead internal team members (management, information architecture, copywriting, development, testing) and vendors.

Responsibilities:

• Act as the senior visual lead, working with designers, IA, Content, and/or Prototyping directly, to deliver the visual design of the user experience.

• Create documentation to help communicate the experience to the project team, UX team and prototyping team

• Present and explain design thinking in critiques and creative review discussions or in front of business partners

• Design with the style guide, brand and best user experience in mind

• Manage design workflow and timelines to ensure accurate and timely delivery of projects

• Organize regular discussions with leadership about project, team and design health

• Drive a passion about UX work and stay on top of UX / UI trends and tools

• Show desire to iterate on design, while having the ability to finish a project on time

Qualifications

Core Competency Requirements:

• Advanced knowledge and skill in using Photoshop and/or Fireworks. Should have experience with Illustrator, InDesign, and other software (online and native) to design

• Ability to communicate design effectiveness and efficiency at project team, internal, partner and executive briefings.

Experience & Skills Requirements:

• 5+ years of experience as a Visual Designer, Graphic Designer, User Experience Designer, or similar role.

• Experience with multi-device design and responsive design.

• Well-versed in visual design fundamentals, typography, color theory, brand communication and UI principles.

• Understanding and experience with concepts of HTML and CSS.

• Strong verbal and visual communication, written communication, interpersonal and presentation skills.

• Financial industry experience required.

Experience & Qualifications:

• A Bachelor's Degree in Art, Design, Human Factors, Interaction, Graphic or Interface Design. Master’s Degree a plus.

• Experience designing for the social web, design patterns, rich Internet applications and delivery methodologies.

• A passion for being the voice of the user and a proven track-record building user-centric solutions.

• Leader using the latest design trends and industry standards.

• Ability to cut through ambiguity and use good organizational skills.

• Experience working with teams in multiple software project methods such as Waterfall SDLC and Agile.

• Online portfolio displaying a firm understanding of user-centered design processes and information architecture principles is a must.

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential.

Ralph Gloria

National Talent Advisor

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
Please note: This position can be remote/telecommute. We are currently accepting applications from those located in the Northeast, Midwest, and South.

If you want...
• To collaborate on design decisions that make life easier for millions of people
• A great team environment where UX is a valued part of software development
• A place where you can gather user insights for designs with real impact

We should talk.

At PrismHR, our close-knit UX team works closely with Product Managers and Developers to solve tricky design problems to create and simplify amazing experiences in the Human Resources space.

We like:
• Attention to detail
• Always-learning, always-growing attitudes
• Passion for making things better for customers
• People who aren’t afraid of complexity

At PrismHR, you’ll work on our newest user experiences for the Human Resources space, helping transform the way small businesses and millions of employees interact with Benefits, Payroll and Administrative functions. Our team is growing quickly and we are looking for creative self-starters to join us! And bring your dog if you’re local…we’re dog-friendly.

SPECIFIC DUTIES and RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Be the voice of the user throughout the discovery and development life cycle
• Lead cross-functional teams in collaborative design sessions
• Collaborate with Product Managers to identify, capture and refine user workflows
• Collaborate with development teams to ensure design integrity and functionality is as scoped
• Translate concepts into wireframes and clickable prototypes
• Validate designs with users as part of an iterative design process
• Identify design problems and usability issues and propose elegant solutions
• Enforce user-centered design best practices while expanding standards

REQUIRED SKILLS and EXPERIENCE:
• Bachelor’s degree in Design, Interaction, Communication Design or relevant discipline
• 5 or more years of professional work experience
• Direct experience designing B2B SaaS applications (Enterprise class software platforms)
• Exceptional design and analytical skills
• Fluency with design and prototyping tools such as Sketch, InVision, Figma, Axure
• Ability to give and receive feedback in a collaborative environment
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• Online portfolio demonstrating research, analysis and design skills

DESIRED SKILLS and EXPERIENCE:
• Advanced degree or training in Human Factors or Human Computer Interaction
• Demonstrated desire and curiously for continuous learning in the Product Design craft
• Familiarity with Lean UX in an Agile environment
• Familiarity with frameworks such as React, Bootstrap and Angular
• Experience facilitating Usability Tests
• Experience with HR, Benefits, Payroll, Finance or other Human Capital Management systems

#LI-REMOTE

PrismHR is a fast-paced SaaS company which provides customers with a cloud-based payroll process software application. PrismHR also provides professional services including system implementation consulting, custom configurations, and training. Lastly, via the Company’s Marketplace platform customers and end users access other human resources and employee benefits applications from PrismHR’s Marketplace Partners.

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion Program/Affirmative Action Plan:
We have transformed our company into an inclusive environment where individuals are valued for their talents and empowered to reach their fullest potential. At PrismHR, we strive to continually lead with our values and beliefs that enable our employees to develop their potential, bring their full self to work, and engage in a world of inclusion.

Ensuring an inclusive environment for our employees is an integral part of the PrismHR culture. We aren't just checking a box, we are truly committed to creating a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our employees and fosters a sense of belonging for everyone. This is essential to our success. We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about our roles but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for these open roles or other open roles. We particularly encourage applicants from traditionally under-represented groups as we seek to increase the diversity of our workforce and provide fair opportunities for all.

As a proud Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, PrismHR encourages talent from all backgrounds to join our team. Employment decisions are based on an individual’s qualifications as they relate to the job under consideration. The Company’s policy prohibits unlawful discrimination based on sex (which includes pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions, the actual sex of the individual, or the gender identity or gender expression), race, color, religion, including religious dress practices and religious grooming practices, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, familial status, age, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, protected veteran or military status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state or local laws, ordinances, or regulations.

The Company is committed to complying with all applicable laws providing equal employment opportunities. This commitment applies to all persons involved in the operations of the Company and prohibits unlawful discrimination by any employee of the Company, including supervisors and co-workers.

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
60264BRAuto req ID:60264BRJob Code:I1658P IT User Experience Prof IV Location:USA - MA - Boston Business Title:Senior UI/UX DesignerSub-Unit:------------ Salary Grade (https://hr.harvard.edu/salary-ranges#ranges) :058Time Status:Full-time Union:00 - Non Union, Exempt or Temporary Additional Qualifications and Skills:

+ + Minimum of 3 years of UI/UX design work including user studies, user... interface design, and evaluation

+ Master’s degree in a relevant field preferred but not required

+ Comprehensive knowledge of and hands-on experience with user interface and user experience research and design techniques

+ Expert knowledge of Figma or state-of-the-art user interface design tools

+ Strong graphic design skills and experience in creating visual identities

+ Hands-on experience with GitHub or other collaborative version control systems

+ Working knowledge of the web application development life cycle

+ Experience with IRB protocols for human subjects research

+ Understanding of basics of molecular biology and biomedical research is helpful but not required

+ Motivation for mentoring junior team members, interns, and trainees and collaborating with peers across multiple sites

Additional Information:This is a one-year term position with strong potential for renewal.

This position is based in Boston, but the work may be done fully or primarily remote. Any remote work must be performed in a state in which Harvard is registered to do business (CA*, CT, GA, IL, MA, MD, ME, NH, NJ, NY, RI, VA, VT, and WA). Individual flexible and remote work options for this role will be discussed during the interview process. *Note: Harvard employees working in California must be exempt.

The University requires all Harvard community members to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and remain up to date with COVID-19 vaccine boosters, as detailed in Harvard’s Vaccine & Booster Requirements (https://www.harvard.edu/coronavirus/covid-19-vaccine-information/) . Individuals may claim exemption from the vaccine requirement for medical or religious reasons. More information regarding the University’s COVID vaccination requirement, exemptions, and verification of vaccination status may be found at the University’s “COVID-19 Vaccine Information” webpage: http://www.harvard.edu/coronavirus/covid-19-vaccine-information/.

Please note that we are currently conducting a majority of interviews and onboarding remotely and virtually. We appreciate your understanding.

Harvard University offers an outstanding benefits package including:

+ Time Off: 3 - 4 weeks paid vacation, paid holiday break, 12 paid sick days, 12.5 paid holidays, and 3 paid personal days per year.

+ Medical/Dental/Vision: We offer a variety of excellent medical plans, dental & vision plans, all coverage begins as of your start date.

+ Retirement: University-funded retirement plan with full vesting after 3 years of service.

+ Tuition Assistance Program: Competitive tuition assistance program, incredibly affordable classes directly at the Harvard Extension School, and discounted options through participating Harvard grad schools.

+ Transportation: Harvard offers a 50% discounted MBTA pass as well as additional options to assist employees in their daily commute.

+ Wellness options: Harvard offers programs and classes at little or no cost, including stress management, massages, nutrition, meditation, and complementary health services.

+ Harvard access to athletic facilities, libraries, campus events, and many discounts throughout metro Boston.

The Harvard Medical School is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position.

Department:Biomedical Informatics (DBMI)Pre-Employment Screening:Identity Schedule:Fulltime | Monday - FridayJob Function:Information Technology School/Unit:Harvard Medical School EEO Statement:We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions, or any other characteristic protected by law.Basic Qualifications:

+ Minimum of 5 years’ post-secondary education or relevant work experience

Position Description:

Join our team of researchers, engineers, and designers to shape the future of biomedical research!

The Gehlenborg Lab in the Department of Biomedical Informatics at Harvard Medical School is funded to develop data visualization tools and user interfaces for multiple national and international cell atlas projects such as the Human BioMolecular Atlas Program (HuBMAP), the Cellular Senescence Network (SenNet), the Human Tumor Atlas Network (HTAN), the Kidney Precision Medicine Network (KPMP), and the Human Cell Atlas (HCA).

The ultimate goal of these efforts is to create maps of the human body at single-cell resolution with the help of cutting edge technologies that generate large and complex sequencing and imaging data sets. The maps will shape our understanding of processes like aging and usher in a new era of treatments for common human diseases.

Your responsibility will be to ensure that the user experience and user interfaces for our tools meet the needs of a broad community of scientists, clinicians, and other stakeholders. You will accomplish this by applying state-of-the-art user research techniques to elicit personas, use cases, and evaluation criteria. You will create wireframes and high fidelity user interface mockups. You will partner with the software developers and researchers on our team as well as national and international collaborators to accomplish our goals. You will also coordinate and oversee the day-to-day work of other UI/UX designers on the team and develop processes and documentation for UI/UX design work in the Gehlenborg Lab.

We value diversity, creativity, and initiative in a highly collaborative and interdisciplinary work environment. The Gehlenborg Lab has an international reputation for creating high impact data visualization tools and we are driven to solve the most challenging design and engineering problems in biomedical data science. We would love to have you on our team!

Work Environment:

The Gehlenborg Lab is using a hybrid workplace model and this position can be fully remote, hybrid, or in-person. All remote work must be performed within a state in which Harvard is registered to do business (CA*, CT, GA, IL, MA, MD, ME, NH, NJ, NY, RI, VA, VT, and WA). Occasional domestic or international travel to attend meetings will be required.

Typical Core Duties:

+ Function as subject matter expert to frame, scope, and lead multiple interdisciplinary projects using a collaborative approach

+ Document detailed UX specifications

+ Ensure work delivery, including accurate estimation, time management, & communication

+ Manage UI/UX design multiple projects simultaneously in collaboration with developer lead, project lead, and the principal investigator

+ Coordinate and oversee the day-to-day work of other UI/UX designers on the team

+ Represent the university internally and externally

+ Abide by and follow the Harvard University IT technical standards, policies and Code of Conduct

Commitment to Equity, Diversity, Inclusion, and Belonging:We are committed to cultivating an inclusive workplace culture of faculty, staff, and students with diverse backgrounds, styles, abilities, and motivations. We appreciate and leverage the capabilities, insights, and ideas of all individuals. Harvard Medical School Mission and Community Values (https://hms.harvard.edu/about-hms/campus-culture/mission-statement-commu

title: Ui ux designer
description:
UI / UX Designer Job Description

We are looking for a dynamic UI / UX Designer who will be responsible for the user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) design of our various digital assets...

You will ensure that all elements of the online user experience are optimized for improved usability, usefulness, and exceptional visual design.

The successful candidate will show evidence a passion for delivering adaptive and creative solutions to UI / UX design problems by staying up to date with best practices and emerging trends in user experience design and user interface technology.

UI / UX Designer Responsibilities :
• Producing high-quality UX design solutions through wireframes, visual designs, workshops, flow diagrams, storyboards, site maps, and prototypes.
• Skills / knowledge of front-end coding of websites and other digital online platforms.
• Designing UI elements and tools such as navigation menus, CTAs, carousels, search boxes, for our digital assets library.
• Providing advice and guidance on the implementation of UX research methodologies and testing activities to analyse and predict user behaviour.
• Meeting team’s deadlines, organising your time wisely while working in an agile environment and a team of designers, developers, and user strategists.

UI / UX Designer Requirements :
• A Bachelor's degree and a minimum of 1-4 years’ UI / UX design experience for digital products or services
• Working knowledge of the following technologies and software : Figma, InVision, Axure, HTML, CSS, Design Systems, Miro and Adobe Creative Suite.
• A team player but can work independently too.
• Multi-tasking and time-management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks.
• Up-to date portfolio detailing skill sets.

Why Mimecast?

And the Mimecast way is also a hybrid-working way. We empower our people to balance their time between home and the office in a way that works best for them, their team, and our stakeholders.

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
Company Description

At Citrix, Mobility Apps, we build beautifully simple and easy-to-use Cloud-based, cross-platform Web, Mobile and Desktop software products. You probably know us by such industry-defining brand names as GoToMeeting®, GoToMyPC® and ShareFile®, as well as other award winning products and services. Citrix "Software-as-a-Service" (SaaS) applications enable customers around the... world to enjoy highly productive, mobile workstyles.

Our start-up like Grasshopper team enables entrepreneurs to turn their smartphones into professional business lines without hardware. Our brilliantly innovative web and mobile apps help companies stay connected with features like voicemail to email, toll free and local numbers, custom greetings, multiple extensions and call forwarding to any phone anywhere in the world, all through their existing devices.

Job Description

You will be designing for scale and your data-driven decisions will affect millions of mobile users.

In this position, you will:

• Design degree or equivalent
• An online portfolio

Additional Information
• High visibility opportunity within a growing, collaborative environment
• Work on exciting web and mobile products and applications that are constantly evolving
• High emphasis put on the user experience

title: Sr. UI/UX Designer
description:
Abiomed is a pioneer and global leader in healthcare technology and innovation, with a mission of Recovering Hearts & Saving Lives . With corporate headquarters in Danvers, Massachusetts, and offices in Baltimore, MD, Woburn, MA, Aachen & Berlin, Germany and Tokyo, Japan, Abiomed’s 2,000 employees form one of the fastest growing medical device companies in the world. We attract and retain... exceptional talent with our collaborative culture, passion for our work, and a strong commitment to employee professional development.

Patients First | Innovation | Winning Culture | Heart Recovery

Are you curious about the next generation of innovative cardiac support – support that is smarter and more connected to our users? Are you fascinated by communicating advanced hemodynamic information to guide life-saving decisions? Do you want to build the future of the cardiac ICU in pursuit of our mission to “Recover Hearts and Save Lives”? If yes, we are definitely looking for you!

At Abiomed, we’re building the next generation of advanced mechanical circulatory support – devices that are smarter and more connected with the growing healthcare data ecosystem. We believe that best-in-class devices are defined by the user experiences and interfaces that guide patient care. We believe that our UI/UX designers should be grounded by the unmet clinical needs of these patients and have the creative strength to find, build, and deliver solutions that address those needs.

Our team is focused on expanding the portfolio of advanced patient management tools that make our heart pumps a world-leading innovative device. We need UI/UX designers who can translate these tools to our users with focus, passion, and high standards. This makes our UI/UX designer a critical hire to achieve our mission – someone who is not afraid to own critical goals and thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic team environment. If you’re up for this mission and willing to do what it takes to meet those goals, this is the place for you.

Responsibilities
• Develop understanding and empathy for our users on how they value and interact with our products and services
• Collaborate with scientists, engineers, and cross-functional stakeholders to understand unmet clinical needs and provide creative, thoughtful solutions
• Build concise, user-centric visions and journeys that form bridges between unmet needs and technical solutions
• Guide planning, scaling, documenting, and execution of Human Factors and UI/UX design activities in alignment with the regulatory and quality teams
• Own and deliver interactions and designs across multiple platforms (bedside, remote, web, mobile), from wireframes and storyboards to interactive and high-fidelity prototypes
• Integrate user feedback, user research, and product metrics into all designs to create clear, high-impact experiences that are welcoming and intuitive
• Develop strategies for new product submissions in accordance with FDA and other regulatory guidance in collaboration with regulatory team partners
• Contribute to UX vision and strategy, build strong relationships generating buy-in and operationalizing strategy across larger teams and timelines
• Maintain knowledge on current design trends and standards and how they apply to our products and our patients
• Experience the products and user groups first-hand by undertaking shadowing visits in clinics and practices, and through training on the devices

Qualificiations
• Track record of delivering UI/UX solutions for software or hardware products in a fast-paced, collaborative environment
• 5 or more years of progressively complex UI/UX design projects for a medical device, healthcare technology, or related product field
• Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Human Factors, UI/UX Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Human Computer Interaction)
• Mechanical aptitude and an affinity for consistency, color use, and typography
• Understand and distill highly complex technical solutions into clean, focused, and understandable solutions
• Expertise in prototyping-to-test and demonstrating interactions, flows and component functionality
• Experience representing work to a broader product team and other leaders where you clearly and succinctly articulating the goals and concepts
• Able to provide deliverables under tight deadlines and with input from many senior-level stakeholders
• Follows UI/UX methodology leveraging tools like user journey maps, low fidelity prototyping, wireframe design, wireflows, usability studies, and high-fidelity prototypes
• Strong understanding of accessibility requirements and design principles to accommodate such requirements
• Proficiency with UI/UX prototyping design software (Figma or AdobeXD preferred)
• Experience working closely with Human Factors Engineers, Mechanical Engineers, and Industrial Designers
• Exposure to FDA or EU MDR regulatory guidelines in Human Factors engineering
• Travel internationally as well as domestically (~10%)

Candidates are encouraged to include a portfolio with relevant samples of their work with a focus on rich data user interfaces, especially any work related to medical devices.

Abiomed is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce. Abiomed will not discriminate against any worker or job applicant on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or civil partnership status, pregnancy, gender reassignment, non-job related mental or physical disability, genetic information, veteran status, military service, application for military service, or membership in any other category protected under law. Abiomed maintains a drug-free workplace

title: Sr Manager, UI/UX Design
description:
Position:
Sr Manager, UI/UX Design
Job Description...

Arrow Electronics, Inc is a Fortune 104 company that helps the world's best technology companies think Five Years Out and work together to innovate. We are a global provider of technology products, services, and solutions, with 2021 sales of $30 billion. Arrow Electronics is currently seeking a Sr Manager, UI/UX Designer to work in our SiliconExpert subsidiary.

The UX team covers a wide range of disciplines including design, interaction, research, code development and analytics. We're organized across multi-disciplinary teams where designers and developers tightly collaborate. We are looking for someone who has experience in leading a team, as well as being a senior role in the team. The Sr. Manager UI/UX Design Architect will have a proven record of delivering a product project from the design stage all the way to launch. They will be responsible for the design & execution of innovative digital experiences. This role will lead a team of designers to successfully translate concepts into leading-edge interactive experiences.

The Sr Manager, UI/UX Designer ensures the usability, consistency, brand relevance, and functionality of the finished product. We are looking for someone who can reinforce their fantastic UX tastes with data-driven research, a leader of other designers and have an analytical mind for approaching and solving problems logically and thoroughly through design. We need someone who is excited about being a member of the team and contribute to the team's collective growth and success.

The ideal candidate is a master of visual design patterns and ensures the team's deliverables using UX best practices, a team player and collaborator, is excited about being part of a team of learners, constantly contributing to the team's collective growth and success. They will be very strong in visual design, front-end engineering technologies, knowledgeable on the latest trends and innovations in UI/UX, complete understanding of WCAG and 508 accessible compliance, and knowledge of research and analytics tools.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
• Manage and mentor the digital creative team
• Innovate and mentor, as well as an openness to new learning, nurturing ideas and growing new skills in the UX sphere
• Assist in solving all sorts of design challenges with creativity, efficiency and precision
• Full stack design skills (interaction, usability, graphic design, html, CSS, SEO, Analytics, A/B testing, UX Research, etc.)
• Easily Create wireframes and review user journeys
• Create and enhance user personas
• Ensure projects are completed according to established specifications and are properly documented throughout the project life cycle..
• Develop and report on KPIs for tracking digital creative team contribution to revenue and overall company performance
• Lead discussions and reviews of creative digital strategy deliverables with stakeholders
• Proactive thinking and eager to move out of comfort zone in order to develop your career and move the company forward
• Monitor software development projects throughout the entire process.
• Ensure projects are completed on time and within budget.
• Keeps management informed of schedules, priorities, and problems.
• Execute, assess, and troubleshoot software programs and applications.
• Manages day-to-day operational aspects of a project and scope.
• Responsible for driving strategic direction of function in all areas of UX in scope.
• Manage staff to include hiring, performance management, salary administration, career development, motivation, and teambuilding.
• Systems analysis and design to support projects and requests-data analysis, business process analysis, hardware and software analysis.
• Drive strategy, planning and negotiations to serve Stakeholder needs
• Responsible for vendor management including evaluation, negotiation, monitoring performance to service agreements

REQUIRED SKILLS
• Experience in designing supply chain applications and platform highly desirable
• Experience in B2C applications a must have
• Enterprise level platform design experience and able to integrate multiple modules
• Self-starter and team player, with strong technical and personal leadership skills
• Impressive creative portfolio focused on digital media
• Passion for intuitive design and an uncompromising attention for details
• Must be comfortable working on multiple projects across different domains simultaneously
• Strong written and communication skills and enjoy working in a fast-paced environment
• Deep understanding of information architecture and software interaction design principals
• Work closely with Product Owners, Analysts and QA in an Agile environment to ensure quality, security and maintenance of applications, and to ensure code meets development standards and guidelines
• A complete mastery of most Design, prototyping and wireframing tools
• 10+ years of proven track record working in a UI/UX design-focused role
• 10+ years professional experience in software interaction design and implementation
• Is recognized as an expert in own area within the organization
• Requires specialized depth and/or breadth of expertise
• Interprets internal or external business issues and recommends solutions/best practices
• Solves complex problems; takes a broad perspective to identify solutions
• Works independently, with guidance in only the most complex situations
• Identifies applications of functional knowledge and existing methodologies to complex problems
• Leads functional teams or projects and serves as a best practice/quality resource
• Provides leadership to managers, supervisors and/or professional staff
• Develops departmental plans, including business, production and/or organizational priorities
• Controls resources and policy formation in area of responsibility
• Manages large teams of professionals and/or junior managers

PREFERRED SKILLS
• A complete mastery of interaction design and prototyping processes
• A complete mastery of identity and brand development
• Full fluency of the DOM, including HTML, CSS, and JS
• Highly proficient in communicating ideas using whatever tool necessary
• Advanced understanding of user experience research methodologies and principals
• Superior knowledge of Accessible responsive web design and development

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

Directly supervises 4 or more employees. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems.

EDUCATION

Education requirements are a minimum of 16 years of related experience with a 4 year degree; or 12 years and an advanced degree; or equivalent related experience.

About SiliconExpert

Since 2000, SiliconExpert helps you make better data-driven decisions with a human-driven experience. Over 500 electrical, software and data engineers handcraft our component database of more than one billion parts to deliver the most comprehensive and current tools in the industry. Customers globally use our solutions to manage risk, avoid redesigns, and mitigate obsolescence in innovative industries such as consumer electronics, telecommunications, automotive, medical and aerospace. SiliconExpert's customers include: leading commercial and government OEMs, top-tier authorized distributors, contract manufacturers and component suppliers. Whether it's a design engineer or financial expert, supply chain management or procurement manager, SiliconExpert is a complete components data intelligence solution for organizational alignment, efficiency, collaboration, and optimization.

Annual Hiring Range/Hourly Rate:

$139,200.00 - $228,387.50

Actual compensation offer to candidate may vary from posted hiring range based upon geographic location, work experience, education, and/or skill level. The pay ratio between base pay and target incentive (if applicable) will be finalized at offer.

Location:
US-MA-Cambridge, Massachusetts (Main Street)

Remote work employees may be required to be present at the closest designated Arrow office for work-related purposes, at the Company's request and sole discretion.
Time Type:
Full time
Job Category:
Information Technology

EEO Statement:

Arrow is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status. (Arrow EEO/AAP policy)

Arrow requires new employees in the United States to provide proof of full COVID-19 vaccination prior to beginning work, except where prohibited by law. This requirement may not apply to supply-chain service employees assigned to work at a light industrial facility, warehouse, distribution center, or in-plant store, who are instead subject to location-specific safety requirements

title: UI/UX Prototyper (Somerville, MA)
description:
To reinvent an industry, you have to build the best team. Join Formlabs if you want to bring ground-breaking professional 3D printers to the desktop of every designer, engineer, researcher, and artist in the world.

The Formlabs Product Design Team is looking for a UI/UX Prototyper to work on the design and development of user interfaces across our embedded, desktop, and web products. As a member... of the team, you will work across creative and engineering disciplines; develop low and high fidelity prototypes; and contribute to the development of products and user experiences that will impact millions of people.

If you’re excited to ship products that ship products and completely reinvent how we make things, join our Product team as a UI/UX Prototyper.

The Job:
• Design user interfaces and product experiences that exist across hardware, software, and materials.
• Rapidly prototype ideas, interactions, and user experiences that are instrumental in shaping how our products work.
• Work to design, develop, grow and maintain a robust and scalable design system.
• Dive into the needs of a diverse range of users, and turn their requirements into compelling new features.
• Work from low-fidelity wireframes to pixel-perfect, interactive prototypes.

You:
• Create compelling user experiences and designs.
• Prioritizes fast prototyping of user experience above code performance or scalability.
• Have a clear understanding of human-computer interaction principles, how to execute on them, and can communicate your design intentions to collaborators.
• Can show a strong and diverse portfolio of interactive work.
• Experience designing and building user interfaces for desktop, web, mobile or embedded.
• Experience with Figma and Adobe Creative Suite.
• Experience with creative coding frameworks, game engines, and/or web technologies.
• Can take and give constructive criticism, and work in an environment where the best ideas win.
• Have a background in human-computer interaction, design and/or computer science; but we care much more about your experience and enthusiasm than about the particularities of your background.

Bonus Skills:
• Experience with web technologies (e.g. JavaScript, p5.js, HTML, CSS, React, and/or Electron)
• An interest in 3D printing, CAD, computational geometry, and/or related technologies.
• Experience with creative coding frameworks or game engines (e.g. p5.js, Open Frameworks, Processing, or Unity).
• Experience with Qt, QML, or OpenGL.

Our Perks & Benefits:
• Robust equity program to build future wealth through RSUs
• Comprehensive healthcare coverage (Medical, Dental, Vision)
• Low cost fund options in our 401K and access to advisors
• Generous paid Parental Leave (up to 16 weeks)
• Tenure-based paid Sabbatical Leave (up to 6 weeks)
• Flexible Out of Office Plan – Take time when you need it
• Ample on-site parking & pre-tax commuter benefits
• Healthy on-site lunches, snacks, beverages, & treats
• Regular sponsored professional development opportunities
• Many opt-in culture events across our diverse community
• And of course… unlimited 3D prints

title: UI/UX Design Copywriter (C)
company_name: Harvard Partners, LLP, Trusted Advisors to IT
description:
Job DescriptionAs the UI/UX Design Copywriter, you’ll create and align experiences across diverse platforms and devices, applying UX best practices and research findings. This role reports to the head of UX Strategy and Design, syncs regularly with our other Copy Designer and collaborates with product teams, developers and UX designers and researchers.

Responsibilities...
• Craft a variety of content, including microcopy (buttons, error messages, help text, click triggers, success states, empty states, etc.), product copy (instructions, FAQs, tooltips, on-boarding, etc.), in-product marketing (splash screens, modals, etc.), transactional notifications and more.
• Edit content drafted by others, focused on clarity, consistency and voice.
• Check in and collaborate with product teams and UX designers and researchers.
• Capture and prioritize needs as they come in (we’re a Jira team), always looking for ways to improve how we work together.
• Package up and present recent projects and wins in team meetings.
• Identify areas of opportunity, then work with a UX Researcher to test your hypothesis with new copy.
• Possess a keen sense of empathy.
• Creates sharp copy across a variety of digital experiences (web, mobile, email and online banking).
• Comfortable managing and prioritizing many projects/stakeholders at the same time.
• Works well independently as well as in a collaborative environment.
• Flexible and can maintain a high quality of work as project requirements and timelines shift.

Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in English, Journalism, Marketing/Communications, or a related field.
• 5 years of experience with UX writing, content strategy, technical writing or other customer-facing documentation.
• A portfolio of relevant work samples with a UX focus; including problems you helped solve for, your contributions, and impact to the customer.
• Ability to craft impactful communications across a spectrum of styles and genres.
• Solid written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present a strong rationale for design decisions.
• Experience working directly with designers, product managers, researchers, and other subject matter experts.
• Strong track record of iterative design, working closely with customers and peers and developers from inception through implementation.
• Experience with UX writing for complex workflows, software products.
• Experience working with user research and analyzing customer feedback.
• Demonstrated history of understanding customer data (e.g., conducting usability studies, performing user research) and leveraging it for developing precise content.
• Ability to manage multiple projects at once.

About Harvard Partners, LLP, Trusted Advisors to IT:

Harvard Partners is a management consulting firm focused on helping companies more effectively leverage their IT investment. We engage with the C-Suite and Technology Team to help them better understand their IT infrastructure and process in order to align the technology strategy and organization to reach the firm’s strategic business goals.Some of our practices include:• Program/Project Management and "PMO as a Service"​• IT Assessments• Business Continuity/Disaster Recovery• Optimized Infrastructure• Concierge Managed Services• Data Center Strategy, Transformation, and Migration• Cloud Management Programs• Security Assessments and Remediation• Staffing, technical & tacticalWorking with the client’s staff, vendors, and consultants, we deliver supportive and collaborative engagements where direct dialog, simplified reporting, productive meetings, and clear responsibility and accountability encourage active participation resulting in consensus-based business outcomes

title: UI/ UX Engineer Remote / Telecommute Jobs
description:
The Wingbrace Engineering Technologies Department is charged with identifying, developing,

and applying new technologies that can address the Government's most challenging software...

and systems engineering problems.

Here at Wingbrace, we believe every engagement deserves access to innovation and an outcome.

You will thrive here if you are curious, open-minded, flexible, passionate about user experience,

love take ownership, and value collaboration.

The UI / UX Engineer role is a contract position today with the potential for future full-time employment.

The role is mostly remote with potential trips to the office at 55 Old Bedford Rd Lincoln Ma

and /or Hanscom Airforce base

Wingbrace needs someone who wants to have a direct impact on our client quality of experience by making our web applications both useful (UX) and beautiful (UI).

We are looking for individuals who have a passion for UX and UI work, who understand that website functionality is only the beginning of great websites.

Skills/Education/Certification

Minimum of 5 years with a degree or 7 years of experience without a degree.

Required:

Must be a US citizen capable of obtaining and maintaining a US DoD clearance within first year of employment.

UX research

This includes identifying target users, creating user personas, and gathering data to make informed design decisions.

User Testing

This involves creating wireframes, low and high-fidelity prototypes, user flows and site mockups to test on your users, with conducting card sorting sessions, performing website heatmaps and carrying out user interviews.

Information Architecture

This specifies organizing information in an understandable manner. Clear organization of developed websites and apps focusing on labeling, navigation, and search functions, making it easy for users to understand where they are, where they need to go, and what is next.

Visual Communication

Because design is highly graphic in nature, UX designers need to be competent in visual language. Proficiency in visual communication includes an understanding of concepts like:

• Layout

• Color

• Fonts/Typography

• Icons

• Images

• Design theory

Implementation

Once the vision of the website content has been accepted, help is needed to translate the awesome ideas into actual HTML and CSS. UX/UI candidates must be able to work with the development team to create the necessary HTML structures and CSS style inputs to realize the vision put forward in the mockups. Ability to work with CSS is a must, with skills in CSS padding, flexbox and grid.

About Wingbrace

Wingbrace is a software and technical services company focused on the delivery of solutions for our clients.   We produce software, develop architectures, code, and operate modeling and simulation systems, and build decision support systems -- rapidly and effectively.

We consider successful outcomes as our metric, and our client engagements benefit from a depth of understanding of organizational, cultural and mission issues, yielding speed and integration of critical capabilities.

Service-disabled veteran owned, our culture is collaboration and performance with a commitment to diversity and the values it conveys.  We actively support a variety of open and secure environments.  We have prime and subcontractor relationships with government and large corporate partners.

We are developers.  Our ethos arises from the discipline of the deliverable and our efficiency from an unburdened approach to using the best tools and products for our client.  Our compass is innovation, leading us to exceptional results delivered for our clients.

Apply at www.wingbrace.com

No recruiters currently please.

Grade level and salary ranges are determined through interviews and a review of education, experience, knowledge, skills, abilities of the applicant, equity with other team members, and alignment with market data. See more information on our benefits.

Wingbrace LLC is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or another protected characteristic.  We value each individual and empower our people to fearlessly drive lasting change.

What we do takes passion and a talented team. Our core values are at the heart of every decision we make, and we understand that our team is the key to our success. For those reasons, we have designed a highly competitive benefits program to support employees and their families. These include:

• Competitive salaries scaled based on experience

• Eighty percent Employer paid health care for individuals and families

• Flexible working hours and generous paid time off

• Flexible work location with remote options for several positions not all.

• 401K employer match

• Contemporary designed office space, with snacks, drinks, coffee, and fun team events

title: UI/UX Co-Op - Spring/Summer 2023
description:
Job Overview

Keurig Dr Pepper is looking for a UX/UI Co-op who wants to contribute to defining the experiences that will form the future of the Keurig brand. This individual will bring curiosity, empathy, creativity and strategic skills to bear in service of solving complex business challenges in accociation with our design staff. In this role, you will work under the supervision of senior... design team members to design experiences that span across physical appliances, digital interfaces, and IoT systems. You will work closely with product management, industrial design, UX research, software engineering, mechanical engineering, consumer insights, and other business stakeholders to deliver outstanding customer experiences.

What you will do:
• Understand target audiences' needs, tasks, and goals and translate them into creative concepts and meaningful interactive experiences across physical appliances, digital interfaces, and IoT systems
• Translate high-level conceptual product ideas into well-designed features
• Work closely with developers and be able to communicate your ideas and designs on a technical level within an agile product development environment
• Participate in immersive user research, concept testing, and usability testing. Develop user personas and scenarios to clarify results of user research and focus the design efforts on the needs of key customers.
• Manage the rapid prototyping of digital projects, rapid experiments & demos
• Enable us for scale & speed by maintaining high design standards and guidelines. Develop and document detailed user experience specifications for highly interactive interfaces

As a co-op/intern at Keurig Dr Pepper, you will:
• Participate in meet & greets and lunch & learns with KDP executives and other organization leaders
• Receive professional development training such as networking, professional skills development and presenting
• Be paired with a mentor to enhance your knowledge of other parts of the business and build your network
• Complete a project from start to finish and present it and your takeaways to your team, department vice president and other KDP stakeholders

Requirements

A little about you:
• A willingness to learn
• Ability to prototype experiences at a variety of fidelities
• Desire to be detail-oriented and strive for pixel-perfection
• Ability to work both independently and within a team
• Strong oral, written, and visual communication skills
• Critical thinking to analyze and interpret data
• Strong, modern portfolio that illustrates your previous work and eye for design

Qualifications
• Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in UX/UI design, industrial design, or other related major
• Experience with multiple design tools (Sketch, Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, etc) nice to have
• Strong communication and collaboration skills
• Work visa sponsorship is not available for this position, including CPT/OPT.

The pay range for this position starts at $23/hour.

This is a hybrid model role based in our Burlington, MA or Chicago, IL office.

We incorporate HireVue, an automated interview tool, into our campus recruitment process. Please visit this link to learn more about HireVue and how to prepare. *We recommend checking with your campus career center for additional preparation resources such as InterviewStream, Big Interview and more.

Company Overview

Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) is a leading coffee and beverage company in North America with dual headquarters in Burlington, MA and Frisco, TX, with annual revenue in excess of $11 billion. KDP holds leadership positions in soft drinks, specialty coffee and tea, water, juice and juice drinks and mixers, and markets the #1 single serve coffee brewing system in the U.S. The Company maintains an unrivaled distribution system that enables its portfolio of more than 125 owned, licensed and partner brands to be available nearly everywhere people shop and consume beverages. With a wide range of hot and cold beverages that meet virtually any consumer need, KDP key brands include Keurig®, Dr Pepper®, Green Mountain Coffee Roasters®, Canada Dry®, Snapple®, Bai®, Mott’s® and The Original Donut Shop®. The Company employs more than 25,000 employees and operates more than 120 offices, manufacturing plants, warehouses and distribution centers across North America.

Keurig Dr Pepper Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and affirmatively seeks diversity in its workforce. Keurig Dr Pepper Inc. recruits qualified applicants and advances in employment its employees without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, disability, genetic information, ethnic or national origin, marital status, veteran status, or any other status protected by law. EOE Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled

You will be hands on in rapidly building new product and a scalable design framework. title: UX/UI Designer
description:
ABOUT US:

Braintrust is the only network that gives in-demand talent all the freedom of freelance with all the benefits, community and stability of a full-time role. As the first decentralized talent network, our revolutionary Web3 model ensures the community that relies on Braintrust to find work are the same people who own and build it through the blockchain token, BTRST. So unlike other... marketplaces that take 20% to 50% of talent earnings, Braintrust allows talent to keep 100% of earnings and to vote on key changes to improve the network. Braintrust is working to change the way freelance works – for good.
• JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)
• LOCATION: Remote - Work from anywhere
• HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $40 – $80/hr
• ESTIMATED DURATION: 35h/week - Long term

THE OPPORTUNITY

WHAT WILL YOU DO?

As a Designer, you will work directly with the founders and core team to help design and improve the next generation user experience for protocols at Community Labs. Your focus will include:
• Help define the product roadmap and develop the user experience
• Develop concepts and move them through ideation, prototype, user testing, and production
• Focus on simple and logical design with the ability to develop and test roadmaps and experiences

WHO ARE OUR CLIENTS LOOKING FOR?
• +2 years of product design experience including experience designing for desktop and mobile with an interest in crypto
• Experience working with engineers and a technical protocol, preferably in blockchain
• Self-motivated, innovative and proactive with experience in UX design and planning, visual design, and written communication
• Ability to take responsibility for projects and the willingness to learn and grow professionally in a team environment, as part of a small core team

NICE TO HAVES?
• Experience in a technology startup that underwent hypergrowth or experience in a new division within an established technology company.
• Personal interest in blockchain technology.

WHAT'S IT LIKE WORKING WITH OUR CLIENT?
• Collaborative, supportive, inclusive, and accessible environment that is open to new initiatives and ideas.
• High-performing and ambitious team seeking to make a lasting impact on the way they democratize the internet.
• Fast-paced, remote-first, and international organization where everyone is inspired by each other and grows together.

Apply Now

ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:

Qualified candidates will be invited to do a screening interview with the Braintrust staff. We will answer your questions about the project, and our platform. If we determine it is the right fit for both parties, well invite you to join the platform and create a profile to apply directly for this project.

C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we'd welcome your application.

Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. title: Sr. UX Designer, Design Systems (REMOTE)
description:
Sr. UX Designer, Design Systems (REMOTE)

Date: Nov 9, 2022...

Location: Remote, US

Company: Under Armour

Under Armour has one mission: to make you better. We have a commitment to innovation that lies at the heart of everything we do, not just for our athletes but also for our teammates. As a global organization, our teams around the world push boundaries and think beyond what is expected. Together our teammates are unified by our values and are grounded in our vision to inspire you with performance solutions you never knew you needed but can’t imagine living without.

Position Summary

We are a highly strategic, data-driven team looking to grow our UX Design sqUAd! Our ideal Sr. UX Designer, Design Systems is obsessed with pixel-perfection and has a deep understanding of scalable, component-based atomic design solutions and UX best practices. This is a critical role that will take designs and equip our team and partners with a toolkit that enables productivity at scale with speed, confidence and precision.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities
• Audit existing design libraries and combine/reinvent with a strategic and scalable approach
• Identify opportunities across our existing digital ecosystems to reduce UX & UI redundancy
• Collaborate with brand partners to create compliant and consistent color, iconography, typography elements and guidelines consistent with global Under Armour brand standards
• Establish naming conventions and organizational frameworks for all levels of atomic design
• Combine fragmented and sometimes disparate design elements into a shared component ecosystem
• Establish necessary frameworks, documentation, workflows and toolkits to activate, maintain and evangelize the importance of system design on behalf of our users and the team
• Work closely with design, engineering and product partners to deliver end-to-end scalable, responsive and cross-platform components and guidelines
• Help steward our commitment to accessibility
• Build and grow a system that enables a cohesive digital experience while elevating the Under Armour brand
• Autonomously define and plan milestones to drive efficiency and productivity across teams
• Compile and present to peers, partners and stakeholders in a clear and actionable way

Qualifications (Knowledge, Skills & Abilities)
• A beautiful portfolio that demonstrates experience templatizing and codifying accessible, pixel-perfect, cross-platform designs at scale
• Must have extensive understanding and hands-on experience with atomic design best practices
• Deep knowledge of native HIG and Material design standards
• Fluency in a variety design crafts (UX, UI, Design Systems, Prototyping)
• Experience designing for and working with CMS software (e.g. CloudCMS, Contentful, AEM, Storybook)
• Expert proficiency in industry standard design tools (e.g. Figma, Sketch, Invision, Adobe Creative Suite, Zeplin)
• Deep understanding of WCAG standards and inclusive design practices
• Strategic design thinking, processes and design system related work experience that influenced business outcomes
• Excellent oral and written communication skills and experience articulating design strategy
• Experience designing components for Desktop, Mobile Web and Native App environments
• Capable of managing multiple priorities simultaneously
• Detail-oriented and data-driven
• Experience partnering with cross-functional disciplines to achieve a common goal
• Continually strive to exceed expectations
• Autonomous self-starter
• Passionate about user-centered design
• Respond professionally to feedback
• Passion for sports and fitness is a bonus!

Education And / Or Experience
• 4+ years of UX design experience with at least 2 of those dedicated to design system work

Other Requirements
• Program Experience: Figma, Sketch, Invision, Adobe Creative Suite, Zeplin)
• Deep understanding of WCAG standards and inclusive design practices

Salary and Relocation
• No Relocation Provided
• Base Compensation Range: $91,000 - $125,000

At Under Armour, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Under Armour believes that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success as a global company, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool.

title: Ux design manager
description:
UX Design Manager

Green Pixel Studios is charged with pushing the envelope on user experience design in digital. This role will help set the stage for the evolution of user experience in financial services...

We’re looking for someone who is passionate about envisioning experiences that push imaginative solutions to enable the bank’s clients to fulfill their financial dreams.

The UX Design Manager will work as part of the User Experience Studio’s extended leadership team within the Enterprise Experience Division to create best in class digital experiences.

The ideal candidate should have design expertise and possess superior UX / UI skills. The position will manage a team of UX designers that contribute to creating and aligning user experience across a variety of platforms and devices for Citizens.

This individual will help solve complex problems to improve the team’s development and will play a strategic role creating the vision, designing, and continuously expanding the Citizens Design System.

Qualifications

Primary responsibilities :

Mentoring, motivating, coaching, and managing user experience design colleagues

Being accountable for the performance, quality control, and the results of a group of UX designers

Assisting an experience journey leader at a full journey or component experience level through supporting growth and development of UX design resources deployed to work in those journey areas.

Helping identify any issues impeding the UX design talent and recommending plans of action to remediate

Ability to coach development and standards across multiple UX designers to support growth in t-shaped UX skills.

Collaborate with internal and external partners to conceptualize ideas and implement compelling customer-focused solutions across all digital touch points

Support resources working with complex problems in product and journey areas.

Ability to build a UX design talent pipeline

Motivate, inspire, and influence others in the organization to engage with design thinking and best UX practices

Ability to conduct UX workshops and design sprints utilizing multiple techniques and influence cross functional colleagues to understand and support superior experience Participates in identifying and defining strategic initiatives to support ux designer development and supporting further ways of working improvement for designs working across distributed agile teams

Qualifications :

Required Skills / Experience :

3+ years in team management

Have at least 8+ years in UX Design

Proven UX / UI experience with a strong portfolio

Proficiency with design in Figma

Ability to present your designs and sell your solutions to various stakeholders

A broad understanding of web / mobile UI standards, usability, and practical experience in design and development of user interfaces for web and mobile applications.

Strong prioritization skills and ability to quickly re-prioritize in a dynamic environment, manage multiple projects at the same level of detail

Knowledge of ADA standards for UI

Bachelor's Degree in design, human-computer interaction (HCI), or equivalent professional experience

Experience with Agile Development strongly preferred

Hours & Work Schedule

Hours per Week : 40

Work Schedule : Mon-Fri, 8 : 30 5 : 00

title: Lead UI/UX Designer
description:
Depict is a startup doing groundbreaking things in the digital art space. We're looking for a Lead Designer to join our growing team. Being able to rethink how we view and interact with art in the digital age is a fascinating challenge, and we need someone who wants to take ownership of the experience that Depict users have when discovering art and interacting with our mobile applications... website and physical product. We have a very collaborative environment and believe that all areas of the company influence one another. We are looking for someone who not only can work closely with our engineering, product, marketing and curatorial teams, but is excited to do so because they want to build the most delightful and inspiring experience for our users.

Functionally, you will be in charge of all of our User Experience and Interface design work - user testing and feedback, creating user journeys, synthesizing collaboration with marking, engineering, product to execute on the experience and interface components of the product vision, and creating assets (or managing a visual designer to do so). There will be an opportunity to build out a full design team as we continue to expand.

We are looking for someone with...
• Proven track record successfully taking a product design from concept to successful execuction with demonstrable results on business goals
• Is experienced at collecting user feedback and sees this as a necessary part of the UI/UX process
• Communicates openly and transparently
• Thrives in a collaborative environment and can work independently to execute
• Wants to own their work product and lead Depict's UI/UX design vision and execution
• Is data-driven and action-oriented (knows how to balance data and intuition in decision-making)
• Meets commitments and self-imposed deadlines (gets it done)
• Is incredibly organized with attention to the smallest details
• Bonus points if you can code (html, css, javascript, jQuery)

More About Depict

Depict is a new medium for visual experiences. The Depict ecosystem delivers incredibly stunning and visceral art experiences by enabling people to access and display an entirely new art medium in their own spaces. The work is exclusive to Depict, curated by our in-house curatorial team and previously unavailable elsewhere.

Depict protects the artwork with technology that enables scarcity and provenance tracking, so it is something customers can invest in and re-sell down the road. To display the work, Depict created its own device, a stunning 50” museum quality ultra-high definition display purpose built for delivering incredible visual experiences in interior spaces.

Why digital art: A convergence of social and technological trends has created ideal conditions for the digital art economy to thrive. In the meantime, the quality of modern 4k displays, and the potential for lightweight, flexible screens means that digital art can look beautiful in homes and businesses everywhere.

Working at Depict

Our team of engineers, entrepreneurs, and art professionals is passionate about using technology to create an art discovery and display experience to delight our users. Our team is creative, ambitious, empathetic, and data-driven embracing a diversity of perspectives and interests. We are backed by partners and investors who share and support our mission, and enable our success. We’re also fun with a collective sense of wry humor. We do team lunches, hack days, retreats, exotic snacks, road trips, and truly epic Cards Against Humanity games (truly).

We'd love to meet you and tell you more!

Depict focuses on Digital Media, Art, Internet of Things, and Connected Devices. Their company has offices in San Francisco and Boston. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees. To date, Depict has raised $4M of funding; their latest round was closed on July 2016.

You can view their website at https://depict.com/ or find them on Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, and Product Hunt

title: Principal UX Designer
description:
Alexander Technology Group is working with a client up on the North Shore. Those strong with mobile application design are encouraged to apply. This is a hybrid role 2 -3 days onsite, rest remote. To be successful in this role, you should have experience with user research, enterprise software design, and prototyping as well as a portfolio of professional design projects that include work with... responsive web UI and mobile business applications. You will lead the creation of functional and appealing features that address our client's needs and help us grow our business through a user-centered approach to product design. The Principal UX Designer works closely with a team including other UX/UI designers, UX researchers, product stakeholders, software engineering, and external teams.
• No third-party candidates will be considered for this role.
• This position requires on site attendance.
• Unfortunately no relocation assistance can be provided for this position

Duties Include, But Are Not Limited To
• Lead designs through the full product design lifecycle on multiple projects and initiatives from early ideation, to detailed execution, through launch
• Facilitate user research, evaluate user feedback, report and document findings for stakeholders, and translate findings into actionable requirements
• Manage a collection of customer insights and gather data to deepen our understanding of user needs, behaviors, and mental models
• Collaborate to define innovation activities for future initiatives and product ideas
• Present design reviews and innovation concepts to cross-functional teams
• Provide guidance and mentorship to other team members in UI and UX design best practices including Jr. team members, Co-Op Students, and interns.
• Collaboration is key… Must be skilled in leading design discussions to foster a collaborative approach to advising stakeholders, requirements collection, solution review, and ongoing feedback.
• Develop, document, and promote design guidelines, best practices, and standards across the product portfolio, working with stakeholders and product teams. Manage design pattern systems.
• Build a deep understanding of business goals to help drive results. Challenge the goals when necessary to align with the user’s needs.
• Perform out-of-the-box design thinking, collaborate with others, and make a difference every day!

Direct Responsibilities
• Gather, inform, and evaluate requirements in collaboration with cross-functional teams
• Demonstrate interaction and design ideas using storyboards, journey maps, and prototypes
• Design graphical user interface elements and build out pages and navigational components
• Develop UI mockups and prototypes that clearly illustrate how products look and behave
• Define complex data visualizations that communicate clearly to end users
• Create original graphic design elements (e.g. images, icons, and other graphics)
• In collaboration with Product Management, prepare and present design solutions to stakeholders
• Identify and troubleshoot UX problems (e.g. responsiveness, findability, configuration tools, etc.)
• Propose opportunities for improvement based on user feedback and research
• Evaluate UX effectiveness of current mobile applications

Essential Knowledge & Skills
• BS in Interaction Design, Human Factors (HCI), Computer Science, or relevant field
• 8+ years of proven experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar role
• Portfolio of design projects highlighting design for mobile applications & enterprise software
• Up-to-date knowledge of design and wireframe tools (e.g. Axure, Figma, Adobe)
• Experience with IoT hardware device usability is a plus
• Engaged team player; strong communication and listening skills to collaborate with various stakeholders including executives, sales and support teams, and end users.
• Ability to work well with ambiguity or when requirements are changing
• Proven experience showing a clear understanding of the intersection between user needs, technology requirements, and business goals
• Artistic eye for design and ability to think creatively while maintaining accuracy and attention to detail
• Strong problem-solving and innovation ability
• Excellent organizational, time, and project management skills
• An understanding of the latest design and technology trends and their role in a commercial environment
• Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process

Compensation: Salary up to $150K +10% Bonus for the right individual
• MONATG*
