title: Senior UX/UI Designer
description:
Paperless Parts provides the manufacturing industry with a SaaS platform that empowers the next generation of manufacturers to join the digital age. When manufacturers use our product, they free up valuable time for faster quoting and estimating, leading to increased profitability and reduced manual steps. From life-saving medical devices to critical components that unlock new depths of outer... space, our customers produce parts that go into some of the world's coolest and most impactful products. It is our mission to enable manufacturers with the technology they need to drive innovation forward.

We are a team of motivated and hardworking creators and doers. If you're looking to have a direct impact on a Series B fast-scaling company that is revolutionizing an essential industry, read on and apply!

Due to the nature of our business and interaction with external clients, Paperless Parts has a COVID-19 vaccination and booster mandate. (Unvaccinated persons may request medical or religious accommodations on a case-by-case basis). This position requires activities that are subject to US Export Control Laws and require US Citizenship or Green Card Holder.

Your purpose:

You will be responsible for designing user interfaces and visuals to enhance the user experience for our SaaS platform. This role will create end-to-end experiences that turn complex problems and workflows into intuitive and elegant interfaces. Ultimately, you will make our product more user-friendly and intuitive for our users.

This role will report to our Director of Design. The job is located in our Boston, MA office on a hybrid work schedule.

Who You Are:

You're an individual with close attention to detail and a strong understanding of the product's user experience. You care about the product's impact on their relationship with use and their own business. You can build toward achieving that vision by using data and interviewing users to inform your work and decisions; collaborating with team members to provide the best user experience fuels you to get to our professional and team goals.

This position requires activities that are subject to US Export Control Laws and require US Citizenship or Green Card Holder.

Responsibilities
• Develop wireframes, interactive prototypes, and high-fidelity interfaces around customer needs
• Work alongside designers, engineers, and product managers to ensure we're solving problems for our users the right way.
• Utilize and contribute to our design system and component library
• Use research and data to inform design decisions
• Partner with Engineering to ensure that our implementation and user experience are high-quality
• As part of the Paperless Parts team, further, the company-wide DEI & social impact initiates

Knowledge, Skill, and Abilities
• 4+ years of experience in an individual contributor role for a digital product or application
• Solid understanding of how to build intuitive, user-first designs
• Experience working with and building on a design/component library
• Experience designing for SaaS or digital products
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills
• A UX/UI Design portfolio is required
• Travel to customers as needed; vaccination and booster required

Paperless Parts Life

Culture: At Paperless Parts, we value intentionality, persistence and relationships. We live and breathe these values every day. As a fast-growing company, we're continually improving what we've built while still building from the ground up.

Boston Office: Our office is full of energy; people regularly collaborate to solve complex problems. We recognize that people work well in different environments and have intentionally designed our office to provide collaborative spaces and quiet focus areas. We operate on a hot desk system which is when employees can grab any available desk on a first-come, first-serve basis. Our height-adjustable desks are set up with additional monitors, and employees are provided with the latest Apple technology to support productivity. Because we value the safety of our team, all employees and guests must be fully vaccinated to enter our office.

Our headquarters is located in the bustling West End neighborhood of Boston, MA, and across the street from Hub Hall at TD Garden and North Station for easy access to most transit routes (Orange/Green Line and Commuter Rail) or a 6-minute walk from the Blue Line. Secure bike storage is available.

Encinitas Office: Our California office is our newest office which seats about 15 hardworking BDRs and Account Executives individuals. The office has an open floor plan with several conference rooms to encourage collaboration with your colleagues in California and TV's to connect with those sitting in Boston or remotely. The office comes stocked with snacks, coffee and regularly catered meals. The office is walking distance from Downtown Encinitas, the Coaster train stop, and tons of restaurants, bars, and activities on the 101.

Benefits: We value you and your family. With this in mind, full-time employees are provided:
• 100% coverage of health, dental, and vision for you and your dependent
• Competitive pay and equity
• Unlimited PTO
• 13+ paid holidays
• Work from home and hybrid flexibility
• Company-sponsored wellness stipend/free gym membership
• Company-sponsored life, disability, and voluntary life insurance
• Pre-tax Commuter and FSA/Dependent Care FSA
• 401(k) plan
• Employee recognition program

Paperless Parts is committed to cultivating an equitable, inclusive, and supportive environment for all employees. We believe this environment creates a safe space for employees to share their experiences, brainstorm ideas, and grow their careers. Paperless Parts is an Equal Opportunity & Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status

title: Hardware UI Designer (Industrial Design)
description:

You will collaborate with teams of designers, engineers and... marketeers to create and deliver innovative, user-centered interfaces that elevate the user experience and drive consumer satisfaction for our products. You will also be responsible for articulating designs to senior management.

Develop physical and digital user interfaces for consumer products from concept to production
Conceptualize and visualize physical and digital design solutions
Generate high quality and suitable materials for presentation
Create prototypes for research and internal review

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
Job Title

Senior UX Designer...
Has working experience and advanced and specialized technical/functional knowledge in own discipline. Understands how own area contributes to the business. Acts as a reference for colleagues with less experience and supports junior team members.

- Influences decisions related to own activity, anticipating dependencies and consequences in complex scenarios, contributes to transversal projects, proposes improvements to processes and is accountable for own and team commitments.

- Works independently within plan dictated by manager, with some guidance on most complex situations.

Specific accountabilities:

Business requirements
- Execute design work consistent with design and brand standards, functional and technical environment, business requirements and customer needs

UX Design
- Study, develop and prototype the user experience concepts of a product in a user- centered design process
- Work closely with User Experience Researchers to make recommendations and propose improvements
- Work closely with development teams to ensure a high quality implementation of design artefacts'
- Work closely with product managers to iteratively specify and refine the scope of a delivery

1st speciality: Information Architecture & Interaction Design
- Study & recommend
- Analyze user business processes and workflows.
- Work with UX Researchers to observe and analyze user studies and to raise design topics that need user research investigation.
- Obtain input from UX Researchers, subject matter experts to determine content and produce a framework for the product design.
- Study data from web analytics, heuristic evaluations, and UX Research results, to make recommendations and propose improvements.
- Create information architecture diagrams, sketches, storyboards, wireframes and screen flows, which support the strategic vision and business objectives.
- Create proofs of concept to explore design ideas, support usability testing and obtain buy-in.
- Deliver appropriate level of specification needed to ensure high quality development on time.
- Participate to workshops with internal and external stakeholders to grasp requirements, present UX concepts and iterate on the solutions.
- Develop prototypes ranging from paper-and-pencil concepts to wireframes or interactive prototypes.
- Work with Web Designers to refine the interactive experience and produce designs consistent with the brand.

2nd speciality: Web Design (or: Visual Design)
- Work closely with all UX design related positions to rely on user-centered design principles to produce high-quality visuals.
- Focus on the aesthetics of a user interface and any related materials by strategically implementing typography, layout, color, graphics, visual effects, imagery, texture, mood, taking into account UX principles, emotional design principles, style guidelines and the technical constraints of development teams.
- Find graphical solutions to express ideas and metaphors and define visual environment of new products.
- Create a consistent look and feel across all products and communicate effectively to present ideas and designs.
- Present the user interface visually so information is easy to read, easy to understand and easy to find.
- Build visual guidelines and design style guide to define UI components and support the graphical consistency of a product or set of products.
- Create prototypes, interactive mock-ups, and proofs of concept to explore design ideas, support usability testing and obtain buy-in, by using interaction design tools as well as front-end development frameworks.
- Work closely with the Information Architects and Interaction Designers to ensure that the mock-ups and prototypes reflect the architecture and interaction principles.

Diversity & Inclusion

Amadeus is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. title: Senior UX Designer
description:
JOB ID:- R0029653

BASIC FUNCTION...

The Senior User Interface Engineer/ Designer is responsible for architecting, in close working relationships with product management, technology, and clinical teams, a phenomenal user experience while delivering features to meet market needs. This role will act as a designer across the Health Language portfolio, creating solution designs and supporting the drafting user stories for agile development teams to bring those designs to fruition. This role will add and iterate on features for end users as well as build internal tooling to help implementation and support teams scale with expanding sales. The Health Language applications are use case specific workflow tools to help expedite the authoring, mapping, design, and review of data. This role will require a designer to be able to dive into product technical details, user journey mapping and flow diagrams to inform product features that can help our provider, vendor, and health plan clients achieve their business and patient outcomes.
• Build in-depth knowledge of the Health Language Data Platform, users, and use cases; understand full user experience of key target personas to inform design decisions.
• Collaborate with Product Management to design product functionality to meet roadmap goals.
• Create user-friendly designs that emphasize translating user processes into straightforward user interfaces and navigation flows.
• Collect user feedback on features and functionality, and work with Product Managers to incorporate feedback into roadmap.
• Create mockups and flow diagrams to effectively communicate design and feature ideas.
• Collaborate with technology and clinical informatics teams to break designs and features into epic and story-level approaches.
• Collaborate with product, technology, client services and clinical resources to build in-depth technical understanding of the product, to inform feature design and story writing.
• Plan, organize, and conduct user research. Present results of research to project teams and management with findings and recommendations.
• Be autonomous. Make decisions, back them up, get them built.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS :

Education: A bachelors of science (BS) or bachelors of arts degree (BA) or equivalent is desired

Experience:
• 5+ years of design experience
• Knowledge of agile software development process and experience with requirements management and complex projects.
• Background and/or education in the healthcare industry with specific knowledge of hospital information technology preferred.

OTHER KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES, OR CERTIFICATIONS:
• Comfortable working on an existing and new products in a fluid environment
• Comfortable working independently and making decisions
• Comfortable both with user interface design, and diving into technical and data details to inform features
• Demonstrated ability to communicate the rationale and thought process behind ideas and solutions and collaborate with people from different disciplines with different needs
• Demonstrated capability for solving problems and generating ideas around sophisticated interactions
• Experienced with methods of UX and design related processes
• Desire to work collaboratively as part of a high performing team with aggressive goals
• Ability to be flexible and adjust quickly to changes in priority or customer needs

EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY Wolters Kluwer U. S. Corporation and all of its subsidiaries, divisions and customer/business units is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status

title: Senior ux designer
description:
Description

Humana is a Fortune 100 healthcare company with a long history of successful innovation and reinvention. For more than 50 years Humana has been a proven leader and innovator in the health and wellness industry...

A passionate emphasis on people, choice, well-being, and innovation guides our business practices and culture. We’re not just a health insurance company, we are increasingly a healthcare company innovating to best serve seniors and low-income individuals through our Medicare and Medicaid businesses.

Those businesses comprise our Retail business segment.

Responsibilities

We are searching for a Senior User Experience Designer with 5+ years of professional experience to join our cross-functional agile product development team.

Our internal stakeholders include insurance product, strategy, customer service, care management, home care, digital health & analytics, and IT.

You will work with a team of UI / UX designers, researchers, full-stack-, data-, and DevOps engineers focused on building high-impact, innovative products aimed at improving the benefit quoting experience for our members and associates.

The team follows human-centered design approach and agile development practices. We are looking for a candidate who understands technology and is familiar with computer programs in the areas of graphic design, information architecture and interaction design.

This job requires familiarity with methodologies of user research and skills in content development .

The Senior UX Designer is a great communicator and patient when working in teams. They are methodical and able to see the big picture.

They can break human behavior patterns into their most logical steps. They are creative professionals but also scientific and organized.

They’re skilled at anticipating next steps and can apply that intuition to this role. The Senior UX Designer pays great attention to detail.

The team is distributed onshore / nearshore and operates remotely working Eastern Standard Time hours.

Responsibilities

Create user interfaces for products using human centered design practices

Follow user research testing results to iterate designs based on consistent feedback from users, subject matter experts, business partners and peers

Design user-friendly experiences across multiple platforms and screen sizes

Ensure consistency with brand guidelines and existing design patterns

Required Qualifications

5+ years of professional user interface design experience and / or Bachelor’s degree in graphic design, experience design, communications design, marketing or equivalent experience

Hands-on experience with modern design and image editing tools (Figma, Sketch, Sympli, Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.)

Understanding of the balance of colors, textures and interactive elements (such as navigational design components) that make a user-friendly experience

A design portfolio demonstrating a strong understanding of human centered design

Portfolio must exhibit a strong understanding of design craft (typography, hierarchy, color, and composition)

Ability to prioritize project requests and meet deadlines

Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment, while keeping track of projects with minimal supervision

Strong initiative, a good sense of humor, and a we’ll figure it out together attitude

Understanding of agile principles and how they can be flexibly applied

Outstanding all-round communication skills and ability to work collaboratively

Preferred Qualifications

Experience with user research and usability testing

Experience working on cross-functional / balanced product development teams

Experience with human-centered design approach

Healthcare business experience

Experience working with remote distributed teams

Scheduled Weekly Hours

Colorado Pay Range

The compensation range represents a good-faith estimate of annualized starting pay at the time of posting based on a full-time 40-hour workweek and may vary based on geographic location and / or employment type.

Individual pay decisions will vary based on demonstrated job-related skills such as education, experience, certifications, etc.

Incentive

This job is eligible for a bonus incentive plan. This incentive opportunity is based upon company and / or individual performance.

Description of Benefits

Humana, Inc. and its affiliated subsidiaries (collectively, Humana ) offers competitive benefits that support whole-person well-being.

Associate benefits are designed to encourage personal wellness and smart healthcare decisions for you and your family while also knowing your life extends outside of work.

Among our benefits, Humana provides medical, dental and vision benefits, 401(k) retirement savings plan, time off (including paid time off, company and personal holidays, volunteer time off, paid parental and caregiver leave), short-term and long-term disability, life insurance and many other opportunities.

title: Lead UI/UX Designer
UI/UX Design Architect
description:
Position:
UI/UX Design Architect
Job Description...

Do you have endless curiosity about how people use technology? We are looking for an enthusiastic User Experience (UX) person to join a team of passionate professionals obsessed with quality, usability, and simplicity. We are expecting intuitive, innovative, and beautiful human experiences led by data-driven processes.

Arrow Electronics, Inc is a Fortune 104 company that helps the world's best technology companies think Five Years Out and work together to innovate. We are a global provider of technology products, services, and solutions, with 2021 sales of $30 billion. Arrow Electronics is currently seeking a UI/UX Design Architect to work in our SiliconExpert subsidiary.

The UX team includes a wide range of disciplines including design, interaction, research, code development and analytics. We're organized across multi-disciplinary teams where designers and developers tightly collaborate in exploring, crafting, and validating the user/customer experience. You'll have regular interactions with stakeholders and be capable of being a UX lead for a project team. You are a proactive thinker and eager to learn new skills to develop your career and increase the value of our products. You are comfortable working in an Agile environment as well as other Methodologies, such as Kanban and FDD.

The ideal candidate follows design patterns and innovates using UX best practices, a team player and collaborator, as well as having an analytical mind for approaching solving UX problems logically. We are looking for someone who is excited about being part of a team of learners, constantly contributing to the team's collective growth and success. They will be strong in visual design, front-end engineering technologies, knowledgeable on the latest trends and innovations in UI/UX, a deep understanding of WCAG and 508 accessible compliance, and has experience with research and analytics tools. You should have a strong technical background in interaction design methodologies and implementations.

Work You'll Do
• Innovate and mentor, as well as an openness to new learning, nurturing ideas and growing new skills in the UX sphere
• Assist in solving all sorts of design challenges with creativity, efficiency and precision
• Full stack design skills (interaction, usability, graphic design, html, CSS, SEO, Analytics, A/B testing, UX Research, etc.)
• Easily Create wireframes and review user journeys
• Create and enhance user personas
• Ensure projects are completed according to established specifications and are properly documented throughout the project life cycle.
• Develop and report on KPIs for tracking digital creative team contribution to revenue and overall company performance
• Lead discussions and reviews of creative digital strategy deliverables with stakeholders
• Proactive thinking and eager to move out of comfort zone in order to develop your career and move the company forward

Required Qualifications
• Experience in designing supply chain applications and platform highly desirable
• Experience in B2C applications a must have
• Self-starter and team player, with strong technical and personal leadership skills
• Must be comfortable working on multiple projects across different domains simultaneously
• Deep understanding of information architecture and software interaction design principles
• 10+ years of proven track record working in a UI/UX design-focused role
• 10+ years professional experience in software interaction design and implementation

As the Lead role of our multi-disciplined UX team, we desire for an applicant to also possess many of these skills.

Desired Qualifications
• A complete mastery of interaction design and prototyping processes
• A complete mastery of identity and brand development
• Deep understanding of limitations and functions of the DOM, including HTML, CSS, and JS
• Highly proficient in communicating ideas using whatever tool necessary
• Advanced understanding of user experience research methodologies and principles
• Superior knowledge of Accessible responsive web design and development

EDUCATION

Typically requires a minimum of 14 years of related experience with a 4 year degree; or 12 years and an advanced degree; or equivalent experience.

About SiliconExpert

Since 2000, SiliconExpert helps you make better data-driven decisions with a human-driven experience. Over 500 electrical, software and data engineers handcraft our component database of more than one billion parts to deliver the most comprehensive and current tools in the industry. Customers globally use our solutions to manage risk, avoid redesigns, and mitigate obsolescence in innovative industries such as consumer electronics, telecommunications, automotive, medical and aerospace. SiliconExpert's customers include: leading commercial and government OEMs, top-tier authorized distributors, contract manufacturers and component suppliers. Whether it's a design engineer or financial expert, supply chain management or procurement manager, SiliconExpert is a complete components data intelligence solution for organizational alignment, efficiency, collaboration, and optimization.

Annual Hiring Range/Hourly Rate:

$117,900.00 - $175,450.00

Actual compensation offer to candidate may vary from posted hiring range based upon geographic location, work experience, education, and/or skill level. The pay ratio between base pay and target incentive (if applicable) will be finalized at offer.

Location:
US-MA-Cambridge, Massachusetts (Main Street)

Remote work employees may be required to be present at the closest designated Arrow office for work-related purposes, at the Company's request and sole discretion.
Time Type:
Full time
Job Category:
Information Technology

EEO Statement:

Arrow is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status. (Arrow EEO/AAP policy)

Arrow COVID-19 Vaccination Policy:

Arrow requires new employees in the United States to provide proof of full COVID-19 vaccination prior to beginning work, except where prohibited by law. This requirement may not apply to supply-chain service employees assigned to work at a light industrial facility, warehouse, distribution center, or in-plant store, who are instead subject to location-specific safety requirements

title: Associate Creative Director UX/UI Designer-Deloitte’s Green Dot Agency
description:
Associate Creative Director UXUI Designer-Deloitte's Green Dot Agency

Are you a forward-thinking User Experience Strategist with 8-10 years of experience under your belt who's passionate about human behavior? Do you geek out on the latest trends and wonder how you might apply them on your next project? Is your approach adaptive, allowing you to think beyond wireframes and workflows to deliver... more holistic user journeys? Do you embrace complex problems and turn them into compelling strategies? Do you have the kind of entrepreneurial, collaborative, and empathetic mindset that fearlessly advocates for the user while remaining a trusted advisor to a multidisciplinary team?

Join Deloitte's Green Dot Agency experience design team to design adaptive digital services and applications that capture the imagination, delivering impressive returns for our firm. As a US Strategist Manager, you'll implement a "design thinking" approach to developing valuable experiences that improve people's lives and client business results. You are an endlessly curious professional, up to date with new trends, technologies and tools to develop the best digital experiences across the widest markets. Your passion for UX drives you to foster design thinking and best practices, stimulating and intriguing people both within and outside the team.

Responsibilities:
• You inspire and lead as a subject matter expert and advocate, while remaining highly collaborative.
• You're passionate about human-centered problem solving and you tirelessly seek to discover what users really need.
• You develop wireframes, user stories and journeys, and prototypes, optimized for devices and contexts.
• You're a curious, passionate, data-driven problem solver.
• You embrace Agile.
• You clearly and convincingly explain your decisions and perspective.
• You understand people, technology and how they interact.
• You are empathetic.
• You've worked as a member of a team of designers, strategists, and developers
• You might even have some knowledge and experience in UI Design, Interaction Design, and Accessibility (although not required, we'd be super impressed)
• You have a portfolio that demonstrates your range of experience and thinking, that showcases your process, deliverables, and roles on projects-from setting strategic direction through tactical implementation.

Qualifications:

Project Management Skills
• Advises and influences stakeholders at all levels of the business to achieve strategic objectives
• Demonstrates strong analytical and problem-solving skills
• Possesses specialized skills or experience relative to operations/process excellence

Leadership Skills
• Proven experience managing and leading cross-functional teams
• Prior experience working on a virtual team within a highly matrixed organization, preferably for a global corporation or professional services firm
• Identifies and/or follows leading practices to assess resources and budget for client projects and initiatives
• Skilled at gaining consensus when differing viewpoints are presented
• Demonstrates leadership, maturity, and accountability through extra-curricular and community activities

Professional Skills
• Demonstrates excellent written and verbal communication skills
• Exhibits a high level of professionalism with a strong executive presence
• Collaborates and builds relationships, both virtually and in-person, with colleagues, stakeholders, and teams across the organization to meet shared objectives
• Skilled at negotiating, with the ability to solve complex problems and demonstrate agility
• Provides strategic and tactical counsel that helps achieve clients' business goals
• Proficient in Microsoft Office
• Capable of navigating and performing research on the Internet

Brand & Communication Skills
• Understands marketing fundamentals with a focus on strategy/trends and execution in the B2B arena
• Leverages design thinking, and other modern problem-solving tools, to develop innovative marketing solutions
• Demonstrates excellent command of editorial standards, along with strong editing and proofreading skills
• Provides creative ideas and input to enhance communication programs
• Supports delivering Deloitte's story to a variety of stakeholders through multiple communication channels and thought leadership initiatives as defined by our corporate communications strategy

Creative And Digital Skills
• Working knowledge of HTML, Web, CMS publishing and/or CSS JavaScript
• UX/UI design experience and familiarity with UXPin
• Skilled in Adobe Creative and Marketing Clouds (i.e. AEM, InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop, Premiere, After Effects, InCopy)
• Brings creative concepts to life through video production and motion design
• Manages print, digital, and video production projects
• Drives the creative process to produce high-quality, original content

Technical Skills
• Leverages technology to support and enhance communication processes
• Uses Workfront to enhance collaboration, manage assets and maintain visibility of project workflows

Others
• 8-10 Years of Experience

Key Responsibilities
• Form a bridge between our UX Designers and business-focused teams to ensure that business goals and user needs always align
• Facilitate cross-team and collaborative workshops to discuss and visualize what those perspectives look like in terms of the users' and business' goals
• Identify and articulate high-impact research questions and opportunities that could help drive strategic design decisions
• Synthesize user research and business data to help shape the product roadmap, designs, and future research activities
• Review user stories to ensure objectives, goals, and requirements are clear and led by user research
• Use storytelling to communicate high-level concepts and research insights in presentations, reports, and workshops
• Evaluate and measure the outcome for design sprints to provide recommendations on how best to improve the overall product design and collaboration between the cross-functional team
• Own sitemaps and navigational models and serve as the user advocate within integrated teams to ensure user experience aligns with a customer-centric approach
• Clearly wireframe experiences to demonstrate how the user and business needs can be met through design
• Create presentation decks for synthesizing insights and summarizing key points that bring a human-centered perspective to the business strategy
• Assist in creating a Business Model Canvas to help the team better understand how the business and product(s) create, deliver, and capture value
• Create Value Proposition Maps that illustrate the values and needs of the product user and business
• Help create and maintain product roadmaps
• Create Stakeholder Maps to better understand the relationships between users and the other people involved in their workflow
• Collaborate as needed with external UX vendors
• Limited immigrations sponsorship may be available
For individuals assigned and/or hired to work in New York City, Jersey City, Colorado, or Nevada, Deloitte is required by law to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. This compensation range is specific to New York City, Jersey City, State of Colorado, and the State of Nevada and takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. At Deloitte, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is $$78570 to $214,740.

You may also be eligible to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program, subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance.

title: UI/UX Designer (or) Web Designer
description:
Company Description

Jobsbridge...

Job Description

Key Accountabilities

• Work in cross-functional team to create and evaluate the project designs

• Provide human factors across the product lifecycle including defining client and user needs, developing user and workplace profiles and usage scenarios, task analysis, requirements specification, generating design concepts, creating prototypes and graphical user interfaces, conducting usability tests, analyzing user errors.

• Use ingenuity and creativity to develop interaction design solutions to complex, system-wide usability problems

• Analyze and optimize developmental prototypes and provide usability assessments

• Plan and conduct end-user evaluations of product concepts, data analyses, document evaluation methods/results, and present design recommendations to the project team

• Work closely with project stakeholders and business analysts to understand complex business problems and to define solutions

• Provide feedback and act as a role model for junior members of the Human Factors Engineering team

• Generates presentation solutions (workflow, information and navigation architecture, layout, taxonomy, wireframing and templates)

• Play an active role in defining enterprise standards for Human Factors

Skills

• Ability to interpret and communicate technical information into business language and vice versa

• Experience with and knowledgeable of a range of a range of Usability Testing methods

• Proficient in web and print design, with specific expertise with web-based applications within Adobe Creative Suite (CS6)

• Experience with methodologies such as Iterative development, Agile, etc.

• Can conceptualize innovative, simple solutions to complex interaction and design problems

• Good interpersonal skills and the ability to collaborate actively and proactively with others in a cross-functional team

• Self-motivated and self-managing

• Detail-oriented, energetic self-starter with strong communication and organizational skills

• Ability to multi-task and work collaboratively as well as independently

Education

Preferred Bachelor's degree in Human Factors, Graphic Design, Mechanical Engineering, Psychology, or related discipline/specialty in Human Factors

Language Skills

• English but additional languages are a plus

Minimum Work Experience

• 4+ years of experience

Qualifications

Iterative development, Agile, Usability Testing methods

Additional Information

Multiple Openings

title: Ui ux designer
description:
ABOUT US :

Braintrust is the only network that gives in-demand talent all the freedom of freelance with all the benefits, community and stability of a full-time role...

As the first decentralized talent network, our revolutionary Web3 model ensures the community that relies on Braintrust to find work are the same people who own and build it through the blockchain token, BTRST.

So unlike other marketplaces that take 20% to 50% of talent earnings, Braintrust allows talent to keep 100% of earnings and to vote on key changes to improve the network.

Braintrust is working to change the way freelance works for good.
• JOB TYPE : Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies / C2C - see notes below)
• LOCATION : Remote - Work from anywhere
• HOURLY RANGE : Our client is looking to pay $40 $80 / hr
• ESTIMATED DURATION : 35h / week - Long term

WHAT WILL YOU DO?

As a Designer, you will work directly with the founders and core team to help design and improve the next generation user experience for protocols at Community Labs. Your focus will include :
• Help define the product roadmap and develop the user experience
• Develop concepts and move them through ideation, prototype, user testing, and production
• Focus on simple and logical design with the ability to develop and test roadmaps and experiences

WHO ARE OUR CLIENTS LOOKING FOR?
• 2 years of product design experience including experience designing for desktop and mobile with an interest in crypto
• Experience working with engineers and a technical protocol, preferably in blockchain
• Ability to take responsibility for projects and the willingness to learn and grow professionally in a team environment, as part of a small core team

NICE TO HAVES?
• Experience in a technology startup that underwent hypergrowth or experience in a new division within an established technology company.
• Personal interest in blockchain technology.

WHAT’S IT LIKE WORKING WITH OUR CLIENT?
• Collaborative, supportive, inclusive, and accessible environment that is open to new initiatives and ideas.
• High-performing and ambitious team seeking to make a lasting impact on the way they democratize the internet.
• Fast-paced, remote-first, and international organization where everyone is inspired by each other and grows together.

Apply Now!

ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS :

Qualified candidates will be invited to do a screening interview with the Braintrust staff. We will answer your questions about the project, and our platform.

If we determine it is the right fit for both parties, we'll invite you to join the platform and create a profile to apply directly for this project.

C2C Candidates : This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC / corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.

Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Manager ui ux design
description:
Position : Sr Manager, UI / UX DesignJob Description : Arrow Electronics, Inc is a Fortune 104 company that helps the world's best technology companies think Five Years Out and work together to innovate.

We are a global provider of technology products, services, and solutions, with 2021 sales of $30 billion. Arrow Electronics is currently seeking a Sr Manager, UI / UX Designer to work in our SiliconExpert subsidiary.

The UX team covers a wide range of disciplines including design, interaction, research, code development and analytics. We're organized across multi-disciplinary teams where designers and developers tightly collaborate.

We are looking for someone who has experience in leading a team, as well as being a senior role in the team. The Sr. Manager UI / UX Design Architect will have a proven record of delivering a product project from the design stage all the way to launch.

They will be responsible for the design & execution of innovative digital experiences. This role will... lead a team of designers to successfully translate concepts into leading-edge interactive experiences.

The Sr Manager, UI / UX Designer ensures the usability, consistency, brand relevance, and functionality of the finished product.

We are looking for someone who can reinforce their fantastic UX tastes with data-driven research, a leader of other designers and have an analytical mind for approaching and solving problems logically and thoroughly through design.

We need someone who is excited about being a member of the team and contribute to the team's collective growth and success.

The ideal candidate is a master of visual design patterns and ensures the team's deliverables using UX best practices, a team player and collaborator, is excited about being part of a team of learners, constantly contributing to the team's collective growth and success.

They will be very strong in visual design, front-end engineering technologies, knowledgeable on the latest trends and innovations in UI / UX, complete understanding of WCAG and 508 accessible compliance, and knowledge of research and analytics tools.

title: Lead UI/UX Designer
description:
Description

Robert Half is working with a client in the Boston, MA area who has an immediate job opening for a Lead User Experience (UX) Designers. This is a long-term contract opportunity. As the Lead User Experience (UX) Designer, you will manage user research, the administering of interviews and surveys of diverse populations, and the translation of results into sitemaps, wireframes, and... design prototypes. You should also be able to create the overall functionality of the product and work tirelessly to make incremental improvements to deliver an exceptional user experience. If you are a creative thinker who enjoys working independently as well as collaborating with colleagues, this job might be right for you.

Major responsibilities
• Lead a team of UI/UX Designers
• Help to define product specifications
• Own the journey of a User by conducting User Experience research
• Perform interviews and document User Personas
• Create story boards and provides barebone mockups to conduct User studies
• Delegate the creation of and present story boards with mockups
• Work with Product and Engineering teams to ensure accessibility and styling standards are met
• Enforce design consistency across the organization
• Teach others the User interface mechanics for a visually interactive experience
• Decide layout, buttons, common componentry, etc.
• Rapidly presents ideas to make educated decisions in leadership discussions
• Own the Global Style Guide to enforce specific pixel perfect componentry
• Mentor a team to solve User Experience problems in creative ways (e.g. usability, findability)
• Analyze and report on competitive products and industry trends
• Assist upper management to plan and organize work for a team of UI/UX Designers
• Occasionally assist in recruiting new UI/UX Designers

Requirements
• 3-5 years of designing user experience interfaces
• B.S. in a Design related major
• Proven experience as a UX Designer, UI Designer or similar role
• Portfolio of design projects
• Background in conducting UX research
• Experience in with working across teams within an organization
• Experience leading review sessions
• Experience owning and enforcing sets of standards
• Ability to assert design quality during design and delivery of software
• Proficient in Figma

Innovation starts with people.®

Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.

Robert Half puts you in the best position to succeed by advocating on your behalf and promoting you to employers. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity – even on the go.

Robert Half will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Benefits are available to temporary professionals. Visit

title: Ui ux designer
description:
Job Description :

We are seeking a Mechanical Designer for a very important client. The UX / UI Designer is responsible for applying user experience and user interface design principles to complex Electro-Mechanical medical device systems Key responsibilities include planning and execution of design activities throughout the product development cycle to ensure that products are safe, effective ... easy to use.

What you’ll do- Create user-centered designs by understanding business requirements, and user feedback- Develop UI mockups and prototypes that clearly illustrate how sites function and look- Conduct testing of sample applications, and software to evaluate user experience and ease of design- Create original graphic designs (e.

g images, sketches and tables)- Prepare and present rough drafts to internal teams and key stakeholders- Identify and troubleshoot UX problems (e.

g responsiveness)- Conduct layout adjustments based on user feedback- Adhere to style standards on fonts, colors, and images- Optimize and improve user experience through design and usability best practices- Work with the cross-functional product team to incorporate a visual or brand identity into the finished product- Communicate design ideas and prototypes to developers and key stakeholders- Incorporate feedback, usage metrics, and usability findings into design in order to enhance user experience Responsible for modeling / designing components for new and existing medical device products (e.

g assemblies / equipment / fixtures / programmers / leads / stents) into detail drawings and documentation using CAD and other tools Model product concepts using current tool, analysis techniques, and technologies through use of parametric CAD software and other mechanisms Perform Mechanical design / redesign of medical device products applying industry standards (e.

g ASME Y14.5M-1994) to detail drawings Create / modify / maintain documentation using CAD tools that are tied to a data management system Provide support for OEM device documentation and Bill of Material structure support Provide support for OEM device documentation Completes document packages by detailing parts and creating BOM and schematics following layouts, sketches and verbal instructions to ensure that all of the needed documentation is available for manufacturing process Reviews and verifies design work of peers to check for compliance with standards and corporate procedures May review engineering order (EO) package by reading information on EOs (e.

g document description) and supplemental information (e.g., preliminary sketch) in order to identify missing information May generate engineering change orders (ECOs) May provide illustrations, animation and web publishing solutions that allow communication of 2D / 3D product information for interactive assembly, maintenance / restoration of documentation, product presentations and Federal and International compliance.

Requirement :

The ideal candidate will possess the following qualifications : Required- A bachelor’s degree in Graphic Design, User Experience Design, Human Factors, Industrial Design, Usability, Engineering or equivalent.
• 5+ years in User Experience (UX) design preferably in a regulated industry (i.e medical, defense, etc.)- Excellent organizational, communication and collaboration skills.
• Ability to travel both domestically and internationally.- MUST HAVE A UI / UX PORTFOLIO ATTACHED (could be link, website, pdf etc but will be Rejected in doesn’t have) This is a position for new design and creation NOT a production level.

Manager said that standouts would have mobile and desktop application designs showing the technical ability as well as the artistry.

Top 3 Skills : Solid understanding of UX / UI design principalsAbility to understand and uptake complicated ideasGood file hygiene as a designer Preferred- Proficient in Sketch and other design tools with a solid understanding of UX and UI design principles.
• Proactive problem solver loves pushing the boundaries of design, while being respective of digital limitations Two-year degree with 8+ years related experience or equivalent combination of education and technical work experience May also require a license or certification in the area of expertise.
• Excellent organizational, communication and collaboration skills.

title: Director of Design (Product/UI/UX/Brand) (Hybrid)
description:
Do well by doing good.

Ready for a challenge...

EnergySage is the leading online marketplace for solar and other clean energy technologies and the most-visited solar energy website in the country: Last year, 10 million people used our content and tools to research and evaluate solar, batteries, community solar and other energy products and services. Our brand is trusted by consumers, thought leaders, and the media. Check out our coverage in the New York Times, the Wall Street Journal, and the Washington Post.

We are a team of passionate, collaborative, authentic individuals who are dedicated to making renewable energy options more accessible and affordable to consumers. Currently we are ~100 employees and growing rapidly.

We are located in Boston Financial District and are working in an Hybrid work set up: 3 days in office, 2 days remote. #hybrid

Read more about our company and our team: energysage.com/about-us/company.

Design at EnergySage

We have grown by focusing on the needs of the customer - their problems, motivations, and limitations, and we relentlessly champion for them. We’re heavier on the consumer side than on the B2B side of our marketplace. We have one of the most well-recognized and trusted brands for solar shopping in the US. Our team needs your help to build on this momentum in our solar and upcoming net new solar-adjacent marketplaces.

Our design team currently consists of high performing individuals in UX Design and Visual Design that are steeped in the best practices in the industry. The team is highly engaged in the work we do and cares deeply about each other and our mission to empower people to make smarter energy decisions through simplicity, transparency, and choice.

The Director of Design role (Product/UI/UX/Brand)

We are looking for a Director of Design to lead the design function within EnergySage - product design, UI/UX and Brand. The Director of Design will play a key role in the development and strategy of our products and brand by working through the full product lifecycle. The role is a huge opportunity to continue to grow and mentor our world-class design team and set the design vision across all our products as we move from a single category to multi category marketplace.

Building upon the design team’s current capabilities, deepen and grow capabilities in Interaction Design, Visual Design and MarCom Design, while further expanding the design function to incorporate the full suite of capabilities across User Research, IA, and Content Design.

What You’ll Do
• Partner with relevant senior leadership team to ensure the seamless translation from marketing and product plans to creative strategy and execution.
• Be a strategist who can take a step back on overarching goals and opportunities, while also acting as a product practitioner who can meticulously work alongside his/her teams with domain knowledge and design prowess.
• Utilize design thinking principles to build engaging customer experiences which solve goals with elegant simplicity.
• Collaborate with product managers, developers, content strategists, and other experience designers to execute design concepts that deliver on customer goals, business goals, and are technically feasible to implement.
• Partner with VP Marketing to drive evolution of brand identity
• Drive a sense of urgency in the team to deliver work, emphasizing the use of lean tools and techniques to more rapidly deliver work.
• Day-to-day work will consist of a combination of product oversight, design execution, people management, and design operations management.
• Maintains best practices for accessible design in our products
• Demonstrate strong management and communication skills.
• Manage the development of team members through dedicated mentorship, or less formal coaching and advice.
• Drive enterprise pattern definition and usage across both the consumer and B2B experience of our marketplace.
• Establish brand/visual design standards and work with VP Channel Partnerships to ensure consistency of brand across external partners.
• Partner with the Chief Product Officer to drive awareness, growth and maturity of the Experience Design function

What We Look For
• 8+ years of Design experience for consumers and consumer brands
• 4+ years of experience leading a team including hiring and performance coaching; you love to help others grow!
• Experience with B2C / eCommerce / Comparative Shopping / Marketplaces
• Experience leading and managing operations of a design team (e.g. critiques, team processes, capacity planning, etc.)
• Exceptional interpersonal, collaborative, and creative problem-solving skills. You are focused on getting to the best solution rather than your solution.
• Strong understanding of design processes; knowledge of what is possible and what will be hard to achieve and/or implement in a digital environment.
• Strong skills in modern design tools like Figma
• You understand that design is a problem-solving tool and enabler of customer and business success.
• A strong focus on the customer and a passion for user research
• Web development skills (HTML/CSS/JS) and hands-on skills are a plus

We are EnergySage.

As the leading online comparison-shopping marketplace for rooftop solar, energy storage, community solar, and financing, EnergySage is accelerating the adoption of clean energy by improving consumer access and affordability. Our user-friendly platform is built on the principle of consumer empowerment through unbiased information, transparency, and choice. As we grow and enter new markets, we seek team members who bring new perspectives, skills, and energy that will propel us to accomplish the challenging work we have ahead.

Confidence can sometimes hold us back from applying for a job - but we believe there's no such thing as a 'perfect' candidate. So, however you identify and whatever background you bring, please apply if this is a role that would make you excited to come into work every day and help bring renewable energy to the broader market.

EnergySage is committed to building a workplace that welcomes and encourages diverse perspectives. We believe that the most successful teams actively and authentically engage individuals with varied experiences and skillsets.

EnergySage is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. Applicants from a broad range of backgrounds are encouraged to apply.

Our Values
• Consumer First: Our top priority is to serve and empower consumers through transparency, equitable access to information, and personalized interactions.
• Better Together: We recognize that we gain and give more through collaboration, partnership, and diversity of experience and perspective. We respect one another and are inspired by what we learn and achieve together.
• Integrity: We take personal ownership and pride in doing the right thing. Our consistency, competence, and high standards earn the reputation of “trusted advisors” with all of our stakeholders.
• Substantive Impact: We are committed to effecting and sustaining positive environmental, social, and market transformations through creativity, innovation, and persistence.
• Iterative Excellence: Our intellectual curiosity and bias toward action drive us to continuously learn, evaluate, iterate, and improve.

#jobopening, #hiring, #careers, #employment, #EnergySage, #hybrid, #design, #product

title: Lead ui ux designer
description:
UnitedHealthcare is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think.

Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference...

Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)

UX Designer / Reporting Platform Designer will be responsible for adoption of latest cutting-edge methods in the area of Data Presentation.

Position requires one to be Creative Storyteller from Data and Present the story in the simplest and elegant way. Ideal Candidate should be aware of latest adoption of technologies like Gap-minder’, Infographics’ and Dynamic UI’ and should be able to tell which type of Chart represent the data best.

Looking for an accomplished UI / UX (7-12 years) designer with technical and managerial skills to cater to the fast-changing needs of the business across the globe and contribute positively towards organization's corporate vision, mission & goal and hone technical knowledge, experience on continuous basis to take up challenging roles and responsibilities.

The environment is fast paced and innovative. Our team is highly self-directed. We are looking for others to join us who will take ownership of responsibility, work collaboratively and always look for ways to add to the personal and professional growth of the company and their peers.

Role :
• Create and design the UI Interface and lead a team with similar activities
• Provides multiple design narratives and provide advocacy for adoption of a given representation
• Create Understanding of Data Presentation and communicate with the clients and lead the collaborative effort
• Collect timely feedback on the prototype and implement design changes if required
• Create metrics and key driving component to measure success of User experience over the platform
• Should be able to prototype quickly and ensure designs are technically feasible
• Out of box thinker

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to work remotely* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.

Primary Responsibilities :
• Work closely with Design, Art and Programming Leadership
• Lead the UI / UX Department (UI / UX Designers and UI / UX programmers) managing the UI / UX implementation of the ongoing projects
• Maintain ownership of the product vision and roadmap and improving the product development process
• Lead the team in expanding mastery of the business goals of each design request and bringing forth innovative UX / UI proposals
• Demonstrate high quality design practices. This includes participation in all aspects of UI / UX : research, ideation, strategy, interaction design, and visual design
• Building a UX / UI style guide. Setting and maintaining UX / UI design standards
• Updating, maintaining, and developing interface specifications for the needs of the development team
• Empower and mentor designers in the team, fostering a collaborative, productive, and positive environment within a growing team
• Maintain and further build design team workflows that ensure that all designs delivered are in line with style guides and are of high-quality standards
• Ensure that the projects are delivered on a timely manner

Total 7-12 years of experience in UI / UX :
• Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with product managers and engineers
• Illustrate design ideas using storyboards, process flows and sitemaps
• Design graphic user interface elements, like menus, tabs and widgets
• Build page navigation buttons and search fields
• Develop UI mockups and prototypes that clearly illustrate how sites function and look like
• Create original graphic designs (e.g., images, sketches and tables)
• Prepare and present rough drafts to internal teams and key stakeholders
• Identify and troubleshoot UX problems (e.g., responsiveness)
• Conduct layout adjustments based on user feedback
• Adhere to style standards on fonts, colors and images
• Proven work experience as a UI / UX Designer or similar role
• Portfolio of design projects
• Knowledge of wireframe tools (e.g., Wireframe.cc, Figma and InVision, Adobe XD)
• Up-to-date knowledge of design software like Visio, Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop
• Solid ommunication skills to collaborate with various stakeholders
• Good time-management skills

General :
• This is a high visibility role requiring high energy due to the constant interaction with the customers
• Self-driven, ability to work independently and facilitate change
• Ability to work in a fast-paced, technical, cross-functional environment
• Excellent Visual design sense regarding clear and accurate presentation of data
• Ability to work projects from inception to completion
• Excellent critical thinking and design skills
• Ability to maintain understanding of numerous client processes
• Possess excellent time management and prioritization skills in order to meet multiple deadlines; comfortable working in a high-paced / high production area
• Desire and ability to learn new skills, systems and processes
• Anticipate customer needs and proactively develop solutions to meet them

Required Qualifications :
• Bachelor's degree
• 7+ years of experience in UI / UX of reporting / web application
• 6+ years of experience in wireframes designs
• 6+ years of experience in Charting and Data Presentation with any of market tools / reporting application
• Experience in the healthcare / insurance industry as Lead UI / UX Designer
• Experience managing a team of designers, artists and programmers. Ability to communicate with different departments of the company
• Good general knowledge of graphical trends and flows
• Proficient in English, both spoken and written
• Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential job function of this role. Candidates located in states that mandate COVID-19 booster doses must also comply with those state requirements.

UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination, and boosters when applicable, prior to employment to ensure compliance.

Candidates must be able to perform all essential job functions with or without reasonable accommodation

Preferred Qualifcations :
• Experience in healthcare / insurance domain
• Knowledge of Unreal Engine
• Familiarity with Perforce
• An understanding of GSuite
• Excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills
• Ability to work independently with a skill in producing excellent results despite technical limitations and time constraints

To protect the health and safety of our workforce, patients and communities we serve, UnitedHealth Group and its affiliate companies require all employees to disclose COVID-19 vaccination status prior to beginning employment.

In addition, some roles and locations require full COVID-19 vaccination, including boosters, as an essential job function.

Candidates must be able to perform all essential job functions with or without reasonable accommodation. Failure to meet the vaccination requirement may result in rescission of an employment offer or termination of employment

Careers with UnitedHealthcare. Let's talk about opportunity. Start with a Fortune 5 organization that's serving more than 85 million people already and building the industry's singular reputation for bold ideas and impeccable execution.

Now, add your energy, your passion for excellence, your near-obsession with driving change for the better. Get the picture?

UnitedHealthcare is serving employers and individuals, states and communities, military families and veterans where ever they're found across the globe.

We bring them the resources of an industry leader and a commitment to improve their lives that's second to none. This is no small opportunity.

It's where you can do your life's best work.(sm)

Colorado, Connecticut or Nevada Residents Only : The salary range for Colorado residents is $82,100 to $146,900. The salary range for Connecticut / Nevada residents is $90,500 to $161,600.

Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).

No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.

All employees working remotely will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy

Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere : UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

UnitedHealth Group is a drug - free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.

title: Senior UI/UX Product Designer - User Centered Design for...
description:
REMOTE! UI/UX Designer @ growing Healthcare company! #ProductDesign #Figma

This Jobot Job is hosted by: Katherine Opie...
Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button and sending us your resume.
Salary: $110,000 - $140,000 per year

A bit about us:

We are explorers, listeners, creators, and thinkers working together to influence the ways that people care for themselves and one another. We are seeking individuals who are passionate about solving big problems in healthcare with experience in understanding consumers' underlying needs and how to go about addressing them. Above all else, we are human-centered, kind and respectful, and always looking to understand and support our members. Come help us redefine the future of healthcare.

Why join us?

Join an establish UX Team committed to improving healthcare for Seniors!

Working together, we will:
• Have specific opportunities to make healthcare better for our members, transform the future of care today, while working to build and deliver technology.
• Engage in ongoing activities that enable us to learn, practice, and evolve design to integrate it into a more agile and efficient process.
• Collaborate on products and services that change the way our members enroll, seek, and establish care.

Job Details

Key Responsibilities:
The Senior Product Designer is an individual contributor, who works within a cross-functional team to create and drive the delivery of both virtual and in-person experiences that are impactful for our members and measurable for the business.
• Facilitate the design process over the course of a product lifecycle, working effectively as part of a design pair and advocating for the user's perspective.
• Within a design pair, develop the assets necessary for product success, which include, but are not limited to, the following: research discussion guides, screeners, research insights, remote tests, and the resulting research reports.
• Develop the design assets that include, but are not limited to, the following: customer journeys, user flows, sitemaps, research plans, paper prototypes, sketches, wireframes, visual designs, clickthrough prototypes
• Advocate for the user based on user research insights, product ambition, value proposition, and technical feasibility.
• Uncover user needs in order to craft how users will interact with our products / services.
• Be a great storyteller by preparing product demos and engaging stakeholders with design decisions.
• Contribute to the continuous development of the design discipline.

Set yourself apart:
• Ability to support and teach fellow designers through design pairing, design critiques, and general ways of working.
• A strong portfolio demonstrating a full understanding of the end-to-end design process.
• Extensive experience with Figma, Sketch, Adobe Creative Suite. Ability to learn new software quickly a plus.
• Experience with applying user-centered design processes.
• Understanding of areas of specialization within the greater design landscape, including but not limited to Design Research, Visual Design, Service

Design, UI / UX Design, and Product Design; willingness to broaden own skillset into adjacent specializations while refining mastery of primary skillset.
• Ability to create design assets (e.g., customer journeys, flows, prototypes, visual designs, etc.).
• Extensive knowledge of rapid prototyping methods, ranging from paper sketching to digital prototypes.
• HTML / CSS / JS skills are a plus.
• Strong communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.

Your experience:
• 3 - 6 years of relevant industry experience
• Bachelor's design degree or equivalent experience in a related field
• Demonstrated experience working in UX, Visual Design, or IA within multiple cross-discipline teams (both technology and design)

Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button

title: UI/UX Designer with Security Clearance
description:
Overview Draper is an independent, nonprofit research and development company headquartered in Cambridge, MA. The 1,800 employees of Draper tackle important national challenges with a promise of delivering successful and usable solutions. From military defense and space exploration to biomedical engineering, lives often depend on the solutions we provide. Our multidisciplinary teams of engineers... and scientists work in a collaborative environment that inspires the cross-fertilization of ideas necessary for true innovation. For more information about Draper, visit www.draper.com
• Our work is very important to us, but so is our life outside of work. Draper supports many programs to improve work-life balance including workplace flexibility, employee clubs ranging from photography to yoga, health and finance workshops, off site social events and discounts to local museums and cultural activities. If this specific job opportunity and the chance to work at a nationally renowned R&D innovation company appeals to you, apply now www.draper.com/careers
• Equal Employment Opportunity Draper is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. We understand the value of diversity and its impact on a high-performance culture. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or genetic information. Draper is committed to providing access, equal opportunity and reasonable accommodation for individuals with disabilities in employment, its services, programs, and activities. To request reasonable accommodation, please contact
• Responsibilities We work on exciting projects to solve hard problems at the intersection of engineering, design, and high-stakes scenarios such as: big data analytics, decision support tools, team collaboration systems, human-robot interaction, augmented reality, and contextual situation awareness tools in both the commercial and national security arenas. You will apply user-centered research, interaction, and visual design principles to create usable, engaging, modern, and intuitive interfaces for cutting-edge systems sponsored by the US Government, commercial customers, and internal R&D projects. Our users experience difficult challenges such as: high cognitive workload situations, high stakes tactical scenarios, complex data problems (including data visualization and overcoming cognitive bias), safety critical operations, and collaboration across distributed teams. The ideal candidate is an assertive self-starter that can bring user-centered approaches to an engineering environment and engage with colleagues to build ideas into solutions in a team-centered environment. Qualifications
• B.S., Masters, or formal training in Human-Computer Interaction, Human Factors, Design, Computer Science, Product Management, Data Visualization, or similar field
• A portfolio or case study of work showcasing UX, IX, UI, or Data Visualization design and concept validation - please share a link to work samples in your application; Demonstrated capability and attention to detail in design
• Top-notch user research skills: contextual inquiry, knowledge elicitation, any other creative methods for gathering high-quality data from remote or infrequent user interaction
• Good written, visual, and spoken communication skills
• Familiarity with Agile development and Atlassian's agile suite in particular Preferred Qualifications :
• UX Research - Comfort and confidence leading user research sessions, coming prepared with a plan and being resilient to rapid scheduling / focus changes, delivering artifacts that support software development decisions
• IX Design - ability to apply skillset to new subject matter areas and ability to incorporate new knowledge into documented best practices with the intention to improve future work and capture a knowledge base of relevant subject matter areas, building design artifacts as probes for user research questions
• UI Design - Creation of initial sketch concepts / scalable libraries / design toolkits for product lines
• Experience working closely and iteratively with engineering and development teams Security Clearance Requirements
• TS/SCI Clearance

title: Ux copywriter
company_name: Harvard Partners, LLP, Trusted Advisors to IT
description:
As the UI / UX Design Copywriter, you’ll create and align experiences across diverse platforms and devices, applying UX best practices and research findings.

This role reports to the head of UX Strategy and Design, syncs regularly with our other Copy Designer and collaborates with product teams, developers and UX designers and researchers...

Responsibilities :

Craft a variety of content, including microcopy (buttons, error messages, help text, click triggers, success states, empty states, etc.

product copy (instructions, FAQs, tooltips, on-boarding, etc.), in-product marketing (splash screens, modals, etc.), transactional notifications and more.
• Edit content drafted by others, focused on clarity, consistency and voice.
• Check in and collaborate with product teams and UX designers and researchers.
• Capture and prioritize needs as they come in (we’re a Jira team), always looking for ways to improve how we work together.
• Package up and present recent projects and wins in team meetings.
• Identify areas of opportunity, then work with a UX Researcher to test your hypothesis with new copy.
• Possess a keen sense of empathy.
• Creates sharp copy across a variety of digital experiences (web, mobile, email and online banking).
• Comfortable managing and prioritizing many projects / stakeholders at the same time.
• Works well independently as well as in a collaborative environment.

Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in English, Journalism, Marketing / Communications, or a related field.
• 5 years of experience with UX writing, content strategy, technical writing or other customer-facing documentation.
• A portfolio of relevant work samples with a UX focus; including problems you helped solve for, your contributions, and impact to the customer.
• Ability to craft impactful communications across a spectrum of styles and genres.
• Solid written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present a strong rationale for design decisions.
• Experience working directly with designers, product managers, researchers, and other subject matter experts.
• Strong track record of iterative design, working closely with customers and peers and developers from inception through implementation.
• Experience with UX writing for complex workflows, software products.
• Experience working with user research and analyzing customer feedback.
• Demonstrated history of understanding customer data (e.g., conducting usability studies, performing user research) and leveraging it for developing precise content.
• Ability to manage multiple projects at once.

About Harvard Partners, LLP, Trusted Advisors to IT :

Harvard Partners is a management consulting firm focused on helping companies more effectively leverage their IT investment.

We engage with the C-Suite and Technology Team to help them better understand their IT infrastructure and process in order to align the technology strategy and organization to reach the firm’s strategic business goals.

Some of our practices include :
• Program / Project Management and "PMO as a Service"
• IT Assessments
• Business Continuity / Disaster Recovery
• Optimized Infrastructure
• Concierge Managed Services
• Data Center Strategy, Transformation, and Migration
• Cloud Management Programs
• Security Assessments and Remediation
• Staffing, technical & tacticalWorking with the client’s staff, vendors, and consultants, we deliver supportive and collaborative engagements where direct dialog, simplified reporting, productive meetings, and clear responsibility and accountability encourage active participation resulting in consensus-based business outcomes.
