title: Sr Manager, UI/UX Design
description:
Position:

Sr Manager, UI/UX Design...

Job Description:

Arrow Electronics, Inc is a Fortune 104 company that helps the world's best technology companies think Five Years Out and work together to innovate. We are a global provider of technology products, services, and solutions, with 2021 sales of $30 billion. Arrow Electronics is currently seeking a Sr Manager, UI/UX Designer to work in our SiliconExpert subsidiary.

The UX team covers a wide range of disciplines including design, interaction, research, code development and analytics. We're organized across multi-disciplinary teams where designers and developers tightly collaborate. We are looking for someone who has experience in leading a team, as well as being a senior role in the team. The Sr. Manager UI/UX Design Architect will have a proven record of delivering a product project from the design stage all the way to launch. They will be responsible for the design & execution of innovative digital experiences. This role will lead a team of designers to successfully translate concepts into leading-edge interactive experiences.

The Sr Manager, UI/UX Designer ensures the usability, consistency, brand relevance, and functionality of the finished product. We are looking for someone who can reinforce their fantastic UX tastes with data-driven research, a leader of other designers and have an analytical mind for approaching and solving problems logically and thoroughly through design. We need someone who is excited about being a member of the team and contribute to the team's collective growth and success.

The ideal candidate is a master of visual design patterns and ensures the team's deliverables using UX best practices, a team player and collaborator, is excited about being part of a team of learners, constantly contributing to the team's collective growth and success. They will be very strong in visual design, front-end engineering technologies, knowledgeable on the latest trends and innovations in UI/UX, complete understanding of WCAG and 508 accessible compliance, and knowledge of research and analytics tools.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities
• Manage and mentor the digital creative team
• Innovate and mentor, as well as an openness to new learning, nurturing ideas and growing new skills in the UX sphere
• Assist in solving all sorts of design challenges with creativity, efficiency and precision
• Full stack design skills (interaction, usability, graphic design, html, CSS, SEO, Analytics, A/B testing, UX Research, etc.)
• Easily Create wireframes and review user journeys
• Create and enhance user personas
• Ensure projects are completed according to established specifications and are properly documented throughout the project life cycle..
• Develop and report on KPIs for tracking digital creative team contribution to revenue and overall company performance
• Lead discussions and reviews of creative digital strategy deliverables with stakeholders
• Proactive thinking and eager to move out of comfort zone in order to develop your career and move the company forward
• Monitor software development projects throughout the entire process.
• Ensure projects are completed on time and within budget.
• Keeps management informed of schedules, priorities, and problems.
• Execute, assess, and troubleshoot software programs and applications.
• Manages day-to-day operational aspects of a project and scope.
• Responsible for driving strategic direction of function in all areas of UX in scope.
• Manage staff to include hiring, performance management, salary administration, career development, motivation, and teambuilding.
• Systems analysis and design to support projects and requests-data analysis, business process analysis, hardware and software analysis.
• Drive strategy, planning and negotiations to serve Stakeholder needs
• Responsible for vendor management including evaluation, negotiation, monitoring performance to service agreements

Required Skills
• Experience in designing supply chain applications and platform highly desirable
• Experience in B2C applications a must have
• Enterprise level platform design experience and able to integrate multiple modules
• Self-starter and team player, with strong technical and personal leadership skills
• Impressive creative portfolio focused on digital media
• Passion for intuitive design and an uncompromising attention for details
• Must be comfortable working on multiple projects across different domains simultaneously
• Strong written and communication skills and enjoy working in a fast-paced environment
• Deep understanding of information architecture and software interaction design principals
• Work closely with Product Owners, Analysts and QA in an Agile environment to ensure quality, security and maintenance of applications, and to ensure code meets development standards and guidelines
• A complete mastery of most Design, prototyping and wireframing tools
• 10+ years of proven track record working in a UI/UX design-focused role
• 10+ years professional experience in software interaction design and implementation
• Is recognized as an expert in own area within the organization
• Requires specialized depth and/or breadth of expertise
• Interprets internal or external business issues and recommends solutions/best practices
• Solves complex problems; takes a broad perspective to identify solutions
• Works independently, with guidance in only the most complex situations
• Identifies applications of functional knowledge and existing methodologies to complex problems
• Leads functional teams or projects and serves as a best practice/quality resource
• Provides leadership to managers, supervisors and/or professional staff
• Develops departmental plans, including business, production and/or organizational priorities
• Controls resources and policy formation in area of responsibility
• Manages large teams of professionals and/or junior managers

Preferred Skills
• A complete mastery of interaction design and prototyping processes
• A complete mastery of identity and brand development
• Full fluency of the DOM, including HTML, CSS, and JS
• Highly proficient in communicating ideas using whatever tool necessary
• Advanced understanding of user experience research methodologies and principals
• Superior knowledge of Accessible responsive web design and development

Supervisory Responsibilities

Directly supervises 4 or more employees. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems.

EDUCATION

Education requirements are a minimum of 16 years of related experience with a 4 year degree; or 12 years and an advanced degree; or equivalent related experience.

About SiliconExpert

Since 2000, SiliconExpert helps you make better data-driven decisions with a human-driven experience. Over 500 electrical, software and data engineers handcraft our component database of more than one billion parts to deliver the most comprehensive and current tools in the industry. Customers globally use our solutions to manage risk, avoid redesigns, and mitigate obsolescence in innovative industries such as consumer electronics, telecommunications, automotive, medical and aerospace. SiliconExpert's customers include: leading commercial and government OEMs, top-tier authorized distributors, contract manufacturers and component suppliers. Whether it's a design engineer or financial expert, supply chain management or procurement manager, SiliconExpert is a complete components data intelligence solution for organizational alignment, efficiency, collaboration, and optimization.

Annual Hiring Range/Hourly Rate:

$139,200.00 - $228,387.50

Actual compensation offer to candidate may vary from posted hiring range based upon geographic location, work experience, education, and/or skill level. The pay ratio between base pay and target incentive (if applicable) will be finalized at offer.

Location:

US-MA-Cambridge, Massachusetts (Main Street)

Time Type:

Full time

Job Category:

Information Technology

EEO Statement:

Arrow is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status. (Arrow EEO/AAP policy)

Arrow COVID-19 Vaccination Policy:

Arrow requires new employees in the United States to provide proof of full COVID-19 vaccination prior to beginning work, except where prohibited by law. This requirement may not apply to supply-chain service employees assigned to work at a light industrial facility, warehouse, distribution center, or in-plant store, who are instead subject to location-specific safety requirements

title: Head of design
description:
The Head of UI / UX supports our evolving and fast-paced digital marketing program with a focus on understanding and engaging users on our platform and other marketing channels.

They will collaborate with other members of the user experience and digital marketing team to conduct research, design UI elements and support projects to enhance our digital presence through our portal and other digital... properties with the goal of creating engaging experiences for our audience(s).

You will provide insights and strategic recommendations to cross-functional teams on various projects and initiatives. They will have the opportunity to be both creative and analytical as the work will be mix of ideation, design, research, and analysis.

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Responsible for the delivery of our product page experiences to support commercial initiatives
• Conducting user research and analysis including user testing, competitive analysis, secondary research, interviews; delivering research reports, personas, user journeys, user flows, and more
• Identify patterns in user behavior and translating findings into strategic business recommendations
• Practice design thinking and integrate user research and insights into potential and actual design deliverables
• Develop design concepts, wireframes, and prototypes, through facilitation and hands-on work in Figma, Miro board, and / or Adobe Illustrator
• Collaborate within cross-functional teams and with stakeholders across the firm; provide user experience perspective and recommendations on variety of projects and initiatives

YOU'RE GOOD AT
• Design-thinking and problem solving
• Understanding patterns in data and user behavior
• Taking constructive feedback and iterating on designs
• Learning new skills and tools to support evolving work
• Being a self-starter and working independently
• Multi-tasking in a fast-paced environment
• Managing and organizing multiple projects at once
• Being a team player and collaborating effectively with a geographically dispersed team
• Thinking outside the box to come up with fresh points of view

YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)

Education or Certifications
• Bachelors degree required
• Certification in UX preferred

Work Experience
• 4+ years of professional experience; experience in digital marketing, user experience, and design critical; B2B experience a plus
• Prior experience working for a global organization a plus

Design & Technical Skills
• Experience with web analytics tools (Adobe Analytics and Contentsquare a plus)
• Experience designing for UX, UI, and interaction; familiarity with design software such as Adobe Illustrator, Figma, InVision
• Experience with usability testing and interest in user testing
• Experience with digital product development
• Understanding of digital marketing strategies such as content publishing and SEO

Language Skills

Fluent in English (written and verbal) - other language skills would be beneficial

Global Experience

Experience working across cultures and geographies preferred

Key Competencies
• Ability to take initiative and find ways to get things done
• Problem solving, analytical skills and decision making
• Understanding and ability to escalate an issue when resolution cannot be reached

Communication, interpersonal and teaming skills
• Strong verbal and written communication skills; practice with active listening
• Ability to build trust and work collaboratively with stakeholders
• Ability to work well independently as well as part of a team
• High level of initiative, self-motivation, resourcefulness, collaboration, and patience
• Flexible and creative orientation

Work management, organization, and planning
• Excellent organizational and project management skills
• Able to manage work successfully and effectively against deadlines
• Able to take ownership of tasks and projects and drive to completion

Customer and business focus
• Strong customer orientation towards internal customers
• Ability to produce high quality deliverables and understand the importance of details
• Ability to provide quick turnaround and updates for multiple requests, while maintaining strong reputation of high-quality work

YOU'LL WORK WITH

A motivated, innovative, and supportive team dedicated to improving engagement and enhancing user experience across digital channels in collaboration with the teams across Marketing Team including but not limited to web operations, marketing technologies, email, branding, and editorial.

title: Senior ux designer
description:
Come join our growing UX team and apply your experience in designing B2B and consumer product experiences around information services to support NewsBank's exciting current product portfolio and new market initiatives.

Responsibilities...
• Design meaningful product experiences in collaboration with our product development teams, working on multiple products or features concurrently
• Identify and articulate user behaviors and needs, iteratively create rapid prototypes and validate using lean user research techniques
• Own and represent the voice of the user throughout the design process
• Use a variety of methods to communicate design decisions including sketches, personas, information architecture maps, process and interaction flows, user task analysis, wireframes, storyboards, visual design mockups, and low to high fidelity prototypes
• Assist and facilitate various forms of user research to inform design decisions, including usability testing, A / B testing, customer interviews, and surveys
• Contribute to creating and expanding product design systems and pattern libraries
• Present and demo concept designs to executives through collaborative design reviews and contribute in strategic initiatives and planning

Qualifications
• 5+ years of relevant experience as a product designer with a focus on information architecture, UI design and user testing
• Strong presentation skills is a must; equally at ease speaking with development teams or executives when articulating and advocating design concepts and rationale
• Must have an online portfolio that demonstrates skill and experience
• Proven experience working across multi-disciplinary teams via agile / scrum processes
• Expertise in designing for responsive web and mobile apps. With knowledge of capabilities and limitations of front-end technologies
• Experience creating design artifacts such as wireframes, user flows, journey maps, design comps, design specs, and prototypes
• Experience working with researchers / analysts to distill qualitative and quantitative feedback, identifying themes and deriving data-driven design decisions
• Experience collaborating with content strategists and an understanding of voice and tone as a key element of the user experience
• Proven history with Agile methodology and tools
• Proven expertise with Axure, Sketch, Zeplin, Jira and Adobe Suite, with an ability and openness to learn new tools quickly
• Experience assembling interfaces using established design systems and patterns
• A background designing and building solutions for information retrieval systems is a plus
• A solid understanding of user-centered design processes, systems thinking, and interaction design principles

Benefits

Remote work location, comprehensive health insurance, dental, life, short-term and long-term disability insurances, flexible spending accounts, 401k, voluntary supplemental life insurance and paid time off, and many opportunities to learn and grow.

title: Ux designer
description:
Position Summary

ConvergePROSPERITY - BankingSuite UX Designer...

Deloitte’s Product Transformation and BankingSuite

Deloitte recently launched the Converge™ hybrid market offering as part of a $750M investment in product development over the next 5 years, which will blend the agility of a startup and the reach of a leading professional services firm.

Converge is launching a Banking Suite product line to compete in the exciting FinTech ecosystem, which will focus on delivering a world-class customer experience for consumer and small businesses of smaller banks and non-banks.

The Banking Suite platform is a cloud-native stack at every layer and aims to help Banking Suite clients compete with large bank incumbents and FinTechs with the flexibility to deliver innovative marketing, product, and pricing strategies, while enjoying dramatically lower digital bank operating costs.

The Banking Suite team is looking to build a FinTech startup team with a passion for innovation and the experience to launch a high-quality digital banking product.

The Role
• Create innovative and industry leading UX designs for existing and new financial service offerings, collaborate with stakeholders to define the interaction design of products, and visualize new concepts.
• Maintain accountability for key customer experiences inside specific area of our applications, with a focus on the UI / UX and outbound engagement methods.
• Contribute to BankingSuite product marketing, brand definition, and white-label solutions.
• Design apps that B2B clients and end customers engage with more than BankingSuite’s competitors.

Key Responsibilities
• Customers and clients who use BankingSuite apps say "WOW". The digital banking industry recognizes BankingSuite as a leader in CX and UX excellence
• Highly usable and aesthetically pleasing UIs are implemented consistently across all BankingSuite apps, with a primary focus on radically frictionless experiences, cohesion between inbound UI interactions and outbound digital engagement (Email, push, text, etc.

and consistent omni-channel experiences
• Improve prospect conversion, customer adoption, and retention by demonstrating highly usable UI's and measuring results through user interaction analytics
• Create and maintain the information architecture and design / consume the brand art for all UI systems
• Perform user research, prototyping, usability studies, and "voice of customer" approaches for improving and measuring the success of your BankingSuite UI / UX designs
• Responsive design is used effectively to re-use UI assets without sacrificing mobile or desktop web user interaction quality
• Work directly with engineering to deliver the final product, maintain accountability for design execution. Use the product as an end user to build empathy and self-identify improvements.
• Collaborate with other UX designers to leverage standard processes and tools

Required :
• 3+ years’ experience as an expert hands-on UX designer, preferably with mobile and web-based consumer financial products
• Experience with interaction design principles and tools (wireframes, personas, mental models, etc.), both broader BPM skills and specific UI design skills
• Experience with all digital user interaction models, from web to mobile to push notifications to emerging HCI channels such as Alexa
• Strong mix of analytical (interaction and flow design) and artistic (brand and style) design thinking
• Up-to-date knowledge of current digital user interaction best practices
• Expert at properly leveraging responsive, adaptive, and statically designed UI’s effectively
• Strong reference materials with a high-profile design portfolio and leading apps used by consumers
• Solid understanding of usability heuristics
• Must have a firm understanding of different UI constructs such as portal and workflow concepts
• Expert knowledge and efficiency with UI design tools such as Figma, Adobe, or Axure
• Some experience building multi-tenant SaaS platforms and / or large complex systems serving millions of end consumers a plus
• Bachelor’s degree in HCI, Interaction Design, Human Factors, or equivalent experience
• The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets;

experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs.The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled.

At Deloitte, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case.

A reasonable estimate of the current range is $94,000-$171,000.

oYou may also be eligible to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program, subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance.

Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future.

Recruiting tips

From developing a stand out resume to putting your best foot forward in the interview, we want you to feel prepared and confident as you explore opportunities at Deloitte. .

Benefits

At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. .

Our people and culture

Our diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture empowers our people to be who they are, contribute their unique perspectives, and make a difference individually and collectively.

It enables us to leverage different ideas and perspectives, and bring more creativity and innovation to help solve our client most complex challenges.

This makes Deloitte one of the most rewarding places to work. .

Professional development

From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to build new skills, take on leadership opportunities and connect and grow through mentorship.

From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

Deloitte will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local laws. .

title: Senior ux ui designer
description:
Description

At Humana’s Experience Center (XC), we are explorers, listeners, creators, and thinkers working together to influence the ways that people care for themselves and one another...

We are seeking individuals who are passionate about solving big problems in healthcare for seniors, with experience in understanding consumers’ underlying needs and how to go about addressing them.

Above all else, we are human-centered, kind and respectful, and always looking to understand and support our members. Come help us redefine the future of healthcare.

Responsibilities

An XC Product Designer is

Human-centered They put people at the center of everything they do, always seeking to deeply understand and empathize with them in the entire context of their lives.

The designer advocates for the user’s needs with peers, facilitates user research on a regular basis, and continuously delivers based on evidence-backed insights in order to ensure products and services fit the user need.

Strategic - They strive for experiences that are desirable for members, viable for the business, and operationally and technically feasible.

They look to best practices and methods in order to uncover real member needs and to synthesize insights from research and data.

They understand and practice the design processes across the product lifecycle. Additionally, the designer develops a full-stack skillset, ensuring that the visual interaction design complements the user research findings.

Collaborative They are a humble and generous contributor to a cross-functional team. They recognize and respect the deep expertise of others, helping the team move forward.

The designer participates in the team’s rituals, facilitates user research activities, and serves as part of a design pair.

They are a fast learner and are willing to adapt to the product design needs and processes.

A Storyteller They are a communicator and presents research to colleagues and stakeholders. They are able to thoughtfully discuss and justify design decisions, give honest effective feedback to others, and leverage their communication techniques.

Key Responsibilities

The Senior Product Designer is an individual contributor, who works within a cross-functional team to create and drive the delivery of both virtual and in-person experiences that are impactful for our members and measurable for the business.

Facilitate the design process over the course of a product lifecycle, working effectively as part of a design pair and advocating for the user’s perspective.

Within a design pair, develop the assets necessary for product success, which include, but are not limited to, the following : research discussion guides, screeners, research insights, remote tests, and the resulting research reports.

Develop the design assets that include, but are not limited to, the following : customer journeys, user flows, sitemaps, research plans, paper prototypes, sketches, wireframes, visual designs, clickthrough prototypes

Advocate for the user based on user research insights, product ambition, value proposition, and technical feasibility.

Uncover user needs in order to craft how users will interact with our products / services.

Co-create with both XC team members and our internal stakeholders to understand user and business needs, identify design opportunities, and create meaningful experiences.

Be a great storyteller by preparing product demos and engaging stakeholders with design decisions.

Contribute to the continuous development of the design discipline.

Working together, we will :

Have specific opportunities to make healthcare better for our members, transform the future of care today, while working to build and deliver technology.

Engage in ongoing activities that enable us to learn, practice, and evolve design to integrate it into a more agile and efficient process.

Set yourself apart :

Ability to support and teach fellow designers through design pairing, design critiques, and general ways of working.

A strong portfolio demonstrating a full understanding of the end-to-end design process.

Extensive experience with Figma, Sketch, Adobe Creative Suite. Ability to learn new software quickly a plus.

Experience with applying user-centered design processes.

Understanding of areas of specialization within the greater design landscape, including but not limited to Design Research, Visual Design, Service Design, UI / UX Design, and Product Design;

willingness to broaden own skillset into adjacent specializations while refining mastery of primary skillset.

Ability to create design assets (e.g., customer journeys, flows, prototypes, visual designs, etc.).

Extensive knowledge of rapid prototyping methods, ranging from paper sketching to digital prototypes.

HTML / CSS / JS skills are a plus.

Strong communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.

Your experience :

3 6 years of relevant industry experience

Bachelor’s design degree or equivalent experience in a related field

Demonstrated experience working in UX, Visual Design, or IA within multiple cross-discipline teams (both technology and design)

Additional Information

Work-At-Home Requirements

Scheduled Weekly Hours

title: Interface experience
description:
By clicking the Apply button, I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that the information I provide in my application will be processed in line with Takedas Privacy Notice and Terms of Use .

I further attest that all information I submit in my employment application is true to the best of my knowledge...

Job Description

At Takeda, we are a forward-looking, world-class R&D organization that unlocks innovation and delivers transformative therapies to patients.

Join Takeda as a User Experience and User Interface (UX / UI) Design where you will support the user-centered design of medical devices and combination products.

You will also harness user needs, product requirements, and usability evaluation as inputs into the design and development of the product user interface, such as hardware, software, and instructional materials to support the safe and effective use of the product for the intended use by the intended users in the anticipated use environment.

You will manage UX Research planning and execution, UX / UI design conceptualization, prototyping, testing, and evaluation.

As part of the UI / UX, you will report to Associate Director, User Experience and User Interface (UI / UX) Design Lead.

How you will contribute :

Design User Interfaces for print and digital platforms.

Develop research strategy.

Conduct user experience research.

Visualize data from research.

Mapping user experience.

Translating user needs into user experience and interface requirements.

Visualize design ideas through sketches and digital renderings.

Evaluate user interface concepts iteratively.

Build low and high-fidelity wireframes and prototypes.

Create medical illustrations and animations.

Contribute to a design system and guidelines.

Provide empirical UX design insights for product development.

Collaborate cross-functionally with engineering, packaging, labeling, quality, clinical & medical affairs, regulatory affairs, commercial, legal, and purchasing.

Minimum Requirements / Qualifications :

B.S. in UX Design / Industrial Design / Information Design / Human Factors Engineering, and a minimum of 4 years of UX / UI Design experience or

M.S. in UX Design / Industrial Design / Information Design / Human Factors Engineering, and a minimum of 2 years of UX / UI Design experience.

A UX / UI Design portfolio is required.

Experience working on MS Windows with Adobe CC Suite is required.

Experience working with Figma and Axure is preferred.

Experience working in safety-regulated environments such as Healthcare technology is preferred.

This position may require up to 15% yearly travel, including domestic and international.

What Takeda can offer you :

Comprehensive Healthcare : Medical, Dental, and Vision

Financial Planning & Stability : 401(k) with company match and Annual Retirement Contribution Plan

Health & Wellness programs including onsite flu shots and health screenings

Generous time off for vacation and the option to purchase additional vacation days

Community Outreach Programs and company match of charitable contributions

Family Planning Support

Flexible Work Paths

Tuition reimbursement

More about us :

At Takeda, we are transforming patient care through the development of novel specialty pharmaceuticals and best in class patient support programs.

Takeda is a patient-focused company that will inspire and empower you to grow through life-changing work.

Certified as a Global Top Employer, Takeda offers stimulating careers, encourages innovation, and strives for excellence in everything we do.

We foster an inclusive, collaborative workplace, in which our teams are united by an unwavering commitment to deliver Better Health and a Brighter Future to people around the world.

Base Salary Range : $79,800 to $114,000, based on candidate professional experience level. Employees may also be eligible for Short Term and Long-Term Incentive benefits as well.

Employees are eligible to participate in Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, 401(k), Charitable Contribution Match, Holidays, Personal Days & Vacation, Tuition Reimbursement Program and Paid Volunteer Time Off.

In accordance with the CO Equal Pay Act, Colorado Applicants Are Not Permitted to Apply.

EEO Statement

Takeda is proud in its commitment to creating a diverse workforce and providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, parental status, national origin, age, disability, citizenship status, genetic information or characteristics, marital status, status as a Vietnam era veteran, special disabled veteran, or other protected veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws, and any other characteristic protected by law.

Full time
